original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gzugs kyi phung po'i skye ba bsam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gzugs kyi phung po'i skye ba bsam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is how the arising of the form aggregate should be understood.

original: de la yul gnon cing yul gang du de las gzhan pa dag kyang gnas par 'gyur bar gzugs kyi phung po skyes pa'i sngon du 'gro ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la yul gnon cing yul gang du de las gzhan pa dag kyang gnas par 'gyur bar gzugs kyi phung po skyes pa'i sngon du 'gro ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the form aggregate that precedes the arising of the other aggregates, and that occupies a place in the world?

original: smras pa / 'byung ba chen po dag sngon du 'gro zhing de dag nyid yul gnon pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / 'byung ba chen po dag sngon du 'gro zhing de dag nyid yul gnon pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the great elements precede and occupy a place in the world.

original: de las gzhan pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs de ni 'byung ba de la brten nas yul der gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs de ni 'byung ba de la brten nas yul der gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The other form that is derived from the elements is based on the elements and occupies a place in the world.

original: de la 'byung ba rnams kho na yul de la sgrib pa'i don gyis nye bar gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la 'byung ba rnams kho na yul de la sgrib pa'i don gyis nye bar gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: The elements alone occupy a place in the world in the sense that they obstruct other things from occupying that place.

original: de las gzhan pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis khyab pa'i don dang / de'i dbang gis na de yang yul la gnon par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis khyab pa'i don dang / de'i dbang gis na de yang yul la gnon par rig par bya'o //
translated: The other form that is derived from the elements is based on the elements and occupies a place in the world in the sense that it pervades a particular location.

original: sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi po de dag ni go rims bzhin du rags pa nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi po de dag ni go rims bzhin du rags pa nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The four great elements, earth, etc., should be understood in order as grossness itself.

original: de la sa'i khams 'bras bu dang bcas pa ni rten gyi don gyis gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de la sa'i khams 'bras bu dang bcas pa ni rten gyi don gyis gtso bo yin no //
translated: The earth element, together with its result, is the most important in the sense of being the support.

original: chu dang / me dang / rlung rnams kyi las ni rlan pa dang / 'bar ba dang / g-yo bar byed pa yin te ;
analyzed: chu dang / me dang / rlung rnams kyi las ni rlan pa dang / 'bar ba dang / g-yo bar byed pa yin te ;
translated: The functions of water, fire, and wind are to moisten, burn, and move.

original: de dag ni de la brten nas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de la brten nas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: They function in dependence on the earth element.

original: de la sgra ni brjod ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir gzugs 'dus pa las rgyun brtan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sgra ni brjod ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir gzugs 'dus pa las rgyun brtan pa ma yin te /
translated: Sound is not a stable continuum like form, because it is destroyed as soon as it arises.

original: yul de dang phyi rol la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: yul de dang phyi rol la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: It is the object of the external sense domain.

original: de ni de la brten te lan cig byung ba na yul gang du grag pa'i yul de thams cad @53a * //üîΩdu cig car kho nar khyab par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni de la brten te lan cig byung ba na yul gang du grag pa'i yul de thams cad @53a * // du cig car kho nar khyab par 'byung ste /
translated: When it arises once in dependence on that, it pervades the entire object of sound.üîΩIt arises simultaneously everywhere, like the light of a lamp.

original: me'i 'od dang 'dra ba yin gyi ches tshe ba dang che bar 'byung zhing 'gro ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me'i 'od dang 'dra ba yin gyi ches tshe ba dang che bar 'byung zhing 'gro ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not arise as something greater or more distant.

original: de la rlung ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rlung ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of wind:

original: brtan pa dang brtan pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa dang brtan pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: those that are stable and those that are unstable.

original: de la dkyil 'khor na rgyu ba ni brtan pa'o //
analyzed: de la dkyil 'khor na rgyu ba ni brtan pa'o //
translated: Those that move in the circles are stable.

original: nam mkha' la rgyu ba ni brtan pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la rgyu ba ni brtan pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Those that move in space are unstable.

original: rdzas kyi nang na rgyu ba ni rtag tu phan 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzas kyi nang na rgyu ba ni rtag tu phan 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: Those that move in the body are always helpful.

original: 'khrul 'khor ded pa ni brtan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor ded pa ni brtan pa yin no //
translated: Those that move in the machine are stable.

original: de las gzhan pa rnams ni brtan pa ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnams ni brtan pa ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Those that are different from these should be regarded as unstable.

original: de la nam mkha'i khams ni snang ba dang / mun pas bsdus pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la nam mkha'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la nam mkha'i khams ni snang ba dang / mun pas bsdus pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la nam mkha'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: The space element is form derived from the great elements that is included in light and darkness.

original: de yang brtan pa dang brtan pa ma yin pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang brtan pa dang brtan pa ma yin pa yin te /
translated: It is both stable and unstable.

original: sems can gang dag la rtag tu mun pa dang / rtag tu snang ba yod pa de dag na ni brtan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can gang dag la rtag tu mun pa dang / rtag tu snang ba yod pa de dag na ni brtan pa yin no //
translated: It is stable in those sentient beings who always have light and always have darkness.

original: gang dag la de lta ma yin pa de dag na ni brtan pa ma yin pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag la de lta ma yin pa de dag na ni brtan pa ma yin pa yin te /
translated: It is unstable in those who do not always have light and darkness.

original: de yang gzugs 'dus ba la brten pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang gzugs 'dus ba la brten pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and that is to be understood as based on the collection of form.

original: de yang gsal ba ni 'od kyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang gsal ba ni 'od kyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: That is also clear, which is included in light.

original: mi gsal ba ni bu gas bsdus pa yin no //üîΩring po dang thung ngu nyid la sogs pa gang dag dbyibs zhes bya ba de dag kyang ci rdzas su yod pa'am /
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni bu gas bsdus pa yin no // ring po dang thung ngu nyid la sogs pa gang dag dbyibs zhes bya ba de dag kyang ci rdzas su yod pa'am /
translated: It is unclear, which is included in shadow.

original: brtags pa'i yod pa yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: brtags pa'i yod pa yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: As for long and short, etc., which are called ‚Äúshape,‚Äù should they be said to be substantially existent or imputedly existent?

original: smras pa / brtags pa'i yod pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / brtags pa'i yod pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that they are imputedly existent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsags pa las gnas pa ni dbyibs zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig yin pa dang bsags pa tsam dmigs pa dang / mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'i don mi dmigs pa dang / ltos shing ltos na ngo bo nyid 'dres par 'gyur ba dang / de blos phye bas shing rta la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsags pa las gnas pa ni dbyibs zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig yin pa dang bsags pa tsam dmigs pa dang / mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'i don mi dmigs pa dang / ltos shing ltos na ngo bo nyid 'dres par 'gyur ba dang / de blos phye bas shing rta la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the definition of shape is ‚Äúthat which is based on a collection,‚Äù and only a collection is observed, and no object other than the characteristic is observed, and if it were dependent, it would be mixed with its nature, and it is like a chariot, because it is distinguished by the mind.

original: de la chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu la ni kha dog tsam kho na yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu la ni kha dog tsam kho na yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the form belonging to the sense-field of mental objects which is the result of meditative concentration has only color.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de las gzhan pa dri la sogs pa'i skye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dang dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dri la sogs pa'i skye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dang dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no cause for the arising of smell, etc. other than that, and because there is no need for it.

original: de bzhin du nam mkha' la rgyu ba'i rlung la yang dri la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa ni med la /
analyzed: de bzhin du nam mkha' la rgyu ba'i rlung la yang dri la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa ni med la /
translated: In the same way, there is no innate smell, etc. in the wind which moves in space.

original: 'dres pa las ni 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dres pa las ni 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It arises from a mixture.

original: dkyil 'khor las ni phyi rol du byung ba'i snang ba la yang de las gzhan pa'i 'byung ba rnams dang dri la @53b sogs pa ni mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor las ni phyi rol du byung ba'i snang ba la yang de las gzhan pa'i 'byung ba rnams dang dri la @53b sogs pa ni mi dmigs so //
translated: And in the light which arises outside the circle, the other primary elements and smell, etc. are not perceived.

original: chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de yang snyoms par 'jug pa la brten pa kho na yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de yang snyoms par 'jug pa la brten pa kho na yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the form belonging to the sense-field of mental objects which is the result of meditative concentration is only based on meditative concentration.

original: 'byung ba chen po la brten pa ni ma yin te /üîΩde dang rigs mthun pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin las grub pa'i phyir 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa zhes bya'i de la brten te skyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po la brten pa ni ma yin te / de dang rigs mthun pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin las grub pa'i phyir 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa zhes bya'i de la brten te skyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not based on the great elements,

original: gzugs kyi phung po las chos ngu zhig ni bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas par gnas la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po las chos ngu zhig ni bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas par gnas la /
translated: because it is produced from concentration that focuses on a reflection that is similar to the type of form that is its cause. Therefore, it is said to be derived from the great elements, but it is not produced in dependence on them.

original: du zhig ni bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas par gnas la du zhig ni bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med par gnas she na /
analyzed: du zhig ni bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas par gnas la du zhig ni bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med par gnas she na /
translated: How many of the aggregates are demonstrable and impeded, how many are not demonstrable but impeded, and how many are neither demonstrable nor impeded?

original: smras pa / mig gi spyod yul gang yin pa gcig ni rnam pa gnyi ga yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / mig gi spyod yul gang yin pa gcig ni rnam pa gnyi ga yin no //
translated: It was said that one type of form is both demonstrable and impeded.

original: lhag ma rnams ni bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The remaining types of form are not demonstrable but are impeded.

original: chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs ni ma gtogs te de ni bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs ni ma gtogs te de ni bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The form that is included in the sense field of mental objects should be regarded as neither demonstrable nor impeded.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gzugs kyi phung po'i dbyibs bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gzugs kyi phung po'i dbyibs bsam pa yin no //
translated: The form aggregate is the shape of the body, which is the basis of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: de la gang dag gis gzugs kyi phung po 'jug par 'gyur ba'i gzugs kyi phung po'i rgyun du yod ce na /
analyzed: de la gang dag gis gzugs kyi phung po 'jug par 'gyur ba'i gzugs kyi phung po'i rgyun du yod ce na /
translated: What is the continuity of the form aggregate that is the basis of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù?

original: smras pa gsum ste /
analyzed: smras pa gsum ste /
translated: It is said to be threefold:

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / rgyas pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / rgyas pa las byung ba'o //
translated: arisen from the ripening cause, arisen from the cause of natural outflow, and arisen from the cause of enhancement.

original: de la rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Arisen from the ripening cause is of four kinds:

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / rgyas pa'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / 'gyur ba'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / rang bzhin gyi rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / rgyas pa'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / 'gyur ba'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / rang bzhin gyi rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o //
translated: arisen from the cause of natural outflow of the ripening cause, arisen from the cause of enhancement of the ripening cause, arisen from the cause of transformation of the ripening cause, and arisen from the cause of natural outflow of the ripening cause.

original: de la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni dang po dang rgyun las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni dang po dang rgyun las byung ba ste /
translated: Arisen from the cause of natural outflow is the first and the subsequent.

original: 'di lta ste las las skyes pa'i rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i rnam par smin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste las las skyes pa'i rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i rnam par smin pa ste /
translated: For example, the karmic ripening that arises from action and the karmic ripening that arises from karmic ripening.

original: las kyi 'phen pa kho nas de'i rnam par smin pa las dus gzhan na 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi 'phen pa kho nas de'i rnam par smin pa las dus gzhan na 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The latter is the karmic ripening that occurs at another time due to the projection of action alone.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.

original: de la rgyas pa las byung ba ni rnam pa gnyis te yul la khyab pa'i rgyas pa las byung ba dang / mtshan nyid brtas par byed pa'i rgyas pa las byung ba'o //üîΩde la rgyas pa las byung ba dang po ni gzugs can zas dang gnyid dang tshangs @54a * //üîΩpar spyod pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag gis rgyas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la rgyas pa las byung ba ni rnam pa gnyis te yul la khyab pa'i rgyas pa las byung ba dang / mtshan nyid brtas par byed pa'i rgyas pa las byung ba'o // de la rgyas pa las byung ba dang po ni gzugs can zas dang gnyid dang tshangs @54a * // par spyod pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag gis rgyas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.

original: de las gzhan pa'i zas dang / de'i gnas dang / yid la byed pa'i khyad par bsgom pa dang / dus kyis yongs su smin pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i zas dang / de'i gnas dang / yid la byed pa'i khyad par bsgom pa dang / dus kyis yongs su smin pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: The second is the karmic ripening that arises from the development of the faculties.üîΩThe second is the karmic ripening that

original: de la chos gzugs can rnams ni rgyas pa gnyis kyis rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: de la chos gzugs can rnams ni rgyas pa gnyis kyis rgyas par byed do //
translated: Material form is augmented by two kinds of augmentation.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams ni mtshan nyid brtas par byed pa'i rgyas pa 'ba' zhig gis rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams ni mtshan nyid brtas par byed pa'i rgyas pa 'ba' zhig gis rgyas par byed do //
translated: The immaterial is augmented by the augmentation of the increase of characteristics alone.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs ni zas rnam pa bzhi dang / de las gzhan pa rgyas pa'i rgyu thams cad kyis rgyas par byed do ;
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs ni zas rnam pa bzhi dang / de las gzhan pa rgyas pa'i rgyu thams cad kyis rgyas par byed do ;
translated: Material form of the realm of desire is augmented by the four nutriments and by all the causes of augmentation other than that.

original: / gzugs na spyod pa'i gzugs ni kham gyi zas kyis kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: / gzugs na spyod pa'i gzugs ni kham gyi zas kyis kyang ma yin la /
translated: Material form of the realm of finemateriality is not augmented by nutriment.

original: gnyid kyis kyang ma yin /
analyzed: gnyid kyis kyang ma yin /
translated: It is not augmented by sleep.

original: tshangs par spyod pas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pas kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is not augmented by sexual union.

original: dbang po gzugs can rnams kyi rgyun ni gnyis kyis 'jug par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can rnams kyi rgyun ni gnyis kyis 'jug par rig par bya ste /
translated: The continuum of the material faculties is to be understood as being engaged by two.

original: de dag la rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / rgyas pa las byung ba'i rgyun las gzhan pa rgyu mthun pa'i rgyun med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / rgyas pa las byung ba'i rgyun las gzhan pa rgyu mthun pa'i rgyun med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no third continuum, other than the continuum that is the maturation of action and the continuum that is the result of augmentation.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par smin pa'i rgyun la yang 'phel zhing yangs la rgyas shing rgya che ba dmigs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par smin pa'i rgyun la yang 'phel zhing yangs la rgyas shing rgya che ba dmigs pa'i tshe /
translated: When a continuum of evolution is observed to increase, expand, and grow,

original: rnam par smin pas bsdus pa yang ci'i phyir rgyas pa las byung bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pas bsdus pa yang ci'i phyir rgyas pa las byung bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: why is that which is included in evolution not also called ‚Äúarisen from enhancement?‚Äù

original: smras pa / rgyas pa tha dad pa'i rgyun de la phan 'dogs pas nye bar bstan pa ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i rgyun gyis 'phel ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / rgyas pa tha dad pa'i rgyun de la phan 'dogs pas nye bar bstan pa ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i rgyun gyis 'phel ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We reply: Because the continuum of a different enhancement is taught to be helpful, it is an increase by a continuum arisen from evolution and from natural outflow.

original: dbang pos ma bsdus pa'i gzugs la ni rnam pa gsum char med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang pos ma bsdus pa'i gzugs la ni rnam pa gsum char med par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that form not included in the sense bases is not included in any of the three.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / rgyas pa gnyis pas rgyas pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / rgyas pa gnyis pas rgyas pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: Mind and mental factors are arisen from natural outflow, arisen from evolution, and arisen from enhancement, which is a second kind of enhancement.

original: chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs la ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa med de lhag ma ni sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs la ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa med de lhag ma ni sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Form included in the sense-field of mental objects is not born from the ripening of karma. The rest should be understood as in the case of the mind and mental factors.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ni nang dang phyi rol gyi gzugs thams cad rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ni nang dang phyi rol gyi gzugs thams cad rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the realm of desire, all internal and external forms are the result of the ripening of karma.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni dri dang ro med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni dri dang ro med do //
translated: In the realm of form, there is no odor or taste.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ni dbang po gzugs can rnams ma tshang bar yang rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ni dbang po gzugs can rnams ma tshang bar yang rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the realm of desire, the material faculties are incomplete as the result of the ripening of karma.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni tshang ba rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni tshang ba rnams so //
translated: In the realm of form, they are complete.

original: sgra'i khams ni @54b rnam par smin pa yin la sgra ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i khams ni @54b rnam par smin pa yin la sgra ni ma yin te /
translated: The element of sound is the result of the ripening of karma, but sound is not.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gzugs kyi phung po'i rgyun bsam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gzugs kyi phung po'i rgyun bsam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is how the continuum of the aggregate of form should be understood as it is taught.

original: gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i sa'i khams ni las du dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i sa'i khams ni las du dang ldan pa yin /
translated: How many kinds of action are included in the earth element included in the aggregate of form?

original: rlung gi khams kyi bar du yang las du dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyi bar du yang las du dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: Up to the wind constituent, how many actions does it have?

original: smras pa ; thams cad kyang las lnga dang ldan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa ; thams cad kyang las lnga dang ldan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that all have five actions.

original: de la sa'i khams ni mngon par gnod pas de yongs su 'gyur bar byed pa'i las can dang / rten gyi las can dang / gnas byed pa'i las can dang / 'khrug pa'i las can dang / phan 'dogs pa'i las can yin no ;
analyzed: de la sa'i khams ni mngon par gnod pas de yongs su 'gyur bar byed pa'i las can dang / rten gyi las can dang / gnas byed pa'i las can dang / 'khrug pa'i las can dang / phan 'dogs pa'i las can yin no ;
translated: Among them, the earth constituent has the action of injury, the action of transformation, the action of support, the action of abiding, the action of disturbance, and the action of benefit.

original: / chu'i khams ni 'bab pa dang / sdud pa dang / rlan pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / phan 'dogs pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: / chu'i khams ni 'bab pa dang / sdud pa dang / rlan pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / phan 'dogs pa'i las can yin no //
translated: The water constituent has the action of flowing, the action of collecting, the action of moistening, the action of disturbance, and the action of benefit.

original: me'i khams ni gsal ba dang / smin pa dang / sreg pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / phan 'dogs pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: me'i khams ni gsal ba dang / smin pa dang / sreg pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / phan 'dogs pa'i las can yin no //
translated: The fire constituent has the action of illuminating, the action of ripening, the action of burning, the action of disturbance, and the action of benefit.

original: rlung gi khams ni g-yo ba dang bya ba'i rjes su 'jug pa dang / skam pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / phan 'dogs pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni g-yo ba dang bya ba'i rjes su 'jug pa dang / skam pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / phan 'dogs pa'i las can yin no //
translated: The wind constituent has the action of moving, the action of following activity, the action of drying, the action of disturbance, and the action of benefit.

original: yang 'byung ba chen po rnams ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'jug pa las lnga dang ldan par blta bar bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang 'byung ba chen po rnams ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'jug pa las lnga dang ldan par blta bar bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the five?

original: skyes pa dang / brten pa dang / gnas pa dang / rton pa dang ; 'phel bar byed pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa dang / brten pa dang / gnas pa dang / rton pa dang ; 'phel bar byed pa'i las can yin no //
translated: They have the function of origination, support, maintenance, reliance, and growth.

original: de la skyes pa ni 'gyur ba skye ba'i sngon du 'gro ba dag yin no //
analyzed: de la skyes pa ni 'gyur ba skye ba'i sngon du 'gro ba dag yin no //
translated: Among them, origination is the prior state of the elements in relation to the arising of derivative form.

original: brten pa ni 'gyur ba 'byung ba'i yul tha mi dad pas rten du gyur pa dag yin no //
analyzed: brten pa ni 'gyur ba 'byung ba'i yul tha mi dad pas rten du gyur pa dag yin no //
translated: Support is the state of being the support of derivative form, because the elements do not differ from the place where derivative form arises.

original: gnas pa ni phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa dag gis grub pa dang / bde ba gcig pa'i don gyi gnas su gyur pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa ni phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa dag gis grub pa dang / bde ba gcig pa'i don gyi gnas su gyur pa dag yin no //
translated: Maintenance is the state of being the basis for the same purpose of establishing and maintaining happiness in relation to derivative form, whether it is helpful or harmful.

original: rton pa ni de tsam las mi nyams shing kun tu 'dzin pas rton par gyur pa dag yin no //
analyzed: rton pa ni de tsam las mi nyams shing kun tu 'dzin pas rton par gyur pa dag yin no //
translated: Reliance is the state of being the support of derivative form, because it does not diminish and it holds it together.

original: 'phel bar byed pa ni 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur bas 'phel bar byed pa dag yin no //
analyzed: 'phel bar byed pa ni 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur bas 'phel bar byed pa dag yin no //
translated: Growth is the state of being the cause of the increase and expansion of derivative form.

original: mig dang rna ba'i spyod yul gyi gzugs dge ba dang mi dge ba gang yin pa de ci'i phyir na dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid yin pa de las gzhan pa dag ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: mig dang rna ba'i spyod yul gyi gzugs dge ba dang mi dge ba gang yin pa de ci'i phyir na dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid yin pa de las gzhan pa dag ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that only those forms that are the objects of the eye and ear are virtuous or nonvirtuous, and not others?

original: smras pa / mdor bsdu na sems pa ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang / chen po'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: smras pa / mdor bsdu na sems pa ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang / chen po'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: In brief, intention is threefold, distinguished according to its small, medium, and great degrees.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩlus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed dge ba dang / @55a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed dge ba dang / @55a * //
translated: It is as follows:üîΩThe intention that is the instigation of the engagement in the virtuous or nonvirtuous informative form of body and speech,

original: mi dge bar gdags pa 'jug pa la mngon par 'du byed pa'i sems pa dang / nges pa'i sems pa dang / kun nas slong ba'i sems pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge bar gdags pa 'jug pa la mngon par 'du byed pa'i sems pa dang / nges pa'i sems pa dang / kun nas slong ba'i sems pa'o //
translated: the intention that is the determination, and the intention that is the instigation.

original: de ni sems pa chen po rten du gyur pa dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge bar blta bar bya'o //üîΩgzugs 'dus pa las g-yo ba tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: de ni sems pa chen po rten du gyur pa dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge bar blta bar bya'o // gzugs 'dus pa las g-yo ba tha dad pa'am /
translated: It should be understood that intention is virtuous or nonvirtuous because it is associated with a great degree of support.

original: tha mi dad par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: tha mi dad par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Should movement be described as different from the collection of form or not different?

original: smras pa / tha mi dad par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / tha mi dad par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be described as not different.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause there is no fault in moving after being born in that place,

original: yul der skyes nas sam /
analyzed: yul der skyes nas sam /
translated: or not being born there,üîΩor after being destroyed,

original: ma skyes par ram /üîΩzhigs nas sam /üîΩma zhigs par g-yo ba la nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes par ram / zhigs nas sam / ma zhigs par g-yo ba la nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or not being destroyed.

original: de la nyes pa ni 'di dag yin te ;
analyzed: de la nyes pa ni 'di dag yin te ;
translated: Here are the faults:

original: gal te skyes nas g-yon ni des na mtshan nyid spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te skyes nas g-yon ni des na mtshan nyid spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it moves after being born, then it would abandon its characteristics.

original: gal te ma skyes par g-yo na ni des na g-yo ba dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma skyes par g-yo na ni des na g-yo ba dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it moves without being born, then it would not possess movement.

original: gal te zhigs nas g-yo na ni des na gong ma dang 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te zhigs nas g-yo na ni des na gong ma dang 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it moves after being destroyed, then it would be just as before.

original: gal te ma zhigs par g-yo na ni des na 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid gsal bar spangs par 'gyur ro //üîΩde las gzhan pa yul gzhan du skye ba'i rgyu dmigs pas na /
analyzed: gal te ma zhigs par g-yo na ni des na 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid gsal bar spangs par 'gyur ro // de las gzhan pa yul gzhan du skye ba'i rgyu dmigs pas na /
translated: If it moves without being destroyed, then it would clearly abandon the characteristics of conditioning.

original: g-yo ba zhes bya ba don gzhan du gyur pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: g-yo ba zhes bya ba don gzhan du gyur pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Apart from that, movement should be understood as not existing substantially as a separate object, because the cause of birth in another place is observed.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gzugs kyi phung po'i las bsam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gzugs kyi phung po'i las bsam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The function of the form aggregate should be understood in accordance with this explanation.

original: de la gzugs kyi phung po thams cad ni skad cig pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi phung po thams cad ni skad cig pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: All form aggregates are momentary.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: skyes nas 'jig pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes nas 'jig pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their destruction is observed immediately after their origination.

original: skye ba'i rgyu ni 'jig pa'i rgyu yin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu ni 'jig pa'i rgyu yin par mi rung ste /
translated: It is not possible that the cause of origination is also the cause of destruction,

original: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because their characteristics are different.

original: skyes pa gnas pa'i rgyu de las gzhan pa yang mi dmigs pas de'i phyir 'du byed thams cad ni rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: skyes pa gnas pa'i rgyu de las gzhan pa yang mi dmigs pas de'i phyir 'du byed thams cad ni rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Since no other cause of duration is observed, therefore all formations are known to be subject to destruction by their very nature.

original: de'i phyir skad cig pa nyid rab tu grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig pa nyid rab tu grub bo //
translated: Therefore, momentariness is well established.

original: me la sogs pa 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid du rtog pa yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: me la sogs pa 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid du rtog pa yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible to conceive of fire, etc., as the cause of destruction.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: me la sogs pa de dag ni 'du byed de dang lhan cig tu skye ba dang 'jig par dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: me la sogs pa de dag ni 'du byed de dang lhan cig tu skye ba dang 'jig par dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because fire, etc., are observed to originate and be destroyed simultaneously with those formations.

original: de dag ni mi 'dra ba skye ba'i rkyen byed pa tsam yod par zad do //
analyzed: de dag ni mi 'dra ba skye ba'i rkyen byed pa tsam yod par zad do //
translated: They are merely conditions that give rise to the arising of the different states.

original: 'jig pa yang 'jig pa'i rgyur mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'jig pa yang 'jig pa'i rgyur mi rung ngo //
translated: And destruction is not a cause of destruction.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dang lhan cig yod par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig yod par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that it exists simultaneously with itself.

original: skyes nas de 'jig par byed ces byar yang @55b de'i rgyun chad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes nas de 'jig par byed ces byar yang @55b de'i rgyun chad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And if it is said that it causes the destruction of what has arisen, then it follows that the continuum of that would be severed.

original: 'jig pa de la 'jig pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid yin na ni 'jig pa'i rgyu yin par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'jig pa de la 'jig pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid yin na ni 'jig pa'i rgyu yin par mi rung ngo //
translated: If that destruction has the nature of mere destruction, then it is not tenable that it is a cause of destruction.

original: 'on te 'jig pa de ngo bo nyid gzhan pa kho na zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te 'jig pa de ngo bo nyid gzhan pa kho na zhig yin na ni /
translated: But if that destruction has a different nature,

original: des na 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid don gzhan du gyur pa de mi dmigs pas mi rung ngo ;
analyzed: des na 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid don gzhan du gyur pa de mi dmigs pas mi rung ngo ;
translated: then it is not tenable that it is a different object from the characteristics of destruction.

original: / gal te me la sogs pa dang 'jig pa bsdongs te 'jig par byed do zhes rtog na ni /
analyzed: / gal te me la sogs pa dang 'jig pa bsdongs te 'jig par byed do zhes rtog na ni /
translated: If you imagine that fire and so on cause destruction through contact with what is to be destroyed,

original: des na mar me la sogs pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rang gi ngang gis 'jig go zhes bya ba mi 'thad par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na mar me la sogs pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rang gi ngang gis 'jig go zhes bya ba mi 'thad par mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to say that a flame, etc., and minds and mental factors are momentary by their very nature.

original: gal te de skye ba la nus pa gzhan dang gzhan yod par rtog na ni des na bye brag mi dmigs pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te de skye ba la nus pa gzhan dang gzhan yod par rtog na ni des na bye brag mi dmigs pas mi rung ngo //
translated: If you imagine that the capacity to arise is different from the capacity to be destroyed, then it is not possible to distinguish between them.

original: gal te gnyi gas phyogs gcig 'jig par nus so zhes rtog na ni /
analyzed: gal te gnyi gas phyogs gcig 'jig par nus so zhes rtog na ni /
translated: If you imagine that both the capacity to arise and the capacity to be destroyed are present in a single entity,

original: des na gnyi gas cha gnyi ga 'jig par nus pa'am /
analyzed: des na gnyi gas cha gnyi ga 'jig par nus pa'am /
translated: then it follows that both the capacity to arise and the capacity to be destroyed would be present in every entity,

original: cha gnyi ga 'jig par mi nus par thal bar 'gyur bas mi rung ste /
analyzed: cha gnyi ga 'jig par mi nus par thal bar 'gyur bas mi rung ste /
translated: or neither the capacity to arise nor the capacity to be destroyed would be present in any entity.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gzugs kyi phung po'i skad cig pa nyid bsam pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gzugs kyi phung po'i skad cig pa nyid bsam pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: This is how you should understand the momentariness of the form aggregate.

original: 'di lta ste rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa'i rgyu dang / me la sogs pa 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin par bkag pa dang / 'jig pa 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin par bkag pa dang / de gnyi ga 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin par bkag pa las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa'i rgyu dang / me la sogs pa 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin par bkag pa dang / 'jig pa 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin par bkag pa dang / de gnyi ga 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin par bkag pa las blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be understood from the refutation of the cause of destruction as being intrinsic to things, the refutation of fire and so on as the cause of destruction, the refutation of destruction as the cause of destruction, and the refutation of both as the cause of destruction.

original: yang 'du byed thams cad ni sems kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir sems bzhin du skad cig pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩci 'byung ba chen po rnams las rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams mtshan nyid tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: yang 'du byed thams cad ni sems kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir sems bzhin du skad cig pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o // ci 'byung ba chen po rnams las rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams mtshan nyid tha dad pa'am /
translated: Moreover, all formations are the effects of mind, and therefore, like mind, they should be understood to be momentary.

original: tha dad pa ma yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Should it be said that the forms derived from the great elements have the same characteristics as the great elements or different characteristics?

original: smras pa / tha dad par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / tha dad par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that they have different characteristics.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their characteristics are perceived to be different.

original: de la mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference in their characteristics is as follows:

original: 'di lta ste dbang po gzhan gyis rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dbang po gzhan gyis rtogs pa ste /
translated: They are perceived by a different sense faculty.

original: 'di ltar 'byung ba chen po rnams ni dbang po gzhan gyis 'dzin par byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'byung ba chen po rnams ni dbang po gzhan gyis 'dzin par byed la /
translated: Thus, the great elements are apprehended by other faculties,üîΩand derivative form is also apprehended by other faculties.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams kyang dbang po gzhan gyis 'dzin par byed pa dang / de bzhin du 'pho ba dang mi 'pho ba yang dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams kyang dbang po gzhan gyis 'dzin par byed pa dang / de bzhin du 'pho ba dang mi 'pho ba yang dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: And likewise, it is observed that some are transferable and some are not transferable.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: til mar dag gi nang du me tog dag gi dri 'pho ba ni dmigs la /üîΩsra ba la sogs @56a * //
analyzed: til mar dag gi nang du me tog dag gi dri 'pho ba ni dmigs la / sra ba la sogs @56a * //
translated: the fragrance of flowers is observed to be transferable in sesame oil,üîΩbut solidity and so on are not transferable.

original: pa ni mi 'pho ba dang / de bzhin du 'gyur ba dang mi 'gyur ba yang dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: pa ni mi 'pho ba dang / de bzhin du 'gyur ba dang mi 'gyur ba yang dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: And likewise, it is observed that some are changeable and some are not changeable.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: mar bzhu ba la sogs pa la kha dog dang ro la sogs pa 'gyur ba'i bye brag ni dmigs la /
analyzed: mar bzhu ba la sogs pa la kha dog dang ro la sogs pa 'gyur ba'i bye brag ni dmigs la /
translated: color, taste, and so on are observed to be changeable in melted butter and so on,

original: sra ba la sogs pa ni mi dmigs te /
analyzed: sra ba la sogs pa ni mi dmigs te /
translated: but solidity and so on are not observed to be changeable.

original: de lta bas na 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dag ni mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dag ni mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that derivative form is different in characteristic from the great elements.

original: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dag la yang gcig pa nyid du mngon par zhen par byed na ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dag la yang gcig pa nyid du mngon par zhen par byed na ni /
translated: If one were to conceive of things that have different characteristics as being the same,

original: 'byung ba chen po rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then the great elements would also be the same.

original: 'di lta ste 'byung ba chen po rnams ni phan tshun mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dag yin pas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'byung ba chen po rnams ni phan tshun mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dag yin pas /
translated: For example, the great elements are mutually different in their characteristics.

original: de ltar na 'byung ba chen po yang gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'byung ba chen po yang gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the great elements would also be the same.

original: de ltar na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams ni 'byung ba chen po dag las mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams ni 'byung ba chen po dag las mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, derivative form should be understood as being different in characteristics from the great elements.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi ma 'dres pa dang 'dres pa bsam pa yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩgzugs kyis bsdus pa'i chos rnams las du zhig ni dbang por gyur pa dag yin /
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi ma 'dres pa dang 'dres pa bsam pa yin par rig par bya'o // gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i chos rnams las du zhig ni dbang por gyur pa dag yin /
translated: Such is the understanding of the unmixed and mixed great elements.

original: du zhig ni spyod yul du gyur pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig ni spyod yul du gyur pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many of the phenomena included in form are faculties and how many are objects of the faculties?

original: smras pa / lnga ni dbang por gyur pa dag yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / lnga ni dbang por gyur pa dag yin la /
translated: He says: Five are faculties,

original: drug ni spyod yul du gyur pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: drug ni spyod yul du gyur pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and six are objects.

original: de la dbang por gyur pa rnams kyi spyod yul du gyur pa dag ji ltar na spyod yul yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la dbang por gyur pa rnams kyi spyod yul du gyur pa dag ji ltar na spyod yul yin zhe na /
translated: How are the objects of those that are faculties objects?

original: de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sa'i dngos gzhir de la dmigs kyang yongs su ma nyams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sa'i dngos gzhir de la dmigs kyang yongs su ma nyams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher bstan pa yin no //
translated: In the Abhidharma it is stated in detail: ‚ÄúEven though one focuses on that, it is not lost, etc.‚Äù

original: de la rgyu dus na dbang po yongs su nyams pa dang yongs su ma nyams par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la rgyu dus na dbang po yongs su nyams pa dang yongs su ma nyams par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: In this regard, should the faculty be said to be lost or not lost at the time of the cause?

original: smras pa / rgyu gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu gnyis kyis te /
translated: He says: By two causes:

original: dman par gyur pa dang / thams cad kyi thams cad du nyams pas so //
analyzed: dman par gyur pa dang / thams cad kyi thams cad du nyams pas so //
translated: by being inferior and by being completely lost.

original: de las bzlog pas ni yongs su ma nyams par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pas ni yongs su ma nyams par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that should be said to be not lost.

original: gzhan yang mdor bsdu na rgyu bzhis dbang po rnams 'gyur bar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdor bsdu na rgyu bzhis dbang po rnams 'gyur bar blta bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, in brief, the faculties should be seen as changing by four causes:

original: phyi rol gyi rkyen las skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rkyen las skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: arising from external conditions,

original: phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod par byed pa'i yul la yongs su longs spyod pa dag dang / yul dang phan 'dogs pa pha rol gyi gnod pa dag gis 'gyur bar byed pa'o //üîΩnang gi rkyen las skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod par byed pa'i yul la yongs su longs spyod pa dag dang / yul dang phan 'dogs pa pha rol gyi gnod pa dag gis 'gyur bar byed pa'o // nang gi rkyen las skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The internal condition is the transformation of the object of enjoyment, whether it is helpful or harmful, by the object of enjoyment and by the harmfulness of the other.üîΩThe internal condition is the transformation of the object of enjoyment, whether it is helpful or harmful, by the object of enjoyment and by the harmfulness of the other.üîΩThe internal condition is the transformation of the object of enjoyment, whether it is helpful or harmful, by the object of enjoyment and by the harmfulness of the other.üîΩThe internal condition is the transformation of the object of enjoyment, whether it is helpful or harmful, by the object of enjoyment and by the harmfulness of the other.üîΩThe internal condition is the transformation of the object of enjoyment, whether it is helpful or harmful, by the object of enjoyment and by the harmfulness of the other.üîΩThe internal condition is the transformation of the object of enjoyment, whether it is helpful or harmful, by the object of enjoyment and by the harmfulness of the other.

original: so so'i nang gi @56b tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las skyes pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las skyes pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pas 'gyur bar byed pa'o //üîΩlas kyi rkyen las skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: so so'i nang gi @56b tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las skyes pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las skyes pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pas 'gyur bar byed pa'o // las kyi rkyen las skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The internal condition is the transformation of the object of enjoyment, whether it is helpful or harmful, by the object of enjoyment and by the harmfulness of the other.üîΩThe internal condition is the transformation of the object of enjoyment, whether it is helpful or harmful, by the object of enjoyment and by the harmfulness of the other.

original: sngon gyi las kyi dbang gis gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa la sogs pas 'gyur bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi dbang gis gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa la sogs pas 'gyur bar byed pa'o //
translated: The internal condition is the transformation of the object of enjoyment, whether it is helpful or harmful, by the object of enjoyment and by the harmfulness of the other.

original: ngo bo nyid las 'gyur ba skye ba ni 'di lta ste /üîΩdbang po de dag nyid kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pas 'gyur bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las 'gyur ba skye ba ni 'di lta ste /üîΩdbang po de dag nyid kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pas 'gyur bar byed pa'o //
translated: The internal

original: yid kyi dbang po'i yongs su nyams pa rnam pa dur blta bar bya zhe na smras pa ;
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po'i yongs su nyams pa rnam pa dur blta bar bya zhe na smras pa ;
translated: How many types of degeneration of the mental faculty should be understood?

original: rnam pa bzhi ste /üîΩsgrib pas byas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi ste / sgrib pas byas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Four types:

original: sgrib pa lnga po dag las gang yang rung bas sems sgrib pa las so //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga po dag las gang yang rung bas sems sgrib pa las so //
translated: Degeneration caused by obstruction, as when the mind is obstructed by any of the five obstructions.

original: g-yeng bas byas pa ni 'di lta ste gdon gyis brlams pa la sogs pas sems g-yeng bar byas pa las so //üîΩma thob pas byas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: g-yeng bas byas pa ni 'di lta ste gdon gyis brlams pa la sogs pas sems g-yeng bar byas pa las so // ma thob pas byas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Degeneration caused by distraction, as when the mind is distracted by the influence of spirits, etc.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i yon tan khyad par can ma thob pa'i sems de la rtsol bar byed pa las so //üîΩma byang bas byas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i yon tan khyad par can ma thob pa'i sems de la rtsol bar byed pa las so // ma byang bas byas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Degeneration caused by non-acquisition, as when one strives for a mind that is not capable of obtaining the special qualities of the absorptions and formless states.

original: thos pa dang bzo la sogs pa la yongs su byang bar ma byas pa'i sems las so //
analyzed: thos pa dang bzo la sogs pa la yongs su byang bar ma byas pa'i sems las so //
translated: Degeneration caused by non-cultivation, as when one strives for a mind that is not cultivated in learning, arts, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams dbang po rnams la ji ltar snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams dbang po rnams la ji ltar snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do objects such as form appear to the sense faculties?

original: smras pa / gzugs ni mig dang ma phrad par snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs ni mig dang ma phrad par snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is said: Form appears without contact with the eye.

original: ha cang cha phra ba ma yin pa snang bar 'gyur ro //üîΩbstan du yod pa snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha cang cha phra ba ma yin pa snang bar 'gyur ro // bstan du yod pa snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The visible form that is not subtle is visible.

original: ma bsgribs pa snang bar 'gyur ro //üîΩsnang ba dang bcas par snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa snang bar 'gyur ro // snang ba dang bcas par snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The visible form that is not obscured is visible.üîΩThe visible form that is not too distant is visible.üîΩThe visible form that is not too close is visible.

original: ha cang bskal pa ma yin pa snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha cang bskal pa ma yin pa snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The visible form that is not too remote is visible.

original: spyod yul na gnas pa snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyod yul na gnas pa snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The visible form that is in the field of vision is visible.

original: gzhan yang la la'i mig la ni mun khrod na yang gzugs snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang la la'i mig la ni mun khrod na yang gzugs snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, for some, form is visible even in the dark.

original: sgra ni rna ba dang ma phrad pa dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa dang / snang ba dang / mun khrod dang / ha cang cha phra ba ma yin pa dang / ha cang bskal pa ma yin pa dang / spyod yul na gnas pa grag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra ni rna ba dang ma phrad pa dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa dang / snang ba dang / mun khrod dang / ha cang cha phra ba ma yin pa dang / ha cang bskal pa ma yin pa dang / spyod yul na gnas pa grag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Sound is heard when it is not in contact with the ear, when it is obscured, when it is not obscured, when it is visible, when it is in the dark, when it is not too subtle, when it is not too remote, and when it is in the field of vision.

original: dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams ni rang rang gi dbang po rnams dang phrad pa dang / spyod yul na gnas pa dag spyod yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams ni rang rang gi dbang po rnams dang phrad pa dang / spyod yul na gnas pa dag spyod yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: Smell, taste, and tactility are in the field of vision when they are in contact with their respective faculties and are in the field of vision.

original: lha'i mig la ni gzugs bstan du yod pa dang / bsgribs @57a * //
analyzed: lha'i mig la ni gzugs bstan du yod pa dang / bsgribs @57a * //
translated: The divine eye is the form base that is obscured.üîΩ

original: pa dang ; mun khrod na 'dug pa dang / bskal pa dang / spyod yul na gnas pa yang snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa dang ; mun khrod na 'dug pa dang / bskal pa dang / spyod yul na gnas pa yang snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The divine eye sees visible form that is hidden, distant, subtle, past, future, and internal to others.

original: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig la ni gzugs rnam pa thams cad spyod yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig la ni gzugs rnam pa thams cad spyod yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: The eye of wisdom of the noble ones sees all aspects of visible form as their sphere.üîΩThe YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi explains that the sphere of activity is sixfold.

original: sa'i dngos gzhir spyod yul rnam pa drug ces gang smras pa de'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa'i dngos gzhir spyod yul rnam pa drug ces gang smras pa de'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is its classification?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gnas dang / mtshan nyid dang / phyogs dang dus dang gsal ba dang / mi gsal ba dang / phyogs gcig dang / dngos po thams cad 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: gnas dang / mtshan nyid dang / phyogs dang dus dang gsal ba dang / mi gsal ba dang / phyogs gcig dang / dngos po thams cad 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The sphere of activity is the holding of the place, the characteristics, the direction, the time, the manifest, the unmanifest, the part, and all things.

original: de la dang po ni sems can gyi 'jig rten du gtogs pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten du gtogs pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: de la dang po ni sems can gyi 'jig rten du gtogs pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten du gtogs pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The first is visible form included in the world of sentient beings and included in the receptacle world.

original: gnyis pa ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum gyis ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag las te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum gyis ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag las te /
translated: The second is the distinction of intrinsic natures through the three intrinsic natures.

original: mtshan nyid kyi bye brag dang / bya ba'i bye brag dang / gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi bye brag dang / bya ba'i bye brag dang / gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis so //
translated: by the particularities of characteristics, by the particularities of action, and by the particularities of state.

original: de la gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi bye brag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi bye brag ni 'di yin te /
translated: The particularities of characteristics of form are as follows:

original: sngon po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po zhes bya ba rgya cher bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po zhes bya ba rgya cher bstan pa'o //
translated: blue, yellow, red, white, etc.

original: de la bya ba'i bye brag ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la bya ba'i bye brag ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The particularities of action are as follows:

original: rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa sdom pa dang / sdom pa ma yin pa dang / sdom pa yang ma yin sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma yin par bsdus pa dag yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa sdom pa dang / sdom pa ma yin pa dang / sdom pa yang ma yin sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma yin par bsdus pa dag yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: one should see that they are included in the categories of informative form, non-informative form, morality, immorality, and that which is neither.

original: de la gnas skabs kyi bye brag ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gnas skabs kyi bye brag ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The particularities of state are as follows:

original: yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang / btang snyoms kyi gnas lta bu dag yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang / btang snyoms kyi gnas lta bu dag yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: one should see that they are included in the categories of pleasant, unpleasant, and neutral states.

original: de la sgra rnams ni mtshan nyid kyi bye brag ni zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba rnams dang / ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba rnams dang / zin pa dang / ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: de la sgra rnams ni mtshan nyid kyi bye brag ni zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba rnams dang / ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba rnams dang / zin pa dang / ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba rnams so //
translated: Sounds are distinguished by their characteristics as being produced by the great elements that are the basis of the essential nature, as being produced by the great elements that are not the basis of the essential nature, and as being produced by the great elements that are both the basis of the essential nature and not the basis of the essential nature.

original: bya ba'i bye brag ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed do //
analyzed: bya ba'i bye brag ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed do //
translated: Sounds are distinguished by their function as the intimation of speech.

original: gnas skabs kyi bye brag ni snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi bye brag ni snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: They are distinguished by their condition as before.

original: de la dri rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi bye brag ni rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang / shun pa dang / snying po dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang 'bras bu'i dri dag go //
analyzed: de la dri rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi bye brag ni rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang / shun pa dang / snying po dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang 'bras bu'i dri dag go //
translated: Smells are distinguished by their characteristics as the smells of roots, stems, shoots, trunks, branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits.

original: dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams la bya ba'i bye brag ni med do //
analyzed: dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams la bya ba'i bye brag ni med do //
translated: Smells, tastes, and tangible objects are not distinguished by their function.

original: de dag gi gnas skabs kyi bye brag ni snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gnas skabs kyi bye brag ni snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: They are distinguished by their condition as before.

original: de la ro'i mtshan nyid kyi bye brag ni kha ba la @57b sogs pa ste snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la ro'i mtshan nyid kyi bye brag ni kha ba la @57b sogs pa ste snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The particularities of the characteristic of taste are sweet, sour, etc., as before.

original: reg bya'i mtshan nyid kyi bye brag kyang rnam pa du ma ste snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: reg bya'i mtshan nyid kyi bye brag kyang rnam pa du ma ste snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The particularities of the characteristic of touch are also of many kinds, as before.

original: de la spyod yul gsum pa ni shar dang lho dang nub dang byang la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la spyod yul gsum pa ni shar dang lho dang nub dang byang la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The third domain should be known as the directions, east, south, west, north, etc.

original: de la bzhi pa ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang ; da ltar byung ba'i bye brag las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la bzhi pa ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang ; da ltar byung ba'i bye brag las blta bar bya'o //
translated: The fourth should be seen as the distinction of past, future, and present.

original: de la lnga pa ni yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin par gzung ba'i bye brag las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la lnga pa ni yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin par gzung ba'i bye brag las blta bar bya'o //
translated: The fifth should be seen as the distinction of grasping what is real and what is unreal.

original: de la drug pa ni phyogs gcig dang / dngos po mtha' dag 'dzin pa'i bye brag las blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la drug pa ni phyogs gcig dang / dngos po mtha' dag 'dzin pa'i bye brag las blta bar bya ste /
translated: The sixth should be seen as the distinction of grasping a part and the whole.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gzugs can rnams kyi yul rnams snang bar 'gyur ba'i bye brag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gzugs can rnams kyi yul rnams snang bar 'gyur ba'i bye brag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is how the appearance of the objects of those with form should be understood.

original: de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the attention to the elements?

original: gnas yongs su ma nyams pa de dang yul snang ba dang phrad pa de dang / des sems kyi 'jug pa mngon par grub pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gnas yongs su ma nyams pa de dang yul snang ba dang phrad pa de dang / des sems kyi 'jug pa mngon par grub pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the non-deterioration of the basis, the appearance of the object, and the establishment of the engagement of the mind.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gzugs can rnams kyi phung po'i spyod yul bsam pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gzugs can rnams kyi phung po'i spyod yul bsam pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This is how the object of the aggregates of those with form should be understood.

original: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus la gnas pa'i lus la gzugs na spyod pa'i 'byung ba chen po gang dag mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba de dag 'og ma'i gzugs dang lhan cig pa yul gcig gam yul tha dad dam ji ltar gnas par brjod parüîΩbya zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus la gnas pa'i lus la gzugs na spyod pa'i 'byung ba chen po gang dag mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba de dag 'og ma'i gzugs dang lhan cig pa yul gcig gam yul tha dad dam ji ltar gnas par brjod parüîΩbya zhe na /
translated: In the desire realm, when the body of one who is in the desire realm is established, the great elements of the form realm are established together with the lower form. Should it be said that they are in the same place or in different places?

original: smras pa / bye ma dang chu bzhin du yul tha dad pa ma yin par gnas par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / bye ma dang chu bzhin du yul tha dad pa ma yin par gnas par brjod par bya ste /
translated: He replied: ‚ÄúLike sand and water, they are said to exist without being separate objects.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gzugs kyi phung po'i phan tshun 'dres pa bsam pa yin par blta bar bya'o ;üîΩ/ gzugs kyi phung po'i bsam pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gzugs kyi phung po'i phan tshun 'dres pa bsam pa yin par blta bar bya'o ; / gzugs kyi phung po'i bsam pa rdzogs so /
translated: Thus, this is how you should view the contemplation of the commingling of the form aggregate.

original: // / bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bdun pa /
translated: The contemplation of the form aggregate is complete.

original: da 'di man chad ni ming gis bsdus pa'i phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ci rigs par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da 'di man chad ni ming gis bsdus pa'i phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ci rigs par bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, from here on, the appropriate presentation of the four non-physical aggregates that are subsumed by name should be explained.

original: sa'i dngos gzhir sems gcig rnam par gzhag pa bshad pa gang yin pa de las brtsams nas de la dpe ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: sa'i dngos gzhir sems gcig rnam par gzhag pa bshad pa gang yin pa de las brtsams nas de la dpe ni 'di yin te /
translated: The Compendium of Abhidharma explains the presentation of a single mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bde bar gshegs pa ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bde bar gshegs pa ni ston pa'o //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúThe Sugata is the teacher.üîΩThe Sugata is the teacher.‚Äù

original: bde bar gshegs pa ni ston pa'o zhes sems bskyed cing tshig tu yang smra na /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ni ston pa'o zhes sems bskyed cing tshig tu yang smra na /
translated: When one generates that thought and speaks those words,

original: de ltar sems skyed par byed pa yang dge ba'i chos @58a * //
analyzed: de ltar sems skyed par byed pa yang dge ba'i chos @58a * //
translated: one generates virtuous thoughts.

original: rnams la gces spras byed pa yin par nga smra na /
analyzed: rnams la gces spras byed pa yin par nga smra na /
translated: I say that you should cherish them.

original: lus dang ngag gis rjes su sgrub pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gis rjes su sgrub pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: How much more so should you practice them with your body and speech!

original: de bzhin du sems 'di snyed kyis mngon par rtogs par byed pa dang / de bzhin du sems dang ba gcig gis ni bde 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems 'di snyed kyis mngon par rtogs par byed pa dang / de bzhin du sems dang ba gcig gis ni bde 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa ste /
translated: In the same way, a single thought of faith will lead to a happy rebirth.

original: de la 'jug par gtogs pa'i sems kyi rgyun gcig gis ni tha snyad dang ldan pa'i sems gcig kun nas slong bar byed la /
analyzed: de la 'jug par gtogs pa'i sems kyi rgyun gcig gis ni tha snyad dang ldan pa'i sems gcig kun nas slong bar byed la /
translated: In this regard, a single continuum of thought that is engaged in a verbal expression motivates a single thought that is associated with verbal expression.

original: tha snyad dang ldan pa'i rgyun gcig gis ni tshig gcig rjod par byed cing lus kyi las kyang kun nas slong bar byed do //üîΩde la ci rnam par rtog pa can dang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems da ltar byung ba'i yul nyid kyis yul mtshungs pa'am /
analyzed: tha snyad dang ldan pa'i rgyun gcig gis ni tshig gcig rjod par byed cing lus kyi las kyang kun nas slong bar byed do // de la ci rnam par rtog pa can dang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems da ltar byung ba'i yul nyid kyis yul mtshungs pa'am /
translated: A single continuum that is associated with verbal expression expresses a single word and also motivates a bodily action.

original: yul mi mtshungs par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yul mi mtshungs par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: In this regard, should the present object of a conceptual or nonconceptual thought be said to be the same as or different from its object?

original: smras pa yul mtshungs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa yul mtshungs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: He replied, ‚ÄúIt should be said that they are similar in terms of their object.üîΩ‚Äù

original: rgyu gang gis she na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis she na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the cause of that?‚Äù

original: smras pa / rgyu gsum gyis gsal ba'i phyir dang / de la rtsol ba'i phyir dang / gnas gnyis kyis brtas par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu gsum gyis gsal ba'i phyir dang / de la rtsol ba'i phyir dang / gnas gnyis kyis brtas par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He replied, ‚ÄúIt is because they are clear in three ways, because they are applied to that, and because they are developed by two bases.üîΩ‚Äù

original: sems nyon mongs pa can du skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ci ngo bo nyid las nyon mongs pa can du brjod par bya'am /
analyzed: sems nyon mongs pa can du skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ci ngo bo nyid las nyon mongs pa can du brjod par bya'am /
translated: ‚ÄúIs the arising of a defiled mind called defiled because of its intrinsic nature,

original: 'on te mtshungs par ldan par las sam /
analyzed: 'on te mtshungs par ldan par las sam /
translated: or because of its concomitants,

original: 'on te bag la nyal las she na /
analyzed: 'on te bag la nyal las she na /
translated: or because of its latent propensities?‚Äù

original: smras pa / mtshungs par ldan pa dang bag la nyal las yin gyi /
analyzed: smras pa / mtshungs par ldan pa dang bag la nyal las yin gyi /
translated: He replied, ‚ÄúIt is because of its concomitants and its latent propensities,

original: ngo bo nyid las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las ni ma yin no //
translated: but not because of its intrinsic nature.üîΩ‚Äù

original: gal te ngo bo nyid las nyon mongs pa can du gyur na ni de 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin du gtan rnam par mi 'dag pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid las nyon mongs pa can du gyur na ni de 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin du gtan rnam par mi 'dag pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro ;
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were defiled because of its intrinsic nature, then it would be defiled like attachment and so on, and the fault would be that it would never be purified.

original: / de lta bas na ngo bo nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir sems ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid du skye'o //
analyzed: / de lta bas na ngo bo nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir sems ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid du skye'o //
translated: Therefore, because it is not intrinsically defiled, the mind is born as clear light by nature.

original: de la kun nas dkris pa sems kun nas nyon mongs pa de gnyis las gang yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la kun nas dkris pa sems kun nas nyon mongs pa de gnyis las gang yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Now, which of these two defilements of the mind, the entanglements and the latencies, should be called the mind‚Äôs defilement?

original: smras pa mtshungs par ldan pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa mtshungs par ldan pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that the mind‚Äôs defilement is the entanglements.

original: de la bag la nyal gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bag la nyal gang zhe na /
translated: What are the latencies?

original: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len gang yin pa ste 'du byed rnams kyi nyes par kun tu gnas pa nyid dang / nyes par zhugs pa nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len gang yin pa ste 'du byed rnams kyi nyes par kun tu gnas pa nyid dang / nyes par zhugs pa nyid do //
translated: They are the negative reflex actions that are on the side of the defilements, the negative habits and tendencies of the formative forces.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis gang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid @58b kyis sdug bsngal bar mngon par rtogs nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis gang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid @58b kyis sdug bsngal bar mngon par rtogs nas /
translated: The Noble Ones, having realized the suffering of the formative forces,üîΩsee all the formative forces as suffering and abide in that vision.

original: 'du byed thams cad la sdug bsngal bar gzigs shing gnas pa de yang ji ltar gzigs she na /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad la sdug bsngal bar gzigs shing gnas pa de yang ji ltar gzigs she na /
translated: How do they see them?

original: 'di lta ste rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa'i dngos gzhir 'di lta ste /üîΩyongs su gdung ba dang bcas pa dang / 'bras bu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //üîΩyang sems kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad bsdus par blta bar bya ste /üîΩlas kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ; nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas so //üîΩde la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang po dang gnyis pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dag yin no //üîΩtha ma ni khams gsum na spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa'i dngos gzhir 'di lta ste / yongs su gdung ba dang bcas pa dang / 'bras bu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o // yang sems kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad bsdus par blta bar bya ste / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ; nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas so // de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang po dang gnyis pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dag yin no // tha ma ni khams gsum na spyod pa yin no //
