translated: For example, in the Abhidharma it is said: ‚ÄúThe stage with applied thought and sustained thought is the stage of the fundamental meditations, which is accompanied by investigation, accompanied by sustained thought, accompanied by joy, accompanied by pleasure, accompanied by happiness, and accompanied by the faculty of mental pleasure.

original: de la sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba gang zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / bag la nyal gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba gang zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / bag la nyal gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is accompanied by the faculty of equanimity, accompanied by the faculty of pleasure, accompanied by the faculty of pain, accompanied by the faculty of mental pleasure, accompanied by the faculty of mental pain, accompanied by the faculty of indifference, accompanied by the faculty of faith, accompanied by the faculty of vigor, accompanied by the faculty of mindfulness, accompanied original: las kyi 'ching ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: las kyi 'ching ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fetter of action?

original: smras pa / las la dga' ba yang las kyi 'ching ba yin no //üîΩgnas gsum po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa / las la dga' ba yang las kyi 'ching ba yin no // gnas gsum po 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the delight in action.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i sems dang / nges par byung nas dga' ba thob pa dang / lam la dga' ba thob pa la gegs byed pa'i las kyang las kyi 'ching ba yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i sems dang / nges par byung nas dga' ba thob pa dang / lam la dga' ba thob pa la gegs byed pa'i las kyang las kyi 'ching ba yin no //
translated: The fetter of action is also the action which obstructs the mind of liberation, the attainment of joy after liberation, and the attainment of delight in the path.

original: rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa dang mthun pa'i las kyang las kyi 'ching ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa dang mthun pa'i las kyang las kyi 'ching ba yin no //
translated: The fetter of action is also the action which is favorable to the obscuration of retribution.

original: log par smon pa'i las kyang las kyi 'ching ba yin te /
analyzed: log par smon pa'i las kyang las kyi 'ching ba yin te /
translated: The fetter of action is also the action which is wrongly aspired.

original: bzhi po de dag yod na drug tu 'gyur la /
analyzed: bzhi po de dag yod na drug tu 'gyur la /
translated: When these four are present, there are six.

original: drug yod na yang bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drug yod na yang bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: When there are six, there are also four.

original: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba na sems las byung ba'i chos kun tu 'gro ba du 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba na sems las byung ba'i chos kun tu 'gro ba du 'byung zhe na /
translated: When consciousness arises, how many omnipresent mental activities arise together with it?

original: smras pa / lnga ste yid la byed pa dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / lnga ste yid la byed pa dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa'o //
translated: Five: attention, contact, feeling, conceptualization, and volition.

original: kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa du 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa du 'byung zhe na /
translated: How many are not universal?

original: smras pa / kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa ni mang mod kyi gtso bo ni lnga ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa / kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa ni mang mod kyi gtso bo ni lnga ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Reply: There are many that are not universal. The five principal ones are:üîΩaspiration,üîΩresolution,üîΩmindfulness,üîΩconcentration, and

original: 'dun pa dang / mos pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab bo //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / mos pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab bo //
translated: wisdom.

original: yid la byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yid la byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is attention?

original: sems kyi rtsol ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rtsol ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is mental activity.

original: reg pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is contact?

original: gsum 'dus pa las don 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa las don 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the grasping of an object by the union of the three.

original: tshor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is feeling?

original: gsum 'dus pa las don so sor myong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa las don so sor myong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the experience of an object by the union of the three.

original: 'du shes gang zhe na /üîΩgsum 'dus pa nyid @59a * //
analyzed: 'du shes gang zhe na / gsum 'dus pa nyid @59a * //
translated: What is perception?

original: las dmigs par 'dogs pa la brdar 'dzin pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: las dmigs par 'dogs pa la brdar 'dzin pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the grasping of the mark of an object by the union of the three.

original: de yang rjes su sad pa dang / tha snyad bag la nyal ba'o //üîΩde la rjes su sad pa ni 'di lta ste /üîΩlha dang mi tha snyad la mkhas pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de yang rjes su sad pa dang / tha snyad bag la nyal ba'o // de la rjes su sad pa ni 'di lta ste / lha dang mi tha snyad la mkhas pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is also the latent tendency of the expression of a concept.

original: tha snyad bag la nyal ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tha snyad bag la nyal ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The expression of a concept is, for example, the skill in the expression of gods and men.üîΩThe latent tendency of the expression of a concept is, for example, the skill in the expression of infants.

original: byis pa tha snyad la mi mkhas pa rnams dang / tha na ri dvags dang bya rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: byis pa tha snyad la mi mkhas pa rnams dang / tha na ri dvags dang bya rnams kyi'o //
translated: of the ignorant, of the unlearned, of the beasts and birds.

original: sems pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is volition?

original: gsum 'dus pa las dmigs pa de la tshor ba dang / phrad pa dang / 'bral ba'i phyir sems mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa las dmigs pa de la tshor ba dang / phrad pa dang / 'bral ba'i phyir sems mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is mental action which is the cause of the production of the mind.

original: 'dun pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dun pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is desire?

original: yul de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ; de 'dod pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yul de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ; de 'dod pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the wish for a certain object.

original: mos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mos pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is resolution?

original: yul de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / de la nges par 'dzin 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yul de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / de la nges par 'dzin 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the ascertainment of an object which is being examined.

original: dran pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is mindfulness?

original: yul de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / mngon par brjod pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yul de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / mngon par brjod pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is non-forgetting with regard to the object experienced by the mind.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na ;
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na ;
translated: What is concentration?

original: yul de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / nges par sems pa la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yul de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / nges par sems pa la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is one-pointedness of mind.

original: shes rab gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab gang zhe na /
translated: What is wisdom?

original: yul de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / chos rnams rab tu 'byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: yul de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / chos rnams rab tu 'byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the discernment of each and every object, and it is the discernment of the specific and general characteristics of things.

original: de yang rigs pas bskyed pa dang / rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa dang / rigs pa yang ma yin rigs pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rigs pas bskyed pa dang / rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa dang / rigs pa yang ma yin rigs pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pas bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is produced by reasoning, by faith in the word of another, or by the intuition of the saints.

original: de la yid la byed pa las gang dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: de la yid la byed pa las gang dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What is its activity?

original: smras pa / dmigs pa la sems gtod pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / dmigs pa la sems gtod pa'i las can yin no //
translated: It is the activity of fixing the mind on an object.

original: reg pa las gang dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa las gang dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What is contact?

original: tshor ba dang ; 'du shes dang / sems pa rnams kyi rten byed pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang ; 'du shes dang / sems pa rnams kyi rten byed pa'i las can yin no //
translated: It is the activity of the basis of sensation, ideation, and volition.

original: tshor ba las gang dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba las gang dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What is sensation?

original: sred pa skyed pa dang / btang snyoms su 'jog pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: sred pa skyed pa dang / btang snyoms su 'jog pa'i las can yin no //
translated: It is the activity of producing craving and of experiencing pleasure, pain, or neither.

original: 'du shes las gang dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes las gang dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What is ideation?

original: dmigs pa la sems kyis mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / tha snyad 'dogs pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa la sems kyis mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / tha snyad 'dogs pa'i las can yin no //
translated: It is the activity of fixing the mind on the characteristics of an object and of expressing that object by means of a name.

original: sems pa las gang dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: sems pa las gang dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What is the function of thought?

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / lus dang ngag gi las kun nas slong ba'i las can yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / lus dang ngag gi las kun nas slong ba'i las can yin no //
translated: It is the support of discursive thought and the instigation of action of body and speech.

original: 'dun pa las gang dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: 'dun pa las gang dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What is the function of aspiration?

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa skyed pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa skyed pa'i las can yin no //
translated: It is the instigation of the undertaking of vigor.

original: mos pa las gang @59b dang ldan zhe na /üîΩdmigs pa la yon tan nam /
analyzed: mos pa las gang @59b dang ldan zhe na / dmigs pa la yon tan nam /
translated: What is the function of resolution?

original: skyon nam / gnyi ga ma yin pa la mos pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: skyon nam / gnyi ga ma yin pa la mos pa'i las can yin no //
translated: It is the determination of the good qualities of an object, or its faults, or both, or neither.

original: dran pa las gang dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa las gang dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What is the function of memory?

original: yun ring po nas bsams pa dang / byams pa dang / smras pa dran pa rjes su dran par byed pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: yun ring po nas bsams pa dang / byams pa dang / smras pa dran pa rjes su dran par byed pa'i las can yin no //
translated: It is the memory of what has been said and done a long time ago.

original: ting nge 'dzin las gang dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las gang dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What is the function of concentration?

original: shes pa'i rten byed pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i rten byed pa'i las can yin no //
translated: It is the support of knowledge.

original: shes rab las gang dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab las gang dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What is the function of wisdom?

original: spros pa dang / rgyu ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / rjes su mthun par kun tu rtog pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: spros pa dang / rgyu ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / rjes su mthun par kun tu rtog pa'i las can yin no //
translated: It is the action of imagination in conformity with elaboration, movement, affliction, purification, and non-conformity.

original: kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa gang dag yin pa de dag dngos po so sor nges pa gang la skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa gang dag yin pa de dag dngos po so sor nges pa gang la skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the specific object of those that are not universal?

original: smras pa / rnam pa bzhi po 'dod pa dang / nges pa dang / 'dris pa dang / nye bar brtags pa la go rims bzhin du ste /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam pa bzhi po 'dod pa dang / nges pa dang / 'dris pa dang / nye bar brtags pa la go rims bzhin du ste /
translated: It is said: the four types are, respectively, desire, determination, familiarity, and investigation.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab ni tha ma la'o //
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab ni tha ma la'o //
translated: Among them, concentration and wisdom are the last.

original: lhag ma rnams ni go rims bzhin du gong ma gsum la'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni go rims bzhin du gong ma gsum la'o //
translated: The remaining ones are, respectively, the three higher ones.

original: de la de las gzhan pa'i phung po gang dag ming gis bsdus pa /
analyzed: de la de las gzhan pa'i phung po gang dag ming gis bsdus pa /
translated: Among them, those aggregates that are other than those, which are included in name,

original: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag nye bar gnas pa las byung ba yin par brjod par bya'am /
analyzed: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag nye bar gnas pa las byung ba yin par brjod par bya'am /
translated: should be said to arise from the proximate cause of the mind and mental factors.

original: tshor ba pa'am /
analyzed: tshor ba pa'am /
translated: Or should they be said to be feeling,

original: nges pa yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: nges pa yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: or should they be said to be determination?

original: smras pa / de dang rigs mthun pa'i sems la de dang rigs mthun pa nyid yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / de dang rigs mthun pa'i sems la de dang rigs mthun pa nyid yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: He says: The mind that is similar to that should be called ‚Äúsimilar to that.‚Äù

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi po 'di dag ni 'dres par brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi po 'di dag ni 'dres par brjod par bya'i /
translated: These four formless aggregates are said to be mixed,

original: ma 'dres pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa ni ma yin no //
translated: not unmixed.

original: chos 'di dag ni so sor phye na bye brag dmigs par brjod par mi nus so zhes gang gsungs pa de ci'i phyir mtshan nyid tha dad par grub pa rnams 'dres pas bye brag med ces gsungs she na /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni so sor phye na bye brag dmigs par brjod par mi nus so zhes gang gsungs pa de ci'i phyir mtshan nyid tha dad par grub pa rnams 'dres pas bye brag med ces gsungs she na /
translated: It is said that these phenomena cannot be described as observed separately, as distinct. Why is it said that those that are established as having distinct characteristics are not distinct because they are mixed?

original: smras pa / 'dus nas dmigs pa la nye bar spyod pa dang / don rtogs pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dus nas dmigs pa la nye bar spyod pa dang / don rtogs pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: He says: Because they are mixed, they are experienced as observed, and the understanding of the meaning is completed.

original: gzhan du na gang yang rung ba zhig med na don de yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na gang yang rung ba zhig med na don de yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, if any one of them were missing, the meaning would not be completed.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos de dag la ming gi rnam grangs du yod ce na /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos de dag la ming gi rnam grangs du yod ce na /
translated: How many synonyms are there for the phenomena of mind and mental factors?

original: smras pa / rab tu mang ste 'di lta ste /üîΩdmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / mtshungs pa dang ldan pa dang / rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / gnas dang bcas pa zhes bya ba dang / de @60a * //
analyzed: smras pa / rab tu mang ste 'di lta ste / dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / mtshungs pa dang ldan pa dang / rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / gnas dang bcas pa zhes bya ba dang / de @60a * //
translated: He says: They are very many, for example:

original: lta bu dang mthun pa rnams so //
analyzed: lta bu dang mthun pa rnams so //
translated: those that are associated with objects, those that are associated with similar status, those that are associated with aspects, and those that are associated with bases.üîΩAnd so on.

original: mig la sogs pa yang yul yod pa yin na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa yang yul yod pa yin na /
translated: If the eye and so on have objects,

original: ci'i phyir de dag nyid dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag nyid dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: why are they said to be associated with objects?

original: mig la sogs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the eye and so on not?

original: smras pa / de dag ni yul med kyang skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: smras pa / de dag ni yul med kyang skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: He says: They arise even without objects,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but minds and mental factors do not.

original: ci'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa dag ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa dag ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called associated?

original: smras pa / rdzas mtshungs pa dang / yul mtshungs pa dang / dus mtshungs pa dang / bya ba byed pa mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / rdzas mtshungs pa dang / yul mtshungs pa dang / dus mtshungs pa dang / bya ba byed pa mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He says: Because they are the same substance, the same object, the same time, and the same function.

original: ci'i phyir rnam pa dang bcas pa dag ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam pa dang bcas pa dag ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they said to be associated with aspects?

original: smras pa / dmigs pa gcig la rnam pa du ma 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / dmigs pa gcig la rnam pa du ma 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He says: Because many aspects are applied to a single object.

original: ci'i phyir gnas dang bcas pa dag ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnas dang bcas pa dag ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called ‚Äúwith a basis‚Äù?

original: smras pa / gnas sna tshogs la 'jug pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / gnas sna tshogs la 'jug pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He says: Because they are by nature applied to various bases.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos ni 'ga' yang gnas pa med pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos ni 'ga' yang gnas pa med pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: No conditioned phenomenon whatsoever is without a basis.

original: don gyi skabs 'dir bstan pa'i gnas kyi tshad ma ni mi byed do //
analyzed: don gyi skabs 'dir bstan pa'i gnas kyi tshad ma ni mi byed do //
translated: But the measure of a basis as taught in this topic is not made.

original: ci'i phyir bde ba'i tshor ba'i cha mi mthun pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zhes bya /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bde ba'i tshor ba'i cha mi mthun pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zhes bya /
translated: Why is the part of pleasant feeling called ‚Äúpainful feeling‚Äù?

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i cha mi mthun pa de ni bde ba'i tshor ba zhes bya /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i cha mi mthun pa de ni bde ba'i tshor ba zhes bya /
translated: The part of painful feeling is called ‚Äúpleasant feeling.‚Äù

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i cha mi mthun pa ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i cha mi mthun pa ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: The part of pleasant and painful feeling is called ‚Äúneither painful nor pleasant feeling.‚Äù

original: smras pa / rang gi rigs dang cha mi mthun pas cha mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / rang gi rigs dang cha mi mthun pas cha mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He says: Because it is dissimilar to its own type, it is dissimilar.

original: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i cha mthun pa ma rig pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i cha mthun pa ma rig pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the factor of feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant called ignorance?

original: smras pa / tshor ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi grogs yin pas cha mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / tshor ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi grogs yin pas cha mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called ignorance because it is a factor that is a companion to all the afflicted views and to all the other defilements, and because it is a companion to all the feelings and to all the secondary defilements.

original: ci'i phyir ma rig pa'i gnyen po rig pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma rig pa'i gnyen po rig pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the understanding of the truths called the antidote to ignorance?

original: smras pa / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i phyogs kyis gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i phyogs kyis gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called the antidote to ignorance because it is the counteragent to the counteragent.

original: ci'i phyir rig pa'i nye ba'i cha mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rig pa'i nye ba'i cha mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is nirvana called the proximate factor of the understanding of the truths?

original: smras pa / rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pas nye ba'i cha nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pas nye ba'i cha nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called the proximate factor of the understanding of the truths because it is the result of the understanding of the truths.üîΩHow are the four aggregates that are not form established as wholesome?

original: phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po de dag gi dge bar rnam par gzhag pa ni ji lta bu yin /üîΩmi dge bar rnam par gzhag pa ni ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po de dag gi dge bar rnam par gzhag pa ni ji lta bu yin /üîΩmi dge bar rnam par gzhag pa ni ji lta bu yin /
translated: How are they established as unwholesome?

original: lung du ma bstan par rnam par gzhag pa ni ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan par rnam par gzhag pa ni ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of neutral?

original: de dag @60b thams cad bye brag med pa'i sdom ni /
analyzed: de dag @60b thams cad bye brag med pa'i sdom ni /
translated: The summary of all of them is as follows:

original: gnas dang ngo bo nyid dang ni //
analyzed: gnas dang ngo bo nyid dang ni //
translated: The bases of virtue, the nature of virtue,üîΩThe associated, the conventional,

original: mtshungs par ldan dang kun rdzob dang // chung ngu la sogs gzhi dbye dang // yon tan skyon dang mi mthun phyogs //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan dang kun rdzob dang // chung ngu la sogs gzhi dbye dang // yon tan skyon dang mi mthun phyogs //
translated: The classification of small, etc., the qualities, the faults, and the counteragents.

original: de la dge ba'i gnas dag ni du zhe na /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i gnas dag ni du zhe na /
translated: What are the bases of virtue?

original: mdor bsdu na drug ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na drug ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: In brief, there are six:üîΩWhat are the six?

original: nges pa'i dus dang ldog pa'i dus dang / las kyi dus dang / 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa'i dus dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa'i dus dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i dus so //
analyzed: nges pa'i dus dang ldog pa'i dus dang / las kyi dus dang / 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa'i dus dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa'i dus dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i dus so //
translated: The time of certainty, the time of reversal, the time of action, the time of mundane purification, the time of supramundane purification, and the time of benefiting sentient beings.

original: ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of virtue?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: dad pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang ; ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / bag yod pa dang / btang snyoms dang /
analyzed: dad pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang ; ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / bag yod pa dang / btang snyoms dang /
translated: faith,üîΩconscience,üîΩshame,üîΩnonattachment,üîΩnonhatred,üîΩnondelusion,üîΩdiligence,üîΩpliancy,üîΩconscientiousness,üîΩand equanimity.üîΩ

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba ste /
translated: faith, shame, embarrassment, non-greed, non-hatred, non-ignorance, effort, tranquility, non-negligence, and equanimity.üîΩNon-violence is also a root of virtue.

original: de ltar de dag ni dge ba'i chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni dge ba'i chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: These are the essential natures of the virtuous factors.

original: chos de dag ji ltar phan tshun mtshungs par ldan par blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: chos de dag ji ltar phan tshun mtshungs par ldan par blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one view the mutual concomitance of these factors?

original: smras pa / nges pa'i dus na ni tha dad pa dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: smras pa / nges pa'i dus na ni tha dad pa dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: It is said: In the context of certainty, they are concomitant with each other.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa las ldog pa'i dus na ni bdag dang gzhan la brten nas ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang ngo //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa las ldog pa'i dus na ni bdag dang gzhan la brten nas ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang ngo //
translated: In the context of turning away from afflictions, they are shame and embarrassment, based on oneself and others.

original: dge ba'i phyogs kyi las la 'jug pa'i dus na ni ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ngo //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs kyi las la 'jug pa'i dus na ni ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ngo //
translated: In the context of engaging in virtuous actions, they are non-greed, non-hatred, non-ignorance, and effort.

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus na ni shin tu sbyangs pa dang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus na ni shin tu sbyangs pa dang ngo //
translated: At the time of freedom from worldly attachment, it is suppleness.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus na ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus na ni /
translated: At the time of freedom from attachment to the transcendent, it is

original: bag yod pa dang / btang snyoms dang ngo//
analyzed: bag yod pa dang / btang snyoms dang ngo//
translated: carefulness and equanimity.

original: sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i dus na ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang ste de ni snying rjes bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdge ba'i chos de dag las du zhig ni kun rdzob tu yod /
analyzed: sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i dus na ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang ste de ni snying rjes bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro // dge ba'i chos de dag las du zhig ni kun rdzob tu yod /
translated: At the time of benefiting sentient beings, it is nonviolence, because that is included in compassion.

original: du zhig ni rdzas su yod ce na /
analyzed: du zhig ni rdzas su yod ce na /
translated: How many of these virtues exist superficially and how many exist substantially?

original: smras pa / gsum ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin te /üîΩbag yod pa dang / btang snyoms dang ; rnam par mi 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gsum ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin te / bag yod pa dang / btang snyoms dang ; rnam par mi 'tshe ba'o //
translated: Three exist superficially:üîΩcarefulness, equanimity, and nonviolence.

original: bag yod pa dang btang snyoms ni ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi cha yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bag yod pa dang btang snyoms ni ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi cha yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Carefulness and equanimity are parts of nonattachment, nonaversion, nondelusion, and effort.

original: chos de dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i don gyis btang snyoms yin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs @61a * //
analyzed: chos de dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i don gyis btang snyoms yin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs @61a * //
translated: These phenomena are equanimity in the sense that they are devoid of defilement.üîΩ

original: pa'i gnyen po'i don gyis bag yod pa yin par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: pa'i gnyen po'i don gyis bag yod pa yin par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: These factors are considered to be equanimity in the sense of being indifferent to the afflictions and heedfulness in the sense of being the antidote to the afflictions.

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni zhe sdang med pa'i cha yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni zhe sdang med pa'i cha yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-violence is a part of non-hatred.

original: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu gang yin zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'am /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu gang yin zhe na / smras pa / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'am /
translated: What is a small wholesome action?

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chen po'i gnyen po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chen po'i gnyen po gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is a wholesome action of the stage of non-concentration or a wholesome action of the stage of concentration which is the antidote to a small category of defilement.

original: 'bring gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'bring gang zhe na /
translated: What is a medium wholesome action?

original: smras pa / 'jig rten pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i rnam pa 'bring gi gnyen po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'jig rten pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i rnam pa 'bring gi gnyen po gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is a wholesome action of the stage of concentration which is the antidote to a medium category of defilement.

original: chen po gang zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / 'jig rten las 'das pa'am /
analyzed: chen po gang zhe na / smras pa / 'jig rten las 'das pa'am /
translated: What is a great wholesome action?

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu'i gnyen po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu'i gnyen po gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is a wholesome action which is supramundane or a wholesome action which is the antidote to a great category of defilement.

original: yang dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa las kyang chen po nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa las kyang chen po nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The great mental attention is the mental attention that is cultivated for a long time.üîΩThe great field is the field of sentient beings.üîΩThe great things are the things that are given.

original: goms pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / zhing dang / dngos po dang / rnam par dag pa las kyang chen po nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: goms pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / zhing dang / dngos po dang / rnam par dag pa las kyang chen po nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The great purity is the purity of the three sectors.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba skye ba na gzhi du dag las skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba skye ba na gzhi du dag las skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What are the sources of the arising of the roots of virtue?

original: smras pa / mdor bsdu na brgyad las te /
analyzed: smras pa / mdor bsdu na brgyad las te /
translated: In brief, they arise from eight sources:

original: 'di lta ste sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / de las gzhan pa bsgoms pa las byung ba dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / de las gzhan pa bsgoms pa las byung ba dang /
translated: the bases of meritorious action that arise from giving, from morality, from meditation, from learning, from reflection, from other meditations,

original: so sor rtogs pa las byung ba dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i dngos po las so //
analyzed: so sor rtogs pa las byung ba dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i dngos po las so //
translated: from discernment, and from benefiting sentient beings.

original: de la ji skad bstan pa'i gzhi de dag la ci rigs pa tshe 'di dang / tshe phyi ma la 'dod pa dang zhe sdang dang lta ba ngan pa dag las gang yang rung bas sngon kun tu sun phyung ba'i sems kyi rgyud la gang gis kun tu sun phyung ba de'i gnyen pos de dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa yin par lta bar
analyzed: de la ji skad bstan pa'i gzhi de dag la ci rigs pa tshe 'di dang / tshe phyi ma la 'dod pa dang zhe sdang dang lta ba ngan pa dag las gang yang rung bas sngon kun tu sun phyung ba'i sems kyi rgyud la gang gis kun tu sun phyung ba de'i gnyen pos de dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa yin par lta bar
translated: In this regard, one should view the mind-stream of one who has previously been thoroughly disgusted with any of the things that have been taught, whether in this life or the next, by any means whatsoever, whether by desire, hatred, or bad views, as being associated with the antidote to that, and as not being associated with that.

original: bya'o // de la dge ba'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: bya'o // de la dge ba'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of virtue?

original: smras pa / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di lta ste /
translated: It is said:

original: sa'i dngos gzhir rnam pa gcig nas rnam pa bcu'i bar du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sa'i dngos gzhir rnam pa gcig nas rnam pa bcu'i bar du bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught in the Abhidharma as being from one type up to ten types.

original: yang dge ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po las kyang yod do //
analyzed: yang dge ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po las kyang yod do //
translated: Moreover, virtue exists as the antidote to the afflictions,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba las kyang yod do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba las kyang yod do //
translated: and it exists as the pacification of the afflictions.

original: 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa las kyang yod do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa las kyang yod do //
translated: It exists as the result of desire,

original: sems ni rgyud dag pa las kyang yod do //
analyzed: sems ni rgyud dag pa las kyang yod do //
translated: and it exists as the purification of the mind-stream.

original: mchod rten byed pa las kyang yod do //
analyzed: mchod rten byed pa las kyang yod do //
translated: It exists as the making of a stupa,üîΩand it exists as the worship of the Tathagata.

original: sems can la phan @61b 'dogs pa las kyang yod do //
analyzed: sems can la phan @61b 'dogs pa las kyang yod do //
translated: It also exists in the form of benefitting sentient beings.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de dag ni dge ba'i rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de dag ni dge ba'i rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These and other such distinctions should be understood as the classification of virtue.

original: de la dge ba la nyes dmigs ni med do //
analyzed: de la dge ba la nyes dmigs ni med do //
translated: There is no disadvantage to virtue.

original: de'i phan yon gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phan yon gang zhe na /
translated: What are its benefits?

original: smras pa / dge ba'i phan yon ni mang ste /
analyzed: smras pa / dge ba'i phan yon ni mang ste /
translated: It is said: The benefits of virtue are many.

original: 'di lta ste nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang bag la nyal la sems rnam par sbyong bar byed pa dang / dmigs pa la phyin ci log med par byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba brtan par byed pa dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i 'du shes kyi rgyud la 'jug par byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang bag la nyal la sems rnam par sbyong bar byed pa dang / dmigs pa la phyin ci log med par byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba brtan par byed pa dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i 'du shes kyi rgyud la 'jug par byed pa dang /
translated: They are as follows: purifying the mind from the entanglements and latent dispositions of the afflictions, eliminating error with regard to the object, stabilizing the roots of virtue, engaging in the continuum of the discernment that arises from natural outflow,

original: bdag la gnod par mi 'gyur ba dang / gzhan la gnod par mi 'gyur ba dang / gnyi ga la gnod par mi 'gyur ba dang / tshe 'di'i kha na ma tho ba 'phel bar mi 'gyur ba dang / tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba 'phel bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: bdag la gnod par mi 'gyur ba dang / gzhan la gnod par mi 'gyur ba dang / gnyi ga la gnod par mi 'gyur ba dang / tshe 'di'i kha na ma tho ba 'phel bar mi 'gyur ba dang / tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba 'phel bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: It is not harmful to oneself, not harmful to others, and not harmful to both. It does not increase the misdeeds of this life, nor does it increase the misdeeds of the next life.üîΩIt does not increase the misdeeds of this life and the next. It causes one to experience the happiness and mental joy that arise from it, it causes the exhaustion of the suffering of birth and so on, it causes the increase of interest in nirvana,

original: tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba 'phel bar mi 'gyur ba dang / de las byung ba'i bde ba dang yid bde ba so sor myong bar byed pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal zad par byed pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mos pa 'phel bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba 'phel bar mi 'gyur ba dang / de las byung ba'i bde ba dang yid bde ba so sor myong bar byed pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal zad par byed pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mos pa 'phel bar byed pa dang /
translated: and it causes the increase of the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation.

original: de la yang sbyor bar byed pa dang / longs spyod nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / 'khor gyi nang du bag 'khums pa med de sro bzang ba dang / 'jigs pa med par 'gro bar 'gyur ba dang / phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su snyan pa rgya chen po grags par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de la yang sbyor bar byed pa dang / longs spyod nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / 'khor gyi nang du bag 'khums pa med de sro bzang ba dang / 'jigs pa med par 'gro bar 'gyur ba dang / phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su snyan pa rgya chen po grags par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They are: one is able to apply oneself to virtue; one‚Äôs enjoyments are not wasted; one is not timid in the midst of an assembly; one has a good reputation; one goes fearlessly; one‚Äôs good name spreads in all directions;

original: dam pa rnams kyis bsngags par 'gyur ba dang / 'gyod pa med par 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba dang / lus zhi gnas kyang bde 'gror skye bar 'gyur ba dang ; dge ba'i chos rnams las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyis bsngags par 'gyur ba dang / 'gyod pa med par 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba dang / lus zhi gnas kyang bde 'gror skye bar 'gyur ba dang ; dge ba'i chos rnams las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: one is praised by holy beings; one dies without regret; one‚Äôs body is at ease; one is born in a happy realm; one does not fall away from virtuous qualities;

original: bdag gi don rjes su thob par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gi don rjes su thob par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: and one attains one‚Äôs own aim.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni dge ba'i phan yon mang po dag yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni dge ba'i phan yon mang po dag yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: These and others like them should be regarded as the many benefits of virtue.

original: de la dge ba'i gnyen po las ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i gnyen po las ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: How are the benefits of virtue to be known?

original: smras pa / rnam pa bco lnga ste /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam pa bco lnga ste /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúThere are fifteen types.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rnam par sun 'byin pa gnyen po dang / spong ba gnyen po dang / kun tu 'dzin pa gnyen po dang / thag bsrings pa gnyen po dang / 'dod cing khas blangs pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i gnyen po dang / 'dod cing khas blangs pa med pa'i @62a * //
analyzed: rnam par sun 'byin pa gnyen po dang / spong ba gnyen po dang / kun tu 'dzin pa gnyen po dang / thag bsrings pa gnyen po dang / 'dod cing khas blangs pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i gnyen po dang / 'dod cing khas blangs pa med pa'i @62a * //
translated: The antidote of complete rejection, the antidote of abandonment, the antidote of complete acceptance, the antidote of distance, the antidote of desire and commitment, the antidote of non-desire and non-commitment,

original: kun nas dkris pa'i gnyen po dang / bag la nyal gyi gnyen po dang / nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i gnyen po dang / nyon mongs pa 'bring gi gnyen po dang / nyon mongs pa chen po'i gnyen po dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po dang /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa'i gnyen po dang / bag la nyal gyi gnyen po dang / nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i gnyen po dang / nyon mongs pa 'bring gi gnyen po dang / nyon mongs pa chen po'i gnyen po dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po dang /
translated: the antidote of latent states, the antidote of small afflictions, the antidote of medium afflictions, the antidote of great afflictions, the antidote of distraction,

original: gzhan 'debs pa'i gnyen po dang / rtse 'jil ba'i gnyen po dang / rnam par gnon pa'i gnyen po dang / bral ba'i gnyen po las so //
analyzed: gzhan 'debs pa'i gnyen po dang / rtse 'jil ba'i gnyen po dang / rnam par gnon pa'i gnyen po dang / bral ba'i gnyen po las so //
translated: the antidote of planting, the antidote of suppression, the antidote of subjugation, and the antidote of separation.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams ni gnas gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams ni gnas gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: Afflicted phenomena are distinguished by two bases.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: by the defilements and the secondary defilements.

original: de la re zhig nyon mongs pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig nyon mongs pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here, first of all, the defilements should be explained.

original: de'i 'og tu ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams bshad par bya'o //
translated: Then, the secondary defilements should be explained.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnas du yod ce na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnas du yod ce na /
translated: How many bases of the defilements are there?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / drug ste /
analyzed: smras pa / drug ste /
translated: There are six:

original: ma rig pa dang bcas shing yid du 'ong la kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi yul dang / ma rig pa dang bcas shing yid du mi 'ong ba la kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi yul dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang bcas shing kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi yul dang /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang bcas shing yid du 'ong la kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi yul dang / ma rig pa dang bcas shing yid du mi 'ong ba la kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi yul dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang bcas shing kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi yul dang /
translated: the object of the defilements that is associated with nescience and is agreeable, the object of the defilements that is associated with nescience and is disagreeable, the object of the defilements that is associated with improper mental attention,

original: ma rig pa dang bcas shing rang gi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams dang / sems can dman pa dang / mtshungs pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa rnams dang thob par bya ba ma thob pa la phyin ci log dang / yon tan la phyin ci log dang /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang bcas shing rang gi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams dang / sems can dman pa dang / mtshungs pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa rnams dang thob par bya ba ma thob pa la phyin ci log dang / yon tan la phyin ci log dang /
translated: It is associated with ignorance and the five appropriated aggregates,üîΩand it is the perversion of not obtaining what is to be obtained in relation to inferior, equal, and superior sentient beings, the perversion of qualities,

original: ma rig pa dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang bcas shing dam pa ma yin pa'i chos nyan pa dang / ma rig pa dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang bcas shing dam pa ma yin pa'i chos nyan pa dang le lo'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang bcas shing dam pa ma yin pa'i chos nyan pa dang / ma rig pa dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang bcas shing dam pa ma yin pa'i chos nyan pa dang le lo'o //
translated: and the perversion of views. It is associated with ignorance, incorrect mental application, listening to the teachings of inferior persons, and laziness.

original: de la dang po ni phrad par mngon par dga' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dang po ni phrad par mngon par dga' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The first is due to the delight in contact.

original: gnyis pa ni 'bral bar mngon par dga' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'bral bar mngon par dga' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The second is due to the delight in separation.

original: gsum pa ni yul la phyin ci log pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa ni yul la phyin ci log pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The third is due to the perversion of objects.

original: bzhi pa ni 'gran cing mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni 'gran cing mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fourth is the basis of the pride of rivalry.

original: lnga pa ni log pa'i chos la mngon par zhen cing sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lnga pa ni log pa'i chos la mngon par zhen cing sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fifth is the basis of the adherence to false doctrines and the practice of them.

original: drug pa ni sgrub pa dang ldog par mi byed pa'i phyir gnas yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: drug pa ni sgrub pa dang ldog par mi byed pa'i phyir gnas yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The sixth is the basis of the non-performance of what should be performed and the performance of what should not be performed.

original: nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the defilements?

original: de yang rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa drug ste /
translated: It is of six kinds:

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / ma rig pa dang / @62b nga rgyal dang / lta ba dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / ma rig pa dang / @62b nga rgyal dang / lta ba dang / the tshom mo //
translated: attachment, hatred, ignorance, pride, false views, and doubt.

original: nyon mongs pa gang dang nyon mongs pa gang mtshungs par ldan par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang dang nyon mongs pa gang mtshungs par ldan par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: With which defilements are the defilements associated?

original: smras pa / ma rig pa ni thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / ma rig pa ni thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
translated: It is said that ignorance is associated with all.

original: the tshom ni gang dang yang ma yin no //
analyzed: the tshom ni gang dang yang ma yin no //
translated: Doubt is not associated with any.

original: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba ni phan tshun ma yin no ;
analyzed: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba ni phan tshun ma yin no ;
translated: Attachment and hatred are not associated with each other.

original: /'dod chags dang khong khro ba nyid ni nga rgyal dang lta ba dang ste /
analyzed: /'dod chags dang khong khro ba nyid ni nga rgyal dang lta ba dang ste /
translated: Attachment and aversion are concomitant with pride and views,

original: lan 'ga' gang gi tshe chags par gyur pa na rlom par byed pa'am rtog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan 'ga' gang gi tshe chags par gyur pa na rlom par byed pa'am rtog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when one is attached, one becomes conceited or has a false view.

original: chags par gyur pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: chags par gyur pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as with attachment, so it is with aversion.

original: nga rgyal dang lta ba yang lan 'ga' phan tshun mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang lta ba yang lan 'ga' phan tshun mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: Pride and views are also sometimes concomitant with each other,

original: gang gi tshe rlom par gyur pa na rtog par byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnyon mongs pa de dag las du zhig ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rlom par gyur pa na rtog par byed pa'i phyir ro // nyon mongs pa de dag las du zhig ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin /
translated: because when one is conceited, one has a false view.

original: du zhig ni rdzas su yod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig ni rdzas su yod pa yin zhe na /
translated: Among these afflictions, how many are conventional existences and how many are substantial existences?

original: smras pa / lta ba ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / lta ba ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin te /
translated: It is said: Views are conventional existences,

original: shes rab kyi cha yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi cha yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are a part of wisdom.

original: lhag ma rnams ni rdzas su yod pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba dag yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni rdzas su yod pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba dag yin no //
translated: The remaining ones are substantial existences and are mental factors.

original: de dag ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen por rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen por rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How are they classified as small, medium, and great?

original: smras pa / gang dag thams cad kyi tha mar spong bar 'gyur ba de dag ni chung ngu dag yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / gang dag thams cad kyi tha mar spong bar 'gyur ba de dag ni chung ngu dag yin no //
translated: They are small when they are abandoned at the end,

original: gang dag bar du spong bar 'gyur ba de dag ni 'bring dag yin no //
analyzed: gang dag bar du spong bar 'gyur ba de dag ni 'bring dag yin no //
translated: medium when they are abandoned in the middle,

original: gang dag dang por spong bar 'gyur ba de dag ni chen po dag yin no //
analyzed: gang dag dang por spong bar 'gyur ba de dag ni chen po dag yin no //
translated: and great when they are abandoned at the beginning.

original: yang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi chen po nyid ni rnam pa drug gis rig par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi chen po nyid ni rnam pa drug gis rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, the greatness of the defilements should be understood in six ways:üîΩThey are great by nature, as in the case of the defilements of the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa na skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa ni rang bzhin gyis chen po yin par rig par bya ba dang ; de bzhin du sngon goms pa dang / de bzhin du gnas la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa ni rang bzhin gyis chen po yin par rig par bya ba dang ; de bzhin du sngon goms pa dang / de bzhin du gnas la gnas pa ste /
translated: They are great by former habituation.

original: dbang po yongs su smin pa rnams kyi gang yin pa dang / de bzhin du bsgrub tu mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po yongs su smin pa rnams kyi gang yin pa dang / de bzhin du bsgrub tu mi rung ba ste /
translated: They are great by the support, as in the case of those whose faculties are mature.üîΩThey are great by the object, as in the case of the great things.

original: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can rnams kyi gang yin pa dang / de bzhin du gnas ma yin pa bla ma dang sbyin gnas la sogs pa ngag la 'jug pa gang yin pa dang / las dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can rnams kyi gang yin pa dang / de bzhin du gnas ma yin pa bla ma dang sbyin gnas la sogs pa ngag la 'jug pa gang yin pa dang / las dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The great is the defilement that is not subject to complete cessation, that which is not the domain of the disciples and the solitary Buddhas, and that which is the cause of the great deeds of the Buddhas.üîΩThe great is also the defilement that is not subject to complete cessation in the case of those who are not subject to complete cessation, and likewise, that which is not the domain of the disciples and the solitary Buddhas, and that which is the cause of the great deeds of the Buddhas.üîΩThe great is also the defilement that is not the domain of the disciples and the solitary Buddhas, and that which is the cause of the great deeds of the Buddhas.

original: las kun nas slong ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de ni chen po nyid yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩnyon mongs pa skye ba na gang las skye bar 'gyur ba'i nyon mongs pa @63a * //
analyzed: las kun nas slong ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de ni chen po nyid yin par rig par bya'o // nyon mongs pa skye ba na gang las skye bar 'gyur ba'i nyon mongs pa @63a * //
translated: The great is also the defilement that is not the domain of the disciples and the solitary Buddhas, and that which is the cause of the great deeds of the Buddhas.üîΩThe great is also the defilement that is not the domain of the disciples and the solitary Buddhas, and that which is the cause of the great deeds of the Buddhas.üîΩThe great is also the defilement that is not the domain of the disciples and the solitary Buddhas, and that which is the cause of the great deeds of the Buddhas.üîΩThe great is also the defilement that is not the domain of the disciples and the solitary Buddhas, and that which is the cause of the great deeds of the Buddhas.

original: rnams kyi gzhi gang zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / 'dod chags kyi gzhi ni bcu ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnams kyi gzhi gang zhe na / smras pa / 'dod chags kyi gzhi ni bcu ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The great is also the defilement that is not the domain of the disciples and the solitary Buddhas, and that which is the cause of the great deeds of the Buddhas.üîΩThe great is also the defilement that is not the domain of the disciples and the solitary Buddhas, and that which is the cause of the great deeds of the Buddhas.üîΩThe great is also the defilement that is not the domain of the disciples and the solitary Buddhas, and that which is the cause of the great deeds of the Buddhas.üîΩThe great is also the defilement that is not the domain of the disciples and the solitary Buddhas, and that which is the cause of the great deeds of the Buddhas.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams dang / lta ba rnams dang / ma thob pa'i yul dang / thob pa'i yul dang / spyad nas 'das pa'i yul dang / nyes par spyad pa dang / bu dang 'dris pa dang / yo byad dang / yang 'byung ba dang /üîΩ'jig pa rnams so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams dang / lta ba rnams dang / ma thob pa'i yul dang / thob pa'i yul dang / spyad nas 'das pa'i yul dang / nyes par spyad pa dang / bu dang 'dris pa dang / yo byad dang / yang 'byung ba dang /üîΩ'jig pa rnams so //
translated: The great is also the defilement that is not the domain of the disciples and the solitary Buddhas, and that which is the cause of the great deeds of the Buddhas.üîΩThe great is also the defilement that is not the domain of the disciples and the solitary Buddhas, and that which is the cause of the great deeds of the Buddhas.

original: gzhi gang las 'dod chags ci 'dra ba 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi gang las 'dod chags ci 'dra ba 'byung zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of desire?

original: smras pa / bcu po dag las bcu po rnams go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: smras pa / bcu po dag las bcu po rnams go rims bzhin te /
translated: It is said that the ten desires arise from the ten bases,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: in the following order:

original: dngos po'i 'dod chags dang / lta ba'i 'dod chags dang / chags pa'i 'dod chags dang / ser sna'i 'dod chags dang / sgrib pa'i 'dod chags dang / nyes par spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang / bu tsha'i 'dod chags dang / phyogs dang 'khor gyi 'dod chags dang /
analyzed: dngos po'i 'dod chags dang / lta ba'i 'dod chags dang / chags pa'i 'dod chags dang / ser sna'i 'dod chags dang / sgrib pa'i 'dod chags dang / nyes par spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang / bu tsha'i 'dod chags dang / phyogs dang 'khor gyi 'dod chags dang /
translated: desire for things, desire for views, desire for attachment, desire for miserliness, desire for obscuration, desire for bad conduct, desire for children, desire for followers,

original: yo byad kyi 'dod chags dang / yang 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: yo byad kyi 'dod chags dang / yang 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: desire for possessions, and desire for rebirth and destruction.

original: khong khro ba'i gzhi yang bcu ste /
analyzed: khong khro ba'i gzhi yang bcu ste /
translated: There are ten bases of anger:

original: bdag nyid dang sems can sdug pa rnams dang / sems can mi sdug pa rnams dang / 'das pa na gnod pa dang / phan pa byas pa dang / ma 'ongs pa na gnod pa dang / phan pa byed par 'gyur ba dang / da ltar byung ba na gnod pa dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid dang sems can sdug pa rnams dang / sems can mi sdug pa rnams dang / 'das pa na gnod pa dang / phan pa byas pa dang / ma 'ongs pa na gnod pa dang / phan pa byed par 'gyur ba dang / da ltar byung ba na gnod pa dang /
translated: oneself, sentient beings who are dear, sentient beings who are not dear, harm and benefit done in the past, harm and benefit that will be done in the future, harm and benefit done in the present,

original: phan pa byed pa dang / yul yid du mi 'ong ba dang / phrag dog dang / sngon goms pa dang / gzhan du blta ba ste /
analyzed: phan pa byed pa dang / yul yid du mi 'ong ba dang / phrag dog dang / sngon goms pa dang / gzhan du blta ba ste /
translated: 1. the benefit of others, 2. the benefit of oneself, 3. the benefit of both, 4. the benefit of the present life, 5. the benefit of the future life, 6. the benefit of both, 7. the benefit of the Dharma, 8. the benefit of the world, 9. the benefit of the lesser person, 10. the benefit of the great person.

original: de dag las khong khro ba rnam pa bcu rim bzhin du skye bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las khong khro ba rnam pa bcu rim bzhin du skye bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The ten kinds of anger should be understood as arising in order from these ten benefits.

original: de la gzhi drug las ni kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po dgu po dag rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la gzhi drug las ni kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po dgu po dag rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: From these six bases, the nine bases of malice should be understood as established.

original: de dag thams cad ni sems can la khong khro ba sha stag yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni sems can la khong khro ba sha stag yin no //
translated: All of them are only anger toward sentient beings.

original: de las gzhan pa dag las ni yul la khong khro ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag las ni yul la khong khro ba'o //
translated: Anger toward objects arises from the other ones.

original: mi bzod pa sngon du 'gro ba sems can la khong khro ba dang / goms pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / de bzhin du blta bas khong khro ba de dag ni mdor bsdu na khong khro ba rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi bzod pa sngon du 'gro ba sems can la khong khro ba dang / goms pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / de bzhin du blta bas khong khro ba de dag ni mdor bsdu na khong khro ba rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Anger toward sentient beings is preceded by impatience, and anger toward views is preceded by habituation. In brief, these are the three kinds of anger:

original: sems can la khong khro ba dang / yul la khong khro ba dang / lta ba la khong khro ba'o //
analyzed: sems can la khong khro ba dang / yul la khong khro ba dang / lta ba la khong khro ba'o //
translated: anger toward sentient beings, anger toward objects, and anger toward views.

original: ma rig pa skye ba'i gzhi ni bdun te /
analyzed: ma rig pa skye ba'i gzhi ni bdun te /
translated: There are seven bases for the arising of ignorance.üîΩ

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: There are seven bases for the origination of ignorance:

original: dus kyi gzhi dang / 'jig rten gnas pa'i gzhi dang / 'pho ba'i gzhi dang / mchog gi gzhi dang / de kho na'i gzhi dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi dang rnam @63b par byang pa'i gzhi dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gzhi'o //üîΩgzhi de dag las mi shes pa rnam pa bdun nam /
analyzed: dus kyi gzhi dang / 'jig rten gnas pa'i gzhi dang / 'pho ba'i gzhi dang / mchog gi gzhi dang / de kho na'i gzhi dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi dang rnam @63b par byang pa'i gzhi dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gzhi'o // gzhi de dag las mi shes pa rnam pa bdun nam /
translated: the base of time, the base of the world, the base of transmigration, the base of the highest, the base of reality, the base of defilement, and the base of purification.

original: rnam pa bcu dgur blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu dgur blta bar bya'o //
translated: From these bases, ignorance should be seen as sevenfold or nineteenfold.

original: de la dang po ni sgo gsum nas the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dang po ni sgo gsum nas the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The first is the base of time, because doubt arises from three doors.

original: gnyis pa ni so so nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi rol dang / gnyi ga la bdag dang ; bdag gi dang / mdza' bshes la sogs pa'i phyogs su lta ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni so so nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi rol dang / gnyi ga la bdag dang ; bdag gi dang / mdza' bshes la sogs pa'i phyogs su lta ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is the base of the world, because the view of self and what belongs to self and the view of friends, etc. arise with regard to the six internal sense spheres, the external, and both.

original: gsum pa ni las dang rnam pa smin pa dang / de gnyi ga la byed pa po dang / tshor ba pa po dang / rgyu med pa dang / mi mthun pa rgyur lta ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa ni las dang rnam pa smin pa dang / de gnyi ga la byed pa po dang / tshor ba pa po dang / rgyu med pa dang / mi mthun pa rgyur lta ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The third is the view of action, of the aspect of action, of the ripening of action, of the agent in both of these, of the experiencer, of the absence of cause, and of the absence of reason.

original: bzhi pa ni dkon mchog gsum la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni dkon mchog gsum la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fourth is the view that denies the Three Jewels.

original: lnga pa ni bden pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lnga pa ni bden pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fifth is the view that denies the truths.

original: drug pa ni log par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drug pa ni log par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sixth is the view that denies the practice.

original: bdun pa ni bdag gi don ma thob pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdun pa ni bdag gi don ma thob pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The seventh is the view that is the overweening pride of one who has not attained his own aim.

original: nga rgyal skye ba'i gzhi ni drug ste /üîΩsems can dman pa rnams dang / sems can mtshungs pa rnams dang / sems can khyad par du 'phags pa rnams dang / so so nang gi nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams dang / thob par bya ba ma thob pa la phyin ci log dang /
analyzed: nga rgyal skye ba'i gzhi ni drug ste / sems can dman pa rnams dang / sems can mtshungs pa rnams dang / sems can khyad par du 'phags pa rnams dang / so so nang gi nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams dang / thob par bya ba ma thob pa la phyin ci log dang /
translated: There are six bases of pride:

original: yon tan la phyin ci log pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan la phyin ci log pa ste /
translated: inferior beings, equal beings, superior beings, the internal appropriated aggregates, the error of what is not attained as attained, and the error of qualities.

original: de dag las nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal la sogs pa nga rgyal rnam pa bdun skye'o ;
analyzed: de dag las nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal la sogs pa nga rgyal rnam pa bdun skye'o ;
translated: From these seven types of pride, seven types of pride arise, such as pride of pride.

original: / de la sems can khyad par du 'phags pa'i gzhi las ni nga rgyal rnam pa gnyis skye'o //
analyzed: / de la sems can khyad par du 'phags pa'i gzhi las ni nga rgyal rnam pa gnyis skye'o //
translated: Two types of pride arise from the basis of a superior sentient being.

original: gzhi lhag ma rnams las ni nga rgyal re re skye'o //
analyzed: gzhi lhag ma rnams las ni nga rgyal re re skye'o //
translated: Each of the remaining bases gives rise to one type of pride.

original: lta ba rnams skye ba'i gzhi ni gnyis te /
analyzed: lta ba rnams skye ba'i gzhi ni gnyis te /
translated: The bases for the arising of the views are twofold:

original: sgro 'dogs pa'i gzhi dang / skur ba 'debs pa'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'i gzhi dang / skur ba 'debs pa'i gzhi'o //
translated: the basis for superimposition and the basis for denial.

original: de la sgro 'dogs pa'i gzhi ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la sgro 'dogs pa'i gzhi ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The basis for superimposition is fourfold:

original: bdag yod par sgro 'dogs pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid du sgro 'dogs pa dang / mngon par mtho ba'i thabs su sgro 'dogs pa dang / thar pa'i thabs su sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag yod par sgro 'dogs pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid du sgro 'dogs pa dang / mngon par mtho ba'i thabs su sgro 'dogs pa dang / thar pa'i thabs su sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: superimposition of existence of a self, superimposition of permanence or impermanence, superimposition of a means to higher rebirth, and superimposition of a means to liberation.

original: skur pa 'debs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Denial is also fourfold:

original: rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa dang / 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa dang / byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa dang / yod pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa dang / 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa dang / byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa dang / yod pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: Denial of cause, denial of effect, denial of action, and denial of existent things.

original: de la sbyin pa med do zhes bya ba nas legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par spyad pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar ni rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa'o //üîΩlegs par spyad pa @64a * //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa med do zhes bya ba nas legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par spyad pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar ni rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa'o // legs par spyad pa @64a * //
translated: Denial of giving, and so on up to denial of good and bad actions is denial of cause.

original: dang nyes par spyod pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: dang nyes par spyod pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: Denial of the maturation of the results of good and bad actions is denial of effect.

original: 'jig rten 'di med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Denial of this world and the world beyond,

original: sems can rdzus te skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i bar ni byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: sems can rdzus te skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i bar ni byed pa la skur ba 'debs pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: and denial of the existence of spontaneously born beings is to be regarded as denial of action.

original: 'di ltar byed pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi skabs 'dir skyes bu'i byed pa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar byed pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi skabs 'dir skyes bu'i byed pa la bya ste /
translated: For in this context, action means the action of a person.

original: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: And that is of four kinds:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / sa bon 'debs pa dang / mngal 'dzin pa dang / yang 'byung ba'i las skyes bu'i byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / sa bon 'debs pa dang / mngal 'dzin pa dang / yang 'byung ba'i las skyes bu'i byed pa'o //
translated: coming, going, planting seeds, taking up a womb, and the activity of the person who is born again.

original: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa dag med do zhes skur pa 'debs pa de dag la sogs pa ni yod pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa dag med do zhes skur pa 'debs pa de dag la sogs pa ni yod pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who deny the existence of arhats in the world are said to deny the existence of real things.

original: gzhi brgyad dam gnyis po de dag la lta ba lnga skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhi brgyad dam gnyis po de dag la lta ba lnga skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The five views arise in relation to these eight or two bases.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / log par lta ba'o //
translated: the view of the transitory collection, extreme views, holding a view as paramount, holding ethics and spiritual disciplines as paramount, and wrong views.

original: gzhan yang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba skye ba'i gzhi ni sngon gyi mthar rtog pa rnams dang / phyi ma'i mthar rtog pa rnams kyi gzhi drug cu rtsa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba skye ba'i gzhi ni sngon gyi mthar rtog pa rnams dang / phyi ma'i mthar rtog pa rnams kyi gzhi drug cu rtsa gnyis yin te /
translated: Moreover, the sixty-two bases of speculation about the past and future are the bases for the arising of extreme views and wrong views.

original: de dag ni mdo las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni mdo las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: These should be understood according to the sutras.

original: gzhi de dag gi bye brag nyid kyi lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi de dag gi bye brag nyid kyi lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: From these bases, there are sixty-two views.

original: the tshom skye ba'i gzhi ni drug ste /
analyzed: the tshom skye ba'i gzhi ni drug ste /
translated: There are six bases for doubt:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: 1.üîΩhearing bad teachings,üîΩ2.üîΩseeing wrong practice of the holy teachings,üîΩ3.üîΩseeing different practices among those who have faith,üîΩ4.

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos nyan pa dang / ston pa log par bsgrub pa mthong ba dang / skur pa rnams dang / yid ches pa rnams kyis lugs tha dad pa mthong ba dang / rang bzhin gyis dman zhing mong rtul ba nyid dang /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos nyan pa dang / ston pa log par bsgrub pa mthong ba dang / skur pa rnams dang / yid ches pa rnams kyis lugs tha dad pa mthong ba dang / rang bzhin gyis dman zhing mong rtul ba nyid dang /
translated: natural inferiority and dullness,üîΩ5.üîΩthe profound nature of the teachings,üîΩand 6.

original: rang bzhin gyis zab pa nyid kyi chos rnams dang / chos rgya chen po rab tu bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zab pa nyid kyi chos rnams dang / chos rgya chen po rab tu bstan pa nyid do //
translated: the extensive teachings.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of the defilements?

original: de dag thams cad kyi rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa bco lnga ste ;
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa bco lnga ste ;
translated: There are fifteen classifications of all of them:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.üîΩüîΩ

original: nyon mongs pa nang du bltas pa dang / phyir bltas pa dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / 'dod cing khas blangs pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang ldan pa dang / 'dod cing khas blangs pa med pa'i kun nas dkris pa @64b dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa nang du bltas pa dang / phyir bltas pa dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / 'dod cing khas blangs pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang ldan pa dang / 'dod cing khas blangs pa med pa'i kun nas dkris pa @64b dang ldan pa dang /
translated: Afflictions are of the type that are abandoned by seeing the truths, the type that are abandoned by cultivation, the type that are associated with the entanglements of desire and approval, the type that are associated with the entanglements of nondesire and disapproval,

original: bag la nyal dang ldan pa dang / chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / rnam par g-yeng pa'i gnas skabs dang / gzhan 'debs pa'i gnas skabs dang / rtse 'jil ba'i gnas skabs dang / rnam par gnon pa'i gnas skabs dang /
analyzed: bag la nyal dang ldan pa dang / chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / rnam par g-yeng pa'i gnas skabs dang / gzhan 'debs pa'i gnas skabs dang / rtse 'jil ba'i gnas skabs dang / rnam par gnon pa'i gnas skabs dang /
translated: the type that are associated with latent propensities, the small, medium, and great types, the type that is a state of distraction, the type that is a state of planting, the type that is a state of play, the type that is a state of subjugation,

original: bral ba'i gnas skabs so ;
analyzed: bral ba'i gnas skabs so ;
translated: and the type that is a state of separation.

original: / nyon mongs pa rnams la phan yon ni med do //
analyzed: / nyon mongs pa rnams la phan yon ni med do //
translated: Afflictions have no benefits.

original: nyes dmigs mang po rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes dmigs mang po rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the many faults?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa'i dngos gzhir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa'i dngos gzhir 'di lta ste /
translated: In the Stage of the Basic Section of the YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi ≈öƒÅstra, it says:

original: kun nas dkris pa la sems kyi rgyud kun nas nyon mongs par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa la sems kyi rgyud kun nas nyon mongs par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher bstan pa'o //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe entanglements thoroughly afflict the mind continuum.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa ni gang gi gnyen po yang ma yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩ'o na sred pa la brten te sred pa spong bar byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni gang gi gnyen po yang ma yin par rig par bya'o // 'o na sred pa la brten te sred pa spong bar byed do //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe mental afflictions are not antidotes to themselves.‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äú How is it that one abandons craving by relying on craving?

original: nga rgyal la brten te nga rgyal spong bar byed do zhes gang gsungs pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: nga rgyal la brten te nga rgyal spong bar byed do zhes gang gsungs pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it that one abandons pride by relying on pride?‚Äù

original: de ni nyon mongs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThese are not mental afflictions.‚Äù

original: sems mngon par 'du byed pa ni dge ba yin te /
analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed pa ni dge ba yin te /
