translated: The mental formations are virtuous.

original: de ni 'dod pa dang khengs pa'i rnam pa dang chos mthun pa'i phyir sred pa dang nga rgyal zhes bya bar zad de /
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa dang khengs pa'i rnam pa dang chos mthun pa'i phyir sred pa dang nga rgyal zhes bya bar zad de /
translated: They are called craving and pride because they are similar to craving and pride in the sense that they are forms of desire and arrogance.

original: sems kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bco lnga sngar ji skad bstan pa dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni nyon mongs pa bco lnga po dag yin par blta bar bya'o ;
analyzed: sems kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bco lnga sngar ji skad bstan pa dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni nyon mongs pa bco lnga po dag yin par blta bar bya'o ;
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe fifteen mental factors that are antidotes to the mental afflictions should be understood as the fifteen mental factors that are adverse to the mental afflictions.‚Äù

original: / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of the secondary mental afflictions?

original: de ni rnam pa dgur blta bar bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste phan tshun lhan cig gnas pa dang / gcig la gcig gleng ba dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / 'tsho ba nyams pa dang / bla ma rnams la mi 'dud pa dang / mi bzod pa dang ; lhag pa'i tshul khrims nyams pa dang /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa dgur blta bar bya ste / 'di lta ste phan tshun lhan cig gnas pa dang / gcig la gcig gleng ba dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / 'tsho ba nyams pa dang / bla ma rnams la mi 'dud pa dang / mi bzod pa dang ; lhag pa'i tshul khrims nyams pa dang /
translated: It should be regarded as being of nine types:

original: lhag pa'i sems nyams pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab nyams pa'o //üîΩngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems nyams pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab nyams pa'o // ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: mutual rivalry, mutual slander, loss of material resources, loss of reputation, loss of ethical discipline, loss of view, loss of generosity, loss of higher ethical discipline, and loss of higher wisdom.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What is their essential nature?üîΩIt should be regarded as being of ten types:

original: khong khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / rgyags pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / ngo tsha med pa dang /
analyzed: khong khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / rgyags pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / ngo tsha med pa dang /
translated: anger, malice, hypocrisy, viciousness, envy, stinginess, deceit, guile, arrogance, and violence.

original: khrel med pa dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / bag med pa dang / brjed ngas pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / 'gyod pa dang /
analyzed: khrel med pa dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / bag med pa dang / brjed ngas pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / 'gyod pa dang /
translated: Shamelessness, torpor, excitation, lack of faith, laziness, carelessness, forgetfulness, distraction, lack of vigilance, regret,

original: gnyid dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / @65a * //üîΩde ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyid dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / @65a * // de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa 'di lta ste /
translated: sleep, discursive thought, and discursive investigation.

original: sa'i dngos gzhir rgya cher bstan pa dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i dngos gzhir rgya cher bstan pa dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Such are the natures of the secondary mental afflictions, as they are taught extensively in the Levels of Spiritual Practice.

original: de la dang po dang gnyis pa ni gnas dang po las skye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dang po dang gnyis pa ni gnas dang po las skye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, the first and second are to be known as arising from the first abode.

original: gsum pa dang bzhi pa ni gnas gnyis pa las so //
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pa ni gnas gnyis pa las so //
translated: The third and fourth are from the second abode.

original: lnga pa dang drug pa ni gnas gsum pa las so //
analyzed: lnga pa dang drug pa ni gnas gsum pa las so //
translated: The fifth and sixth are from the third abode.

original: bdun pa dang brgyad pa ni gnas bzhi pa las so //
analyzed: bdun pa dang brgyad pa ni gnas bzhi pa las so //
translated: The seventh and eighth are from the fourth abode.

original: dgu pa ni gnas lnga pa las so //
analyzed: dgu pa ni gnas lnga pa las so //
translated: The ninth is from the fifth abode.

original: bcu pa ni gnas drug pa las so //
analyzed: bcu pa ni gnas drug pa las so //
translated: The tenth is from the sixth abode.

original: bcu gcig pa dang bcu gnyis pa ni gnas bdun pa las so //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa dang bcu gnyis pa ni gnas bdun pa las so //
translated: The eleventh and twelfth are explained in the seventh chapter.

original: gzhan bcu gnyis po ni gnas tha ma gnyis las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan bcu gnyis po ni gnas tha ma gnyis las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The other twelve are explained in the last two chapters.

original: de la lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab ni sgo gsum gyis nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab ni sgo gsum gyis nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Among them, the superior mind and superior wisdom are impaired by three doors.

original: zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma nyams pa'i sgo dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma nyams pa'i sgo dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma nyams pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma nyams pa'i sgo dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma nyams pa'i sgo dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma nyams pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The door of the impairment of the sign of serenity, the door of the impairment of the sign of full retention, and the door of the impairment of the sign of equanimity.

original: de la dang pos ni rmugs pa dang gnyid bskyed do //
analyzed: de la dang pos ni rmugs pa dang gnyid bskyed do //
translated: Among them, the first produces torpor and sleep.

original: gnyis pas ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'o //
translated: The second produces excitement and regret.

original: gnas gsum pas ni ma dad pa la sogs pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i mthar thug pa rnams pa skyed do //
analyzed: gnas gsum pas ni ma dad pa la sogs pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i mthar thug pa rnams pa skyed do //
translated: The third produces nonfaith and so on up to discursive and applied thought.

original: de dag ji ltar phan tshun mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar phan tshun mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How are they mutually concomitant?

original: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa ni mi dge ba thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no ;
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa ni mi dge ba thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no ;
translated: Shamelessness and lack of conscience are concomitant with all nonvirtue.

original: / ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / bag med pa dang / brjed ngas pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sems thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: / ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / bag med pa dang / brjed ngas pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sems thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Lack of faith, laziness, carelessness, forgetfulness, distraction, and wrong understanding are associated with all defiled minds.

original: gnyid dang 'gyod pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa thams cad dang yang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: gnyid dang 'gyod pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa thams cad dang yang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Sleep and regret are associated with all minds, whether wholesome, unwholesome, or undefined.

original: lhag ma rnams ni phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin par blta bar bya'o //üîΩnye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag las du zhig ni brtags pa'i yod pa yin /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin par blta bar bya'o // nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag las du zhig ni brtags pa'i yod pa yin /
translated: The remaining ones should be understood as not being mutually associated.

original: du zhig ni rdzas su yod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig ni rdzas su yod pa yin zhe na /
translated: Among these secondary mental afflictions, how many are imaginary and how many are substantial?

original: khro ba dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / phrag dog dang / rnam par 'tshe ba ni khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa'i phyir brtags pa'i yod pa yin no //
analyzed: khro ba dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / phrag dog dang / rnam par 'tshe ba ni khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa'i phyir brtags pa'i yod pa yin no //
translated: Anger, enmity, dissimulation, jealousy, and harm are imaginary because they are included in anger.

original: ser sna dang / rgyags pa dang / rgod pa ni 'dod chags kyi char gtogs pa'i phyir de dag kyang brtags pa'i yod pa yin no //
analyzed: ser sna dang / rgyags pa dang / rgod pa ni 'dod chags kyi char gtogs pa'i phyir de dag kyang brtags pa'i yod pa yin no //
translated: Avarice, arrogance, and excitement are also investigated existents, because they are included in the category of attachment.

original: 'chab pa dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang @65b 'gyod pa ni gti mug gi char gtogs pa'i phyir de dag kyang brtags pa'i yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'chab pa dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang @65b 'gyod pa ni gti mug gi char gtogs pa'i phyir de dag kyang brtags pa'i yod pa yin no //
translated: Concealment, pretense, hypocrisy, torpor, sleep, and regret are also investigated existents, because they are included in the category of delusion.

original: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / ma dad pa dang / le lo ni rdzas su yod pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / ma dad pa dang / le lo ni rdzas su yod pa yin no //
translated: Shamelessness, lack of conscience, lack of faith, and laziness are substantial existents.

original: bag med pa ni snga ma bzhin du brtags pa'i yod pa yin no //
analyzed: bag med pa ni snga ma bzhin du brtags pa'i yod pa yin no //
translated: Carelessness is an investigated existent, as before.

original: brjed ngas pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab ni gti mug gi char gtogs pa kho na'i phyir /
analyzed: brjed ngas pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab ni gti mug gi char gtogs pa kho na'i phyir /
translated: Forgetfulness, distraction, and erroneous understanding are investigated existents, because they are included in the category of delusion.

original: thams cad brtags pa'i yod pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad brtags pa'i yod pa yin no //
translated: All of these are investigated existents.

original: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa ni ngag kun nas slong ba'i sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i char gtogs pa dang / shes rab kyi char gtogs pa'i phyir brtags pa'i yod pa yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa ni ngag kun nas slong ba'i sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i char gtogs pa dang / shes rab kyi char gtogs pa'i phyir brtags pa'i yod pa yin no //
translated: Initial inquiry and investigation are imagined to exist because they are included in the category of volition that instigates speech and are included in the category of wisdom.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang / chen po nyid ji ltar blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang / chen po nyid ji ltar blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one view the degrees of weakness, middling, and great strength of these secondary mental afflictions?

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩde dag ni nyon mongs pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / de dag ni nyon mongs pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: They are as follows:üîΩThey are just like the mental afflictions.

original: de dag gi gzhi yang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gang yin pa de dag nyid yin no //üîΩrab tu dbye ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang 'di lta ste /üîΩnyon mongs pa rnams kyi bzhin du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi gzhi yang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gang yin pa de dag nyid yin no // rab tu dbye ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang 'di lta ste / nyon mongs pa rnams kyi bzhin du blta bar bya ste /
translated: Their bases are just like those of the mental afflictions.üîΩTheir divisions, disadvantages, and counteragents are also just like those of the mental afflictions.

original: de yang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: They should be viewed in the same way, as appropriate.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of the indeterminate dharmas?

original: de dag ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de dag ni bzhi ste /
translated: They are four:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: las kyi 'phangs te /
analyzed: las kyi 'phangs te /
translated: They are projected by karma.

original: mngon par grub pa dang mngon par grub pa'i rgyu dang / gnas pa dang / 'tsho ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag go //
analyzed: mngon par grub pa dang mngon par grub pa'i rgyu dang / gnas pa dang / 'tsho ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag go //
translated: abiding, life, and the various kinds of meditative concentration.

original: ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is essential nature?

original: smras pa / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i phung po rnams dang / tha mal du 'dug pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pas yongs su bsdu ba'i spyod lam dang / de bzhin du bzo'i gnas dang rtsed mo mngon par 'du byed pas yongs su bsdus pa'i sprul pa'o ;
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i phung po rnams dang / tha mal du 'dug pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pas yongs su bsdu ba'i spyod lam dang / de bzhin du bzo'i gnas dang rtsed mo mngon par 'du byed pas yongs su bsdus pa'i sprul pa'o ;
translated: It is the aggregates born of retribution, ordinary deportment, and the emanations included in the deportment and activities of skilled behavior and play.

original: / de dag ji ltar phan tshun mtshungs par ldan par blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: / de dag ji ltar phan tshun mtshungs par ldan par blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one view the mutual relationship of these three natures?

original: smras pa / spyod lam byed pa dang / bzo'i gnas byed pa ni lan 'ga' mtshungs par ldan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / spyod lam byed pa dang / bzo'i gnas byed pa ni lan 'ga' mtshungs par ldan pa yang yod de /
translated: It is said that the deportment and activities of skilled behavior are sometimes associated,üîΩbut sometimes not.

original: mdo las las kyi mtha' gang dag 'gro ba'i tshe na bla la /üîΩsdod pa na yang ma yin /
analyzed: mdo las las kyi mtha' gang dag 'gro ba'i tshe na bla la / sdod pa na yang ma yin /
translated: The sutra says: ‚ÄúWhen one is walking, the activity of skill in deportment is present.üîΩWhen one is standing, it is not.

original: 'dug pa na yang ma yin ;
analyzed: 'dug pa na yang ma yin ;
translated: When one is sitting, it is not.

original: nyal ba na yang ma yin pa de lta bu dag kyang yod do //üîΩlas kyi mtha' gang dag 'gro ba'i tshe na yang bla la /
analyzed: nyal ba na yang ma yin pa de lta bu dag kyang yod do // las kyi mtha' gang dag 'gro ba'i tshe na yang bla la /
translated: There are also those who are not like that when they are going,üîΩstanding,

original: sdod pa na yang bla /üîΩ'dug pa na yang bla /
analyzed: sdod pa na yang bla / 'dug pa na yang bla /
translated: sitting,

original: nyal ba na yang bla ba ste /üîΩde lta bu dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyal ba na yang bla ba ste / de lta bu dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: or lying down.

original: de las gzhan pa dag ni @66a * //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag ni @66a * //
translated: There are also those who are not like that when they are going,üîΩstanding, sitting, or lying down.

original: phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no //üîΩde dag las du ni rdzas su yod pa yin /
analyzed: phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no // de dag las du ni rdzas su yod pa yin /
translated: The rest are not mutually concomitant.üîΩHow many of these are substantially existent?

original: du ni brtags pa'i yod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni brtags pa'i yod pa yin zhe na /
translated: How many are imputedly existent?

original: smras pa / de dag ni rnam par smin pas bsdus pa'i phung po rnams dang / sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i khyad par la gdags pa yin pa'i phyir brtags pa'i yod pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / de dag ni rnam par smin pas bsdus pa'i phung po rnams dang / sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i khyad par la gdags pa yin pa'i phyir brtags pa'i yod pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that they are imputedly existent because they are subsumed within the resultant aggregates and are designated on the basis of the specific volition of the mind.

original: de dag gi chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po gang zhe na /
translated: What are their small, middling, and great forms?

original: smras pa / rnam par smin pa las byung ba dang / spyod lam byed pa ni gsal ba'i phyir chung ngu yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par smin pa las byung ba dang / spyod lam byed pa ni gsal ba'i phyir chung ngu yin no //
translated: He says: The action of the maturational and the action of deportment are small because they are manifest.

original: bzo'i gnas byed pa ni ches gsal ba'i phyir 'bring yin no //
analyzed: bzo'i gnas byed pa ni ches gsal ba'i phyir 'bring yin no //
translated: The action of the creative arts is medium because it is more manifest.

original: sprul pa ni rang bzhin gyi sa ches shin tu gsal ba'i phyir chen po yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sprul pa ni rang bzhin gyi sa ches shin tu gsal ba'i phyir chen po yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The action of emanation should be regarded as great because it is naturally very manifest.

original: yang rang bzhin gyi bye brag gis rnam grangs gzhan ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i rnam par smin pa ni chung ngu yin no //
analyzed: yang rang bzhin gyi bye brag gis rnam grangs gzhan ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i rnam par smin pa ni chung ngu yin no //
translated: Moreover, another classification is by way of the specific natures: The maturational action of the formless realm is small.

original: gzugs na spyod pa ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa ni 'bring yin no //
translated: The action of the form realm is medium.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni chen po yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni chen po yin no //
translated: The action of the desire realm is great.

original: spyod lam 'dug pa dang nyal ba ni chung ngu yin no //
analyzed: spyod lam 'dug pa dang nyal ba ni chung ngu yin no //
translated: The action of deportment, sitting and lying down, is small.

original: 'greng ba ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: 'greng ba ni 'bring yin no //
translated: Standing is medium.

original: 'chag pa ni chen po yin no //
analyzed: 'chag pa ni chen po yin no //
translated: Walking is great.

original: las dang po pa'i bzo'i gnas byed pa ni chung ngu yin no //
analyzed: las dang po pa'i bzo'i gnas byed pa ni chung ngu yin no //
translated: The action of the creative arts of a beginner is small.

original: bslab pa'i ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: bslab pa'i ni 'bring yin no //
translated: The action of one who is trained is medium.

original: slob dpon gyi ni chen po yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi ni chen po yin no //
translated: The action of a master is great.

original: ting nge 'dzin mthu chung ngu dang ldan pa thob pa'i sprul pa ni chung ngu yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mthu chung ngu dang ldan pa thob pa'i sprul pa ni chung ngu yin no //
translated: The emanation of one who has attained the weak state of concentration is weak.

original: ting nge 'dzin mthu 'bring dang ldan pa thob pa ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mthu 'bring dang ldan pa thob pa ni 'bring yin no //
translated: The emanation of one who has attained the middling state of concentration is middling.

original: ting nge 'dzin mthu chen po dang ldan pa thob pa ni chen po yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mthu chen po dang ldan pa thob pa ni chen po yin te /
translated: The emanation of one who has attained the great state of concentration is great.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand the weak, middling, and great in this way.

original: de dag skye ba'i gzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag skye ba'i gzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of their arising?üîΩIt should be seen as being of twelve kinds.

original: smras pa / de ni rnam pa bcu gnyis su blta bar bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa / de ni rnam pa bcu gnyis su blta bar bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the twelve?

original: thos pa las byung ba'i sar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i sar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: They are as explained in the section on the stage of learning.

original: de la rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is their classification?

original: smras pa / rnam par smin pa las byung ba ni 'gro ba lnga'i bye brag gis rnam pa lngar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par smin pa las byung ba ni 'gro ba lnga'i bye brag gis rnam pa lngar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known that the emanation arisen from retribution is of five kinds according to the differences of the five destinies.

original: spyod lam byed pa ni spyod lam bzhi'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: spyod lam byed pa ni spyod lam bzhi'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The emanation of action is of four kinds according to the differences of the four postures.

original: bzo'i gnas byed pa ni gzhi rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi bye brag gis rnam pa bcu gnyis kho na'o //
analyzed: bzo'i gnas byed pa ni gzhi rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi bye brag gis rnam pa bcu gnyis kho na'o //
translated: The basis of craftsmanship is only twelvefold, according to the twelve types of crafts.

original: sprul pa byed pa ni so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bye brag dang / rtsed mo'i don dang / gzhan gyi don dang / lus @66b dang ngag gi sprul pa'i bye brag gis rnam par brgyad du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sprul pa byed pa ni so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bye brag dang / rtsed mo'i don dang / gzhan gyi don dang / lus @66b dang ngag gi sprul pa'i bye brag gis rnam par brgyad du rig par bya'o //
translated: The basis of emanation is to be understood as eightfold, according to the distinctions of the emanations of ordinary men, sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and Tathagatas, and according to the distinctions of emanations for play, for the sake of others, and of body and speech.

original: de la rab tu dbye ba nyid kyis gzhi bsdus pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa dag gi gzhi ni logs shig tu ma smos so //
analyzed: de la rab tu dbye ba nyid kyis gzhi bsdus pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa dag gi gzhi ni logs shig tu ma smos so //
translated: Since the other bases are included in the above divisions, they are not mentioned separately.

original: de la rnam par smin pa las byung ba ni gcig tu lung ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa las byung ba ni gcig tu lung ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: Among these, that which arises from the retribution cause is morally neutral.

original: gnyis ni rnam pa gsum du yang dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ni rnam pa gsum du yang dmigs so //
translated: Two are also found in the three moral natures.

original: gcig ni rnam pa gnyis su dmigs so //
analyzed: gcig ni rnam pa gnyis su dmigs so //
translated: One is found in two moral natures.

original: rol mo la brten te /
analyzed: rol mo la brten te /
translated: The basis of emanation is good.

original: sems nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pas spyod lam byed pa gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa can yin no //
analyzed: sems nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pas spyod lam byed pa gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa can yin no //
translated: The actions of those who are in a defiled state of mind are defiled.

original: nye bar zhi ba la brten pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba yin no //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba la brten pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba yin no //
translated: The actions of those who are in a peaceful state of mind are wholesome.

original: lhag par chags par gyur pas bzo byed pa gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa can yin no //
analyzed: lhag par chags par gyur pas bzo byed pa gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa can yin no //
translated: The actions of those who are in a state of attachment are defiled.

original: dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba yin no //
translated: The actions of those who are in a wholesome state of mind are wholesome.üîΩThe actions of those who are in a state of creation are wholesome.

original: sprul pa byed pa ni gzhan 'dun par bya ba'i rgyu'am /
analyzed: sprul pa byed pa ni gzhan 'dun par bya ba'i rgyu'am /
translated: The actions of those who are in a state of creation for the sake of others are wholesome.

original: sems can rnams kyi don du byed pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don du byed pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba yin no //
translated: The actions of those who are in a state of creation for the sake of sentient beings are wholesome.

original: nyon mongs pa can ni med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni med do //
translated: There are no defiled actions in the formless realm.

original: de la phung po lnga po gang dag yin pa de dag gis bden pa du dag bsdus la bden pa du dag gis kyang phung po du dag bsdus she na /
analyzed: de la phung po lnga po gang dag yin pa de dag gis bden pa du dag bsdus la bden pa du dag gis kyang phung po du dag bsdus she na /
translated: How many truths are included in the five aggregates? How many aggregates are included in the truths?

original: smras pa / bden pa gsum gyis ni phung po lnga bsdus la /
analyzed: smras pa / bden pa gsum gyis ni phung po lnga bsdus la /
translated: It is said: Three truths include the five aggregates.

original: phung po lnga po dag gis kyang bden pa gsum bsdus so //
analyzed: phung po lnga po dag gis kyang bden pa gsum bsdus so //
translated: The five aggregates are also included in the three truths.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa dang phung po rnams ni gcig gis gcig ma bsdus te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa dang phung po rnams ni gcig gis gcig ma bsdus te /
translated: The truth of cessation and the aggregates are not mutually inclusive.

original: 'gog pa ni de dag nye bar zhi bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni de dag nye bar zhi bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because cessation is distinguished by the complete pacification of those aggregates.

original: nyan thos kyi sar bden pa bzhi ni rnam pa bcu drug gis blta bar bya'o zhes gang bshad pa de la ci'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la rnam pa bzhis blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sar bden pa bzhi ni rnam pa bcu drug gis blta bar bya'o zhes gang bshad pa de la ci'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la rnam pa bzhis blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: It was said that the four truths should be seen in sixteen aspects on the ≈õrƒÅvaka stage. Why should the truth of suffering be seen in four aspects?

original: smras pa / phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por te /
analyzed: smras pa / phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por te /
translated: It is said: The antidotes to the four errors.

original: de la rnam pa gcig ni phyin ci log gcig gi gnyen po'o //üîΩrnam pa gcig ni phyin ci log gnyis kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de la rnam pa gcig ni phyin ci log gcig gi gnyen po'o // rnam pa gcig ni phyin ci log gnyis kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: Here, one aspect is the antidote to one error.üîΩOne aspect is the antidote to two errors.

original: rnam pa tha ma gnyis ni phyin ci log tha ma gcig gi gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa tha ma gnyis ni phyin ci log tha ma gcig gi gnyen po yin no //
translated: The last two aspects are the antidote to the last one error.

original: ci'i phyir kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la rnam pa bzhis blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la rnam pa bzhis blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: Why should the truth of origination be seen in four aspects?

original: smras pa / sred pa rnam pa bzhi'i phyir te de yang rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag tu sred pa'i bye brag las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / sred pa rnam pa bzhi'i phyir te de yang rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag tu sred pa'i bye brag las blta bar bya'o //
translated: He said: Because of four kinds of craving, which should be understood as the specific forms of craving for permanence, pleasure, purity, and a self.

original: de la sred pa dang po la brten nas ni yang srid pa 'byung bar byed par mngon no //
analyzed: de la sred pa dang po la brten nas ni yang srid pa 'byung bar byed par mngon no //
translated: It is clear that the first craving produces rebirth.

original: gnyis pa dang gsum pa la brten nas ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang / de dang der @67a * //üîΩmngon par dga' ba mngon no //
analyzed: gnyis pa dang gsum pa la brten nas ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang / de dang der @67a * // mngon par dga' ba mngon no //
translated: The second and third are the delight in and attachment to that rebirth,üîΩand the delight in and attachment to particular objects.

original: tha ma la brten nas ni lus la chags pa dang ldan pa'i sred pa 'ba' zhig blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tha ma la brten nas ni lus la chags pa dang ldan pa'i sred pa 'ba' zhig blta bar bya'o //
translated: The fourth is the craving that is the attachment to the body.

original: de la sred pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sred pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is craving?

original: lus ngag la chags shing sbyor bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lus ngag la chags shing sbyor bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the attachment to and involvement with body and speech.

original: yang srid pa 'byung bar byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang srid pa 'byung bar byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the production of rebirth?

original: phyi ma'i lus kyi khyad par 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i lus kyi khyad par 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the desire for a particular kind of body in the future.

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is delight in and attachment to that?

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang reg bya dang / chos 'dod pa la mngon du phyogs par gyur pa'am /üîΩthob pa dag la dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang reg bya dang / chos 'dod pa la mngon du phyogs par gyur pa'am / thob pa dag la dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the desire for form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects, or the desire for the attainment of those.

original: de dang der mngon par dga' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dang der mngon par dga' ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the desire for the enjoyment of those?

original: de las gzhan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa dag la 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa dag la 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the desire for other forms, etc.

original: ci'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa la rnam pa bzhis blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa la rnam pa bzhis blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: Why should one see the truth of cessation in four ways?

original: smras pa / sred pa 'gog pa rnam pa bzhis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / sred pa 'gog pa rnam pa bzhis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: because of the fourfold division of the cessation of craving.

original: ci'i phyir lam gyi bden pa la rnam pa bzhis blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lam gyi bden pa la rnam pa bzhis blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: Why should one see the truth of the path in four ways?

original: smras pa / sred pa 'gog pa skyed par byed pa rnam pa bzhi'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / sred pa 'gog pa skyed par byed pa rnam pa bzhi'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: because of the fourfold division of the origination of the cessation of craving.

original: nyan thos kyi sar 'jig pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcus /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sar 'jig pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcus /
translated: In the Sravakabhumi, the truth of suffering is said to be understood in ten ways, beginning with impermanence.

original: de ni sdug bsngal bden pa la //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal bden pa la //
translated: The truth of suffering is understood

original: rnam pa bcus ni rtog byed na //
analyzed: rnam pa bcus ni rtog byed na //
translated: in ten ways, beginning with impermanence.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhi la 'jug /'gyur ba dang ni 'jig pa dang ; / bral ba dang ni nye ba dang // chos nyid kyi ni rnam pa dang // kun tu sbyor dang 'ching ba dang // mi sdug pa dang grub bde med //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhi la 'jug /'gyur ba dang ni 'jig pa dang ; / bral ba dang ni nye ba dang // chos nyid kyi ni rnam pa dang // kun tu sbyor dang 'ching ba dang // mi sdug pa dang grub bde med //
translated: the fetters, the bonds,üîΩthe unpleasant, and the absence of established happiness.

original: dmigs med rang dbang med pa yi //
analyzed: dmigs med rang dbang med pa yi //
translated: The absence of an object and the absence of independence.

original: rnam pa de dag rig pas rtog / ces gang bshad pa de la /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag rig pas rtog / ces gang bshad pa de la /
translated: One should understand these aspects.

original: dmigs su med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs su med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the absence of an object?

original: dbang po tsam dang / yul tsam dang ; de las skyes pa'i myong ba tsam dang / sems tsam dang / bdag dang bdag ces bya ba'i ming tsam dang / lta ba tsam dang / mngon par brjod pa tsam dang / rnam pa bdun po de dag las logs shig na don gzhan du gyur pa'i bdag gi mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po tsam dang / yul tsam dang ; de las skyes pa'i myong ba tsam dang / sems tsam dang / bdag dang bdag ces bya ba'i ming tsam dang / lta ba tsam dang / mngon par brjod pa tsam dang / rnam pa bdun po de dag las logs shig na don gzhan du gyur pa'i bdag gi mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of an object that is separate from the mere sense faculty, the mere object, the mere experience arising from them, the mere mind, the mere name ‚Äúself,‚Äù the mere view, the mere expression, and the mere seven aspects.

original: rang dbang med pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: rang dbang med pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the absence of independence?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'du byed rnams la bdag gi mtshan nyid med pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'du byed rnams la bdag gi mtshan nyid med pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of a self-characteristic in the formative forces, by reason of their impermanence and their suffering, which is to say, by reason of their origination in dependence.

original: rnam pa bcu po de dag las gang gis 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid bsdus she na /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po de dag las gang gis 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid bsdus she na /
translated: By how many of these ten aspects is the suffering of change included?

original: smras pa / kun tu sbyor ba'i rnam pas @67b bsdus te /
analyzed: smras pa / kun tu sbyor ba'i rnam pas @67b bsdus te /
translated: It is said that it is included by the aspect of fetters.

original: 'gyur ba'i dbang las byung ba'i yid mi bde ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid du blta bar bya'i /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i dbang las byung ba'i yid mi bde ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid du blta bar bya'i /
translated: The mental dissatisfaction that arises from the power of change should be regarded as the suffering of change.

original: 'gyur ba tsam ni nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba tsam ni nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not merely change,

original: yid mi bde ba dang bral ba rnams la yang de dmigs pa dang / gnod par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang bral ba rnams la yang de dmigs pa dang / gnod par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is observed even in those who are free from mental dissatisfaction and because it does not cause harm.

original: rnam pa gang gis sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid bsdus she na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid bsdus she na /
translated: By how many aspects is the suffering of suffering included?

original: smras pa / mi sdug pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: smras pa / mi sdug pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: It is said that it is included by the aspect of the disagreeable.

original: rnam pa gang gis 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid bsdus she na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid bsdus she na /
translated: By how many aspects is the suffering of the formative forces included?

original: smras pa / grub pa dang bde ba med pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: smras pa / grub pa dang bde ba med pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: He says: By the aspect of the absence of establishment and happiness.

original: skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa'i rnam pa de dag las du zhig sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis bsdus she na /
analyzed: skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa'i rnam pa de dag las du zhig sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis bsdus she na /
translated: How many of the aspects that have been stated, from the suffering of birth up to the suffering of the five appropriated aggregates in brief, are included in the suffering of suffering?

original: smras pa / dang po lnga'o //
analyzed: smras pa / dang po lnga'o //
translated: He says: The first five.

original: du zhig 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis bsdus she na /
analyzed: du zhig 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis bsdus she na /
translated: How many are included in the suffering of change?

original: smras pa / bar ma gnyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / bar ma gnyis so //
translated: He says: The two middle ones.

original: du zhig 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis bsdus she na /
analyzed: du zhig 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis bsdus she na /
translated: How many are included in the suffering of conditioned existence?

original: smras pa / tha ma gcig go /
analyzed: smras pa / tha ma gcig go /
translated: He says: The last one.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang dang po bdun gyis sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid bsdus so //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang dang po bdun gyis sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid bsdus so //
translated: Another enumeration: The first seven are included in the suffering of suffering.

original: de dag gi gnyen po dge ba rnams dang / nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid bsdus so //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po dge ba rnams dang / nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid bsdus so //
translated: The virtuous and afflicted that are their antidotes are included in the suffering of change.

original: thams ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid bsdus te /
analyzed: thams ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid bsdus te /
translated: The last one is included in the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dral zhing gyur pa'i sems zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis sgrib pas kun nas dkris pa de ni de las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba so sor myong ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dral zhing gyur pa'i sems zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis sgrib pas kun nas dkris pa de ni de las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba so sor myong ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pas na /
translated: And similarly, the Bhagav√•n has said, ‚ÄúThe mind that is bound by obscurations experiences suffering and mental dissatisfaction that arise from it.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yin par rab tu grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yin par rab tu grub po //
translated: Therefore it is well established that afflictions are suffering by way of the suffering of change.

original: sdug bsngal ba rnam pa bzhi po mngon par 'grub pa'i sdug bsngal dang / nang la brten pa'i sdug bsngal dang phyi rol la brten pa'i sdug bsngal ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal zhes gang gsungs pa de la sdug bsngal gang zhig rnam pa gang gis bsdus la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba rnam pa bzhi po mngon par 'grub pa'i sdug bsngal dang / nang la brten pa'i sdug bsngal dang phyi rol la brten pa'i sdug bsngal ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal zhes gang gsungs pa de la sdug bsngal gang zhig rnam pa gang gis bsdus la /
translated: The four types of suffering are the suffering of the formation of suffering, the suffering of the internal, the suffering of the external, and the suffering of the negative reflex actions.

original: sdug bsngal gang gis kyang rnam pa gang bsdus she na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang gis kyang rnam pa gang bsdus she na /
translated: Which suffering is included in which type of suffering?üîΩWhich type of suffering includes which suffering?

original: smras pa / rnam pa dang po dang sdug bsngal dang po ni gcig gis gcig bsdus so //
analyzed: smras pa / rnam pa dang po dang sdug bsngal dang po ni gcig gis gcig bsdus so //
translated: He says: The first aspect and the first suffering are included in each other.

original: rnam pa gsum dang sdug bsngal 'og ma gnyis pa yang gcig gis gcig bsdus so //üîΩrnam pa @68a * //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum dang sdug bsngal 'og ma gnyis pa yang gcig gis gcig bsdus so // rnam pa @68a * //
translated: The three aspects and the second suffering are also included in each other.

original: gzhan gsum dang sdug bsngal 'og ma gsum pa yang gcig gis gcig bsdus so //
analyzed: gzhan gsum dang sdug bsngal 'og ma gsum pa yang gcig gis gcig bsdus so //
translated: The other three aspects and the third suffering are also included in each other.

original: rnam pa tha ma dang sdug bsngal tha ma yang gcig gis gcig bsdus so //
analyzed: rnam pa tha ma dang sdug bsngal tha ma yang gcig gis gcig bsdus so //
translated: The last aspect and the last suffering are also included in each other.

original: de la sngar ni sred pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye bas kun 'byung ba'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa las rnam pa bzhir bstan to //
analyzed: de la sngar ni sred pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye bas kun 'byung ba'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa las rnam pa bzhir bstan to //
translated: Therein, previously, the truth of origination was presented as fourfold from the point of view of the classification of the nature of craving.

original: da ni 'bras bu'i rab tu dbye ba las blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'bras bu'i rab tu dbye ba las blta bar bya ste /
translated: Now, it should be seen from the point of view of the classification of the result.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it generates the four types of suffering.

original: rnam pa bcu drug po gang dag yin pa de dag las du zhig stong pa'i rnam pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug po gang dag yin pa de dag las du zhig stong pa'i rnam pa yin zhe na /
translated: From among those sixteen aspects, how many are the aspect of emptiness?

original: smras pa / gnyis te sdug bsngal gyi bden pa las tha ma gnyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / gnyis te sdug bsngal gyi bden pa las tha ma gnyis so //
translated: He said: Two, i.e., the last two aspects of the truth of suffering.

original: du zhig smon pa med pa'i rnam pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig smon pa med pa'i rnam pa yin zhe na /
translated: How many aspects are without expectancy?

original: smras pa / drug ste sdug bsngal gyi bden pa las dang po gnyis dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa las thams cad do //
analyzed: smras pa / drug ste sdug bsngal gyi bden pa las dang po gnyis dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa las thams cad do //
translated: He said: Six, i.e., the first two aspects of the truth of suffering and all of the truth of origination.

original: du zhig mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa yin zhe na ;
analyzed: du zhig mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa yin zhe na ;
translated: How many aspects are signless?

original: smras pa / 'gog pa'i bden pa las thams cad do //
analyzed: smras pa / 'gog pa'i bden pa las thams cad do //
translated: He said: All of the truth of cessation.

original: du zhig ni rnam par dag pa'i rgyu nye bar mtshon pa'i rnam pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig ni rnam par dag pa'i rgyu nye bar mtshon pa'i rnam pa yin zhe na /
translated: How many aspects are the cause of purification?

original: smras pa / lam gyi bden pa las thams cad do //
analyzed: smras pa / lam gyi bden pa las thams cad do //
translated: He said: All of the truth of the path.

original: gang gi tshe mi rtag pa'i 'du shes can bdag med pa'i 'du shes la gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi rtag pa'i 'du shes can bdag med pa'i 'du shes la gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: When one who has the perception of impermanence abides in the perception of selflessness,

original: ci'i phyir stong pa nyid dang por gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir stong pa nyid dang por gsungs she na /
translated: why is emptiness mentioned first?

original: smras pa / bdag med par lta ba skyes na mi rtag pa nyid du lta ba la smon pa med pa nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / bdag med par lta ba skyes na mi rtag pa nyid du lta ba la smon pa med pa nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /
translated: He said: Because when the view of selflessness arises, the view of impermanence is established as the aspect of non-expectancy.

original: lta ba gnyis ni snga phyir gcig gis gcig rnam par dag par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba gnyis ni snga phyir gcig gis gcig rnam par dag par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The two views are purified by the one preceding purifying the one following.üîΩThere is another order of the four noble truths, which is the order in which they are taught.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag gi bshad pa'i go rims gzhan yang gang gis sdug bsngal bar gyur ba de ni dang po yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag gi bshad pa'i go rims gzhan yang gang gis sdug bsngal bar gyur ba de ni dang po yin no //
translated: The first truth is that which is the cause of suffering.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal bar gyur pa de ni gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal bar gyur pa de ni gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The second truth is the suffering that is caused.

original: nag po'i phyogs gtugs nas yang gang gis bde bar gyur pa de ni gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs gtugs nas yang gang gis bde bar gyur pa de ni gsum pa yin no //
translated: The third truth is that which is the cause of happiness, i.e., the cessation of the first two truths.

original: ji ltar bde bar gyur pa de ni bzhi pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar bde bar gyur pa de ni bzhi pa yin te /
translated: The fourth truth is the happiness that is caused.

original: nad dang / de'i rgyu dang / nad med pa dang / sman lta bu yin no //
analyzed: nad dang / de'i rgyu dang / nad med pa dang / sman lta bu yin no //
translated: The four truths are like a disease, its cause, health, and medicine.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang 'jig rten pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i go rims bzhin du bden pa rnams kyi go rims rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang 'jig rten pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i go rims bzhin du bden pa rnams kyi go rims rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: There is another enumeration of the order of the truths, which is the order in which the truths are taught.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa dag ni dang por sdug bsngal gang yang rung @68b ba zhig gis thebs pa na de la rtog par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa dag ni dang por sdug bsngal gang yang rung @68b ba zhig gis thebs pa na de la rtog par byed do //
translated: Thus, worldly people, when they are afflicted by some suffering, first of all investigate that suffering.

original: de'i 'og tu gang las byung ba la'o //üîΩde'i 'og tu de las thar pa la'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gang las byung ba la'o // de'i 'og tu de las thar pa la'o //
translated: After that, they investigate its origin.üîΩAfter that, they investigate the escape from it.

original: de'i 'og tu de las thar pa'i thabs la rtog par byed pa'i phyir ro /üîΩ// / bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de las thar pa'i thabs la rtog par byed pa'i phyir ro / // / bam po brgyad pa /
translated: After that, they investigate the means of escaping from it.

original: bden pa'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: bden pa'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of truth?

original: smras pa / bstan pa dang mi mthun pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don dang / de mthong na rnam par dag pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i don ni bden pa'i don to //
analyzed: smras pa / bstan pa dang mi mthun pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don dang / de mthong na rnam par dag pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i don ni bden pa'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning that is not contrary to the teaching and the meaning that is the cause of purification when it is seen.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the truth of suffering?

original: smras pa / nyon mongs pa las byung ba'i 'du byed kyi don to //
analyzed: smras pa / nyon mongs pa las byung ba'i 'du byed kyi don to //
translated: It is the meaning of the formations that arise from the defilements.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the truth of origination?

original: smras pa / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bskyed pa'i don to //
analyzed: smras pa / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bskyed pa'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning of the production of the truth of suffering.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the truth of cessation?

original: smras pa / de gnyi ga nye bar zhi ba'i don to //
analyzed: smras pa / de gnyi ga nye bar zhi ba'i don to //
translated: Response: Both are for the sake of pacifying them.

original: lam gyi bden pa'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the truth of the path?

original: smras pa / don gsum po dag sgrub pa'i don to //üîΩci 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag kun rdzob kyi bden pas bsdus pa yin nam /
analyzed: smras pa / don gsum po dag sgrub pa'i don to // ci 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag kun rdzob kyi bden pas bsdus pa yin nam /
translated: Response: It is for the sake of accomplishing the three goals.

original: 'on te don dam pa'i bden pas bsdus she na /
analyzed: 'on te don dam pa'i bden pas bsdus she na /
translated: Are these four noble truths subsumed by conventional truth or are they subsumed by ultimate truth?

original: smras pa / don dam pa'i bden pas bsdus so //
analyzed: smras pa / don dam pa'i bden pas bsdus so //
translated: Response: They are subsumed by ultimate truth.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas dang mthun pa dag la rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su 'grub pa las rnam par gzhag la /üîΩdon dam pa'i bden pa ni sdug bsngal du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas dang mthun pa dag la rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su 'grub pa las rnam par gzhag la / don dam pa'i bden pa ni sdug bsngal du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because conventional truth is posited from the perspective of the establishment of individual characteristics in relation to the bases of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Ultimate truth is to be viewed as posited from the perspective of the characteristic of the single taste of suffering.

original: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni yongs su shes par bya /üîΩkun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni spang bar bya /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni yongs su shes par bya / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni spang bar bya /
translated: Why is the truth of suffering to be fully understood?üîΩWhy is the truth of origination to be abandoned?

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni mngon sum du bya /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni mngon sum du bya /
translated: Why is the truth of cessation to be realized?

original: lam gyi bden pa ni bsgom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni bsgom par bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the truth of the path to be cultivated?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni phyin ci log bzhi'i gnas yin pas /
analyzed: smras pa / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni phyin ci log bzhi'i gnas yin pas /
translated: The truth of suffering is the basis of the four errors.

original: phyin ci log bsal ba'i phyir yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log bsal ba'i phyir yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: In order to eliminate the errors, it is to be fully understood.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The truth of origination is included in the truth of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes su zin kyang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes su zin kyang /
translated: Even though the truth of suffering is fully understood,

original: da dung kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: da dung kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: since it is still connected with the truth of origination, the truth of origination is to be abandoned.

original: mngon sum du bya ba ni mngon sum du bya ba'i @69a * //üîΩdon yin pas /
analyzed: mngon sum du bya ba ni mngon sum du bya ba'i @69a * //üîΩdon yin pas /
translated: Realization is the meaning of realization.

original: de mngon du byas nas 'gog pa la mi skrag cing dga' ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa ni mngon du bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de mngon du byas nas 'gog pa la mi skrag cing dga' ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa ni mngon du bya ba yin no //
translated: The truth of cessation is to be realized, because, having realized it, one is not afraid of cessation and one fully takes hold of joy.

original: ji skad smos pa'i don gsum po dag bsgrub pa'i phyir lam goms par bya dgos pas na /
analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i don gsum po dag bsgrub pa'i phyir lam goms par bya dgos pas na /
translated: The truth of the path is to be cultivated, because one must cultivate the path in order to accomplish the three aims as they have been stated.üîΩThe truth of suffering is to be fully understood, because it is to be fully understood by means of direct intuition devoid of conceptual differentiation.üîΩThe truth of origination is to be abandoned, because it is to be abandoned by means of the path of meditative development.üîΩThe truth of cessation is to be realized, because it is to be realized by means of the path of vision.

original: lam gyi bden pa ni bsgom par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni bsgom par bya ba yin no //
translated: The truth of the path is to be cultivated, because it is to be cultivated by means of the path of meditative development.üîΩWhat is the meaning of the term ‚Äòtruth‚Äô?üîΩA truth is that which is not deceptive to those who see it.üîΩWhat is the meaning of the term ‚Äòtruth‚Äô?üîΩA truth is that which is not deceptive to those who see it.üîΩWhat is the meaning of the term ‚Äòtruth‚Äô?üîΩA truth is that which is not deceptive to those who see it.

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ni rnam pa du mtshan nyid ni ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ni rnam pa du mtshan nyid ni ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term ‚Äòtruth‚Äô?üîΩA truth is that which is not deceptive to those who see it.

original: smras pa / mngon par rtogs pa'i don ni nges pa'i don te /üîΩde yang bden pa rnams la nges pa'i shes rab lhan cig 'byung ba rgyud dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / mngon par rtogs pa'i don ni nges pa'i don te / de yang bden pa rnams la nges pa'i shes rab lhan cig 'byung ba rgyud dang bcas pa ste /
translated: What is the meaning of the term ‚Äòtruth‚Äô?üîΩA truth is that which is not deceptive to those who see it.üîΩWhat is the meaning of the term ‚Äòtruth‚Äô?üîΩA truth is that which is not deceptive to those who see it.üîΩWhat is the meaning of the term ‚Äòtruth‚Äô?üîΩA truth is that which is not deceptive to those who see it.üîΩWhat is the meaning of the term ‚Äòtruth‚Äô?üîΩA truth is that which is not deceptive to those who see it.üîΩWhat is the meaning of the term ‚Äòtruth‚Äô?üîΩA truth is that which is not deceptive to those who see it.üîΩWhat is the meaning of the term ‚Äòtruth‚Äô?üîΩA truth is that which is not deceptive to those who see it.

original: de ni re zhig mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: What is the meaning of the term ‚Äòtruth‚Äô?

original: de yang rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya ste /
translated: A truth is that which is not deceptive to those who see it.üîΩWhat is the meaning of the term ‚Äòtruth‚Äô?üîΩA truth is that which is not deceptive to those who see it.üîΩWhat is the meaning of the term ‚Äòtruth‚Äô?

original: 'di lta ste rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sar bshad pa'o //
translated: A truth is that which is not deceptive to those who see it.

original: de la dang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term ‚Äòtruth‚Äô?

original: smras pa / bden pa rnams la nges par sems pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / bden pa rnams la nges par sems pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: He said, ‚ÄúIt is the certainty of mind with regard to the truths.

original: gnyis pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis pa gang zhe na /
translated: ‚Äù What is the second?

original: smras pa / dkon mchog gi don la nges pa'i phyir dkon mchog gsum po dag la shes na dad pa gsum dang / thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab nges pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / dkon mchog gi don la nges pa'i phyir dkon mchog gsum po dag la shes na dad pa gsum dang / thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab nges pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: He said, ‚ÄúIt is the certainty of the three kinds of faith and the certainty of the wisdom born of listening with regard to the Three Jewels, because of the certainty of the meaning of the Jewels.

original: gsum pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum pa gang zhe na /
translated: ‚Äù What is the third?üîΩHe said, ‚ÄúIt is the morality pleasing to the Aryas.

original: smras pa / 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims rnams te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims rnams te /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúThe ethics pleasing to the ƒÅryas.‚ÄùüîΩüîΩ

original: ngan song ba'i las mi byed cing nges par sdom pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan song ba'i las mi byed cing nges par sdom pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not commit the actions leading to unfortunate states of existence and one obtains the restraint.

original: bzhi pa gang zhe na ;
analyzed: bzhi pa gang zhe na ;
translated: ‚Äù What is the fourth?

original: smras pa / sngon sbyor ba'i lam la tshogs shin tu bsags pa'i tshe /
analyzed: smras pa / sngon sbyor ba'i lam la tshogs shin tu bsags pa'i tshe /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúIt is the certainty of mind with regard to the Dharma, because of the certainty of mind with regard to the meaning of the Dharma.üîΩ‚Äù What is the fifth?

original: sems yongs su sbyang ba legs par byas pa na /
analyzed: sems yongs su sbyang ba legs par byas pa na /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúIt is the certainty of mind with regard to the meaning, because of the certainty of mind with regard to the Dharma.

original: 'jig rten pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mthar thug pa'i rjes la so so'i bdag nyid la sems can gyi brda bsal ba'i chos la dmigs shing mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan lenüîΩchung ngu dang bral ba'i sems dang por skye ba dang / de'i rjes la so so'i bdag nyid la chos kyi brda bsal ba'i chos la dmigs shing /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mthar thug pa'i rjes la so so'i bdag nyid la sems can gyi brda bsal ba'i chos la dmigs shing mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len chung ngu dang bral ba'i sems dang por skye ba dang / de'i rjes la so so'i bdag nyid la chos kyi brda bsal ba'i chos la dmigs shing /
translated: small degree of negative tendencies that are factors eliminated by the path ofüîΩseeing.üîΩThe second moment of the path of seeing is the second generation of theüîΩmind that is free from the medium degree of negative tendencies that are factors

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len 'bring dang bral ba'i sems gnyis pa skye ba dang / de'i rjes la sems can thams cad dang / chos thams cad kyi brda bsal ba'i chos la dmigs shing /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len 'bring dang bral ba'i sems gnyis pa skye ba dang / de'i rjes la sems can thams cad dang / chos thams cad kyi brda bsal ba'i chos la dmigs shing /
translated: eliminated by the path of seeing.üîΩThe third moment of the path of seeing is the third generation of the mindüîΩthat is free from the great degree of negative tendencies that are factors eliminatedüîΩby the path of seeing.

original: mthong bas spong bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral ba'i sems gsum @69b pa skye ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mthong bas spong bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral ba'i sems gsum @69b pa skye ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: The third is the mind that is free from all the negative tendencies that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de ltar na de ni mthong ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni mthong ba'i lam yin no //
translated: Thus, this is the path of seeing.

original: de yang zung du 'brel bas 'jug pa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: de yang zung du 'brel bas 'jug pa'i lam yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is the path of unification.

original: de ltar gyur ba de yang gsum ni lhag mthong dang mthun pa'i sems yin la /
analyzed: de ltar gyur ba de yang gsum ni lhag mthong dang mthun pa'i sems yin la /
translated: The three are minds that are compatible with insight,

original: gsum ni zhi gnas dang mthun pa'i sems yin yang zung du 'brel bas 'jug pa'i phyir gsum kho nar rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: gsum ni zhi gnas dang mthun pa'i sems yin yang zung du 'brel bas 'jug pa'i phyir gsum kho nar rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: and the three are minds that are compatible with serenity. However, they are established as only three because they are the path of unification,

original: skad cig gcig la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyi ga dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig gcig la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyi ga dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since both serenity and insight are focused on the same object in a single moment.

original: sems de dag ni rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: sems de dag ni rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Those minds should be regarded as focused on the truths that are not yet fully understood.

original: dang po gnyis ni chos shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin la tha ma gsum pa gcig pu ni rjes su shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dang po gnyis ni chos shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin la tha ma gsum pa gcig pu ni rjes su shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The first two are concomitant with Dharma knowledge, and the third alone should be viewed as concomitant with subsequent knowledge.

original: sems de dag gi mthus de'i 'og ma gnyis mngon par rtogs pa'i gnyis pa la /
analyzed: sems de dag gi mthus de'i 'og ma gnyis mngon par rtogs pa'i gnyis pa la /
translated: By the power of those minds, the two subsequent to that are the second clear realization.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i bden pa rnams la sdug bsngal la sogs pa shes pa rnam par dag pa bar chad med pa skye ba'i phyir de dag kyang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa nyid yin par rab tu grub pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i bden pa rnams la sdug bsngal la sogs pa shes pa rnam par dag pa bar chad med pa skye ba'i phyir de dag kyang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa nyid yin par rab tu grub pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because the pure uninterrupted path of the knowledge of suffering and so on arises in relation to the truths that are classified as the truths of suffering and so on, they are also established as the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of origin, the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path.

original: de ltar zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa'i sems gsum po de dag gis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba mngon du byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / phung po thams cad zhi bar byed pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa'i sems gsum po de dag gis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba mngon du byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / phung po thams cad zhi bar byed pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the three minds that are conducive to serenity and insight manifest the pacification of the mental afflictions that are to be abandoned by seeing, and they attain the supramundane path that pacifies all the mental afflictions and the aggregates. This is called ‚Äúthe knowledge that is the clear realization of the truths that arises from the summit of the worldly.‚Äù

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge that is the clear realization of the truths that arises from the end of the clear realization?

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes las thob pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes las thob pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The knowledge that is attained subsequent to the clear realization is called ‚Äúthe knowledge that arises from the end of the clear realization.‚Äù

original: shes pa de yang sems gsum pa'i mjug thogs su mthong ba'i lam las langs bas mngon du byas nas /
analyzed: shes pa de yang sems gsum pa'i mjug thogs su mthong ba'i lam las langs bas mngon du byas nas /
translated: This knowledge is manifested by rising from the path of seeing that occurs at the conclusion of the third mind.

original: sngon 'jig rten pa'i shes pas dpyad nas /üîΩrnam par gzhag pa'i bden pa sa 'og ma pa sa 'og ma'i dbang gis byung ba dang / sa 'og ma pas gong ma'i dbang gis byung ba rnams la /
analyzed: sngon 'jig rten pa'i shes pas dpyad nas / rnam par gzhag pa'i bden pa sa 'og ma pa sa 'og ma'i dbang gis byung ba dang / sa 'og ma pas gong ma'i dbang gis byung ba rnams la /
translated: Having analyzed with mundane consciousness,üîΩthe truths that are posited are arisen by the power of the lower level for those on the lower level and arisen by the power of the higher level for those on the higher level.

original: chos dang rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang 'dra ba kun rdzob shes pa /üîΩ'jig rten @70a * //
analyzed: chos dang rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang 'dra ba kun rdzob shes pa / 'jig rten @70a * //
translated: The conventional knowledge that is similar to Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge arises in relation to the truths.üîΩConventional knowledge is mundane or supramundane.

original: pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'am /
analyzed: pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'am /
translated: Conventional knowledge is either mundane laukika or supramundane lokottara.üîΩConventional knowledge that is mundane laukika is the conventional knowledge that is obtained through preparation.üîΩConventional knowledge that is supramundane lokottara is the conventional knowledge that is obtained subsequent to the transcendent path.üîΩConventional knowledge that is supramundane lokottara is the conventional knowledge that is obtained subsequent to the transcendent path.üîΩConventional knowledge that is supramundane lokottara is the conventional knowledge that is obtained subsequent to the transcendent path.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes las thob pa'i shes pas bden pa re re la yang go rims bzhin du 'dod pa'i shes pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa nges pa'i shes pa gnyis gnyis 'byung ba ste /üîΩde ltar mngon par rtogs pa snga ma las langs pa la gong ma'am 'og ma'i bden pa dag la /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes las thob pa'i shes pas bden pa re re la yang go rims bzhin du 'dod pa'i shes pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa nges pa'i shes pa gnyis gnyis 'byung ba ste / de ltar mngon par rtogs pa snga ma las langs pa la gong ma'am 'og ma'i bden pa dag la /
translated: Conventional knowledge that is supramundane lokottara is the conventional knowledge that is obtained subsequent to the transcendent path.üîΩConventional knowledge that is supramundane lokottara is the conventional knowledge that is obtained subsequent to the transcendent path.

original: shes pa gnyis gnyis 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa gnyis gnyis 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Conventional knowledge that is supramundane lokottara is the conventional knowledge that is obtained subsequent to the transcendent path.üîΩConventional knowledge that is supramundane lokottara is the conventional knowledge that is obtained subsequent to the transcendent path.üîΩConventional knowledge that is supramundane lokottara is the conventional knowledge that is obtained subsequent to the transcendent path.üîΩConventional knowledge that is supramundane lokottara is the conventional knowledge that is obtained subsequent to the transcendent path.üîΩConventional knowledge that is supramundane lokottara is the conventional knowledge that is obtained subsequent to the transcendent path.üîΩConventional knowledge that is supramundane lokottara is the conventional knowledge that is obtained subsequent to the transcendent path.üîΩConventional knowledge that is supramundane lokottara is the conventional knowledge that is obtained subsequent to the transcendent path.üîΩConventional knowledge that is supramundane lokottara is the conventional knowledge that is obtained subsequent to the transcendent path.üîΩConventional knowledge that is supramundane lokottara is the conventional knowledge that is obtained subsequent to the transcendent path.üîΩConventional knowledge that is supramundane lokottara is the conventional knowledge that is obtained subsequent to the transcendent path.üîΩConventional knowledge that is supramundane lokottara is the conventional knowledge that is obtained subsequent to the transcendent path.

original: de la shes pa snga ma ni brda bsal ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de la shes pa snga ma ni brda bsal ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa yin no //
translated: The former cognition is non-conceptual because it has as its object a dharma whose sign has been eliminated.

original: shes pa phyi ma ni brda ma bsal ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa phyi ma ni brda ma bsal ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The latter cognition is conceptual because it has as its object a dharma whose sign has not been eliminated.

original: yang snga mas ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal gnas las spong bar byed do //
analyzed: yang snga mas ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal gnas las spong bar byed do //
translated: Moreover, the former eliminates the latent impressions of the afflictions that are to be eliminated by the path of seeing.

original: phyi mas ni dmigs pa yid la byed pas de dag nyid kyi 'jug pa spong bar byed do //
analyzed: phyi mas ni dmigs pa yid la byed pas de dag nyid kyi 'jug pa spong bar byed do //
translated: The latter eliminates the activity of those very afflictions by bringing their object to mind.

original: yang snga mas ni bsgom pa'i lam la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis spong bar byed do //
analyzed: yang snga mas ni bsgom pa'i lam la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis spong bar byed do //
translated: Moreover, the former eliminates by means of the supramundane path on the path of cultivation.

original: phyi mas ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis spong bar byed do //
analyzed: phyi mas ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis spong bar byed do //
translated: The latter eliminates by means of the mundane and supramundane paths.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam 'ba' zhig gis bag la nyal yang dag par 'joms pa ni med de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam 'ba' zhig gis bag la nyal yang dag par 'joms pa ni med de /
translated: There is no complete destruction of latent impressions by the mundane path alone.

original: 'jig rten pa ni 'dris pa'i phyir dang / mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni 'dris pa'i phyir dang / mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mundane path is not able to do this because it is familiar with the world and engages by adhering to signs.

original: de ni ji ltar mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pas 'jug pa de ltar mtshan ma rnam par 'jig par 'jug par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pas 'jug pa de ltar mtshan ma rnam par 'jig par 'jug par mi 'gyur la /
translated: It does not engage in the destruction of signs in the way that it engages by adhering to signs.

original: ji ltar mtshan ma rnam par 'jig par mi 'jug pa de ltar gnas ngan len yang dag par 'joms par yang 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan ma rnam par 'jig par mi 'jug pa de ltar gnas ngan len yang dag par 'joms par yang 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And it does not engage in the destruction of negative conditioning in the way that it does not engage in the destruction of signs.

original: de'i phyir des bag la nyal yang dag par 'joms pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir des bag la nyal yang dag par 'joms pa med do //
translated: Therefore, it does not destroy the latent afflictions.

original: mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the final clear realization?

original: smras pa / bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba dag spangs pa la zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa gcig tu 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa ni tshe 'di la nyon mongs pa thams cad nges par spangs pa dang /
analyzed: smras pa / bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba dag spangs pa la zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa gcig tu 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa ni tshe 'di la nyon mongs pa thams cad nges par spangs pa dang /
translated: It is the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising that are one in transcending the world and in transcending the world and the mundane.

original: phyi ma la yang phung po thams cad nges par 'gags pas na /
analyzed: phyi ma la yang phung po thams cad nges par 'gags pas na /
translated: In the latter case, all the aggregates definitely cease.

original: mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The latter is called the final clear knowledge, because all the aggregates are definitely stopped.

original: @70b de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zad pa shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: @70b de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zad pa shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of extinction which is supramundane?
