original: zad pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of extinction which is free from conceptual differentiation.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zad pa shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zad pa shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of extinction which is mundane and supramundane?

original: zad pa las rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa las rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of extinction which is associated with conceptual differentiation.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mi skye ba shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mi skye ba shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of non-arising which is supramundane?

original: smras pa / phung po 'gag pa de nyid kyi rgyu'i don gyis phyi mar phung po mi skye ba la rnam par mi rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / phung po 'gag pa de nyid kyi rgyu'i don gyis phyi mar phung po mi skye ba la rnam par mi rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of non-arising which is free from conceptual differentiation, in regard to the non-arising of the aggregates in the future, by the cessation of the aggregates in this very life.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mi skye ba'i shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mi skye ba'i shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of non-arising which is mundane and supramundane?

original: smras pa / phyi mar phung po mi skye ba la rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / phyi mar phung po mi skye ba la rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: He replied: ‚ÄúIt is the conceptualization of the non-arising of the aggregates in the future.

original: rigs bram ze gang dag yin pa de dag ni gnas gsum po dag yang dag pa dang / bden pa las 'dogs par byed cing /
analyzed: rigs bram ze gang dag yin pa de dag ni gnas gsum po dag yang dag pa dang / bden pa las 'dogs par byed cing /
translated: Those who are of the brahmin class are those who impute from the three bases in a correct and truthful way.

original: de nas kyang rigs bram ze de dag gnas gsum po de dag nyid la nyes pa gsum gyis yang dag par skyon chags pa'i sems kyis gnas par byed do //
analyzed: de nas kyang rigs bram ze de dag gnas gsum po de dag nyid la nyes pa gsum gyis yang dag par skyon chags pa'i sems kyis gnas par byed do //
translated: Then, those brahmins of that class dwell with a mind that is flawed by three faults in relation to those very three bases.

original: de ltar de dag ni don dam par bram ze ma yin pa'i grangs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni don dam par bram ze ma yin pa'i grangs su 'gro'o //
translated: In that way, they are counted as not being brahmins in the ultimate sense.

original: gnas gsum po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas gsum po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three bases?

original: 'tsho ba dang bsod nams yang dag par rtsom pa dang / 'bras bu la sems pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba dang bsod nams yang dag par rtsom pa dang / 'bras bu la sems pa'o //
translated: They are livelihood, the correct performance of merit, and reflection on the result.

original: de la rigs bram ze rnams kyi 'tsho ba ni shis par brjod pa dang / bstod pa dang / 'dod pa brjod pa dag gis 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: de la rigs bram ze rnams kyi 'tsho ba ni shis par brjod pa dang / bstod pa dang / 'dod pa brjod pa dag gis 'tsho ba ste /
translated: In that regard, the livelihood of those of the brahmin class is to live by auspicious statements, praise, and the expression of desires.

original: de la rigs bram ze rnams ni rgyal po'am /
analyzed: de la rigs bram ze rnams ni rgyal po'am /
translated: In that regard, those of the brahmin class are either kings,üîΩor great ministers,

original: blon po chen po'am /
analyzed: blon po chen po'am /
translated: a great minister,üîΩüîΩ

original: bram ze'am / khyim bdag gam /üîΩgrong rdal gyi mi'am /
analyzed: bram ze'am / khyim bdag gam / grong rdal gyi mi'am /
translated: a brahmin, a householder,üîΩa townsman,

original: yul gyi mi'am /
analyzed: yul gyi mi'am /
translated: a countryman,

original: nor can nam /üîΩtshongs dpon nam /
analyzed: nor can nam / tshongs dpon nam /
translated: a wealthy man,üîΩa guild master,

original: ded dpon nam /
analyzed: ded dpon nam /
translated: a caravan leader,

original: gang las 'tsho ba'i yo byad slong bar byed pa de la /
analyzed: gang las 'tsho ba'i yo byad slong bar byed pa de la /
translated: or anyone else from whom he might obtain the requisites of life,

original: de dag 'di skad du /
analyzed: de dag 'di skad du /
translated: he will say to them,üîΩ‚ÄúMay your enemies be destroyed, may they be annihilated, may they be miserable, may they be overcome, may they be killed.

original: khyod kyi dgra rnams ni zad de rmeg med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / zil gyis non pa dang / gsad par gyur cig / de bzhin du khyod kyi dpal dang dbang thang ni mi g-yo ba dang / rtag pa dang mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: khyod kyi dgra rnams ni zad de rmeg med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / zil gyis non pa dang / gsad par gyur cig / de bzhin du khyod kyi dpal dang dbang thang ni mi g-yo ba dang / rtag pa dang mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: May your glory, good fortune, stability, permanence, immutability,

original: mi 'phrogs par gyur cig ces shis par brjod pa sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: mi 'phrogs par gyur cig ces shis par brjod pa sbyor bar byed do //
translated: and invincibility be unshakable.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du bstod pa yang sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du bstod pa yang sbyor bar byed de /
translated: He will also praise them,

original: 'di ltar khyod ni dpa' bo yin no //üîΩnyams stobs dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod ni dpa' bo yin no // nyams stobs dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: saying, ‚ÄúYou are a hero!üîΩYou are strong!

original: snying stobs can yin no //üîΩkhyod ni dgra rnams gsod par nus pa yin no zhes bstod par yang byed do //
analyzed: snying stobs can yin no // khyod ni dgra rnams gsod par nus pa yin no zhes bstod par yang byed do //
translated: You are courageous!üîΩYou are able to kill your enemies!‚Äù

original: dgra rnams gsad @71a * //
analyzed: dgra rnams gsad @71a * //
translated: He will kill his enemies

original: par gyur na ni 'di skad ces brjod de /
analyzed: par gyur na ni 'di skad ces brjod de /
translated: If he is a painter, he says:

original: khyod kyis ni 'di lta 'di ltar dgra rnams nges par bsad pa yin te /
analyzed: khyod kyis ni 'di lta 'di ltar dgra rnams nges par bsad pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúYou have killed your enemies in this way and that way.

original: khyod ltar dgra rnams dang bral ba'i skye bo ni 'jig rten na dkon no zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: khyod ltar dgra rnams dang bral ba'i skye bo ni 'jig rten na dkon no zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: There is no one in the world who is as free from enemies as you are.‚Äù

original: yun ring po nas longs spyod dang yongs su spyod pa dang ldan pa las brtsams nas kyang 'di skad du /
analyzed: yun ring po nas longs spyod dang yongs su spyod pa dang ldan pa las brtsams nas kyang 'di skad du /
translated: He also speaks of his long enjoyment and use of the objects of the senses, saying:

original: khyod lta bu ni 'jig rten na dkon te /
analyzed: khyod lta bu ni 'jig rten na dkon te /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no one in the world who is as fortunate as you are.

original: 'di ltar dpal dang dbang thang mi g-yo ba dang ldan pa yin no zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dpal dang dbang thang mi g-yo ba dang ldan pa yin no zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: You are endowed with such unwavering glory and power.‚Äù

original: de skad ces 'dod pa brjod pa sbyor bar yang byed de //
analyzed: de skad ces 'dod pa brjod pa sbyor bar yang byed de //
translated: He speaks in this way, praising what is desired.

original: khyod ni skyes bu dam pa'i mtshan 'di lta bu dag dang ldan pa nas ring po mi thogs par khyod kyi dgra thams cad zad de rmeg med pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / bsad par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyod ni skyes bu dam pa'i mtshan 'di lta bu dag dang ldan pa nas ring po mi thogs par khyod kyi dgra thams cad zad de rmeg med pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / bsad par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúYou are endowed with the marks of a great man. Before long all your enemies will be destroyed, annihilated, overcome, and killed.‚Äù

original: khyod ni 'di lta bu'i mtshan dang ldan na /
analyzed: khyod ni 'di lta bu'i mtshan dang ldan na /
translated: You have such and such marks.

original: lag rkyong dpal dang dbang thang mi g-yo ba dang ldan par 'gyur zhes kyang rjod par byed do //
analyzed: lag rkyong dpal dang dbang thang mi g-yo ba dang ldan par 'gyur zhes kyang rjod par byed do //
translated: You will have the glory of open hands, and your power will be unshakable.

original: de dag mdza' bshes kyi khyim dang / slong mo ster ba'i khyim de dag la yang /
analyzed: de dag mdza' bshes kyi khyim dang / slong mo ster ba'i khyim de dag la yang /
translated: They also think of those families that are their friends and those that give them alms:

original: khyim 'di dag ni bdag gi yin gyi /
analyzed: khyim 'di dag ni bdag gi yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúThese families are mine.

original: 'di dag ni dge sbyong dang bram ze gzhan dag gis blang ba ni ma yin no snyam du bdag gir 'dzin par yang byed do //üîΩde dag gis de nas rnyed pa chos gos sam /
analyzed: 'di dag ni dge sbyong dang bram ze gzhan dag gis blang ba ni ma yin no snyam du bdag gir 'dzin par yang byed do // de dag gis de nas rnyed pa chos gos sam /
translated: They are not to be taken by other ascetics or brahmins.‚ÄùüîΩWhatever they get from those families‚Äî

original: bsod snyoms sam ;
analyzed: bsod snyoms sam ;
translated: robes, alms-food,üîΩbeds and seats, and medicines for the sick‚ÄîüîΩthey use with attachment,

original: mal cha'am / stan la sogs pa ji snyed pa'i rnyed pa de dag kyang chags pa dang / zhen pa dang / 'chums pa dang / mdud pa bor pa dang / brgyal ba dang / lhag par chags pa dang / lhag par chags par gyur pas yongs su longs spyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mal cha'am / stan la sogs pa ji snyed pa'i rnyed pa de dag kyang chags pa dang / zhen pa dang / 'chums pa dang / mdud pa bor pa dang / brgyal ba dang / lhag par chags pa dang / lhag par chags par gyur pas yongs su longs spyod par byed pa'o //
translated: with desire, with fondness, with love, with craving, with obsession, with infatuation, with lust, with lustfulness, with lusting, with lustful desire, with lustful longing, with lustful fondness, with lustful love, with lustful craving, with lustful obsession, with lustful infatuation, with lustful passion.

original: de la rigs bram ze rnams kyi bsod nams yang dag par rtsom pa ni srog chags rnam pa sna tshogs du ma gsod ba dang ldan pa'i mchod sbyin ston par byed pa dang / mchod sbyin de'i 'bras bu rtag pa'i gnas yin par brtag par ston pa dang /
analyzed: de la rigs bram ze rnams kyi bsod nams yang dag par rtsom pa ni srog chags rnam pa sna tshogs du ma gsod ba dang ldan pa'i mchod sbyin ston par byed pa dang / mchod sbyin de'i 'bras bu rtag pa'i gnas yin par brtag par ston pa dang /
translated: The result of that sacrifice is considered to be a permanent state.

original: mchod sbyin rtsom pa der mgron du gnyer ba rnams kyang blang ba sna tshogs mchog mang po bdag gir bya ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis gcig la gcig brgyud cing 'khu ba'i sems mngon par 'du byed pa ste /
analyzed: mchod sbyin rtsom pa der mgron du gnyer ba rnams kyang blang ba sna tshogs mchog mang po bdag gir bya ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis gcig la gcig brgyud cing 'khu ba'i sems mngon par 'du byed pa ste /
translated: The guests invited to that performance of sacrifice, for their part, arouse thoughts of mutual envy on account of the many excellent things that they receive.

original: rnam pa gsum po de dag gis yang dag par rtsom bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po de dag gis yang dag par rtsom bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the performance of merit is of these three kinds.

original: de la rigs bram ze rnams kyi 'bras bu la sems pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rigs bram ze rnams kyi 'bras bu la sems pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The Brahmins‚Äô reflection on the result is as follows:

original: @71b lha ma yin gyi rigs rnams ni rigs gsad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: @71b lha ma yin gyi rigs rnams ni rigs gsad par bya ba yin no //
translated: The classes of asuras are to be destroyed.

original: lha'i rigs rnams ni rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i rigs rnams ni rtag pa yin no //
translated: The classes of gods are permanent.

original: bram ze'i rigs rnams ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs rnams ni mchog yin no //
translated: The class of Brahmins is supreme.

original: rigs gzhan ni dman pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs gzhan ni dman pa yin no //
translated: The other castes are inferior.

original: bram ze'i rigs ni rgyas par tshangs pa las skyes pa dang / tshangs pas sprul pa dang / tshangs pa'i bgo skal la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs ni rgyas par tshangs pa las skyes pa dang / tshangs pas sprul pa dang / tshangs pa'i bgo skal la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: The brahmin caste is extensive, from Brahma, born of Brahma, created by Brahma, heirs of Brahma.

original: rigs bram ze gang yin pa de dag gi 'bras bu la sems pa ni bsam pa de lta bu dang brjod pa de lta bu dag gis rig par bya'o //üîΩde ltar rigs bram ze rnams ni gnas gsum po de dag la 'di ni bden pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: rigs bram ze gang yin pa de dag gi 'bras bu la sems pa ni bsam pa de lta bu dang brjod pa de lta bu dag gis rig par bya'o // de ltar rigs bram ze rnams ni gnas gsum po de dag la 'di ni bden pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: The fruit of the brahmin caste is to be known by such thoughts and such expressions.üîΩThus, the brahmin caste, in regard to these three points, insists: This is the truth, the rest is false.

original: gzhan ni brdzun pa yin no zhes nan gyis mchog tu bzung zhing mngon par zhen par byas nas tha snyad 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan ni brdzun pa yin no zhes nan gyis mchog tu bzung zhing mngon par zhen par byas nas tha snyad 'dogs par byed do //
translated: Having thus grasped and insisted upon the superiority of their caste, they make use of it.

original: nyes pa gsum po gang dag gis sems skyon chags par gyur ce na /
analyzed: nyes pa gsum po gang dag gis sems skyon chags par gyur ce na /
translated: By what three faults is the mind defiled?

original: ngag gi nyes pa dang / nga rgyal gyi nyes pa dang / mos pa'i nyes pas so //
analyzed: ngag gi nyes pa dang / nga rgyal gyi nyes pa dang / mos pa'i nyes pas so //
translated: By the fault of speech, the fault of pride, and the fault of faithlessness.

original: gnas gsum po de dag nyid la ngag log par 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni ngag gi nyes pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas gsum po de dag nyid la ngag log par 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni ngag gi nyes pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the faults of speech are the incorrect use of speech in regard to these three matters.üîΩIt should be understood that the faults of pride are the conceit of superiority,üîΩequality, or inferiority in regard to others, based on the imputation of the three improper matters and the expression of the three improper words.

original: gnas bzang po ma yin pa gsum gdags pa byas pa dang / tshig bzang po ma yin pa kun tu brjod pa las gzhan la brten te bdag che ba'am /üîΩmtshungs pa'am / chung bar rlom sems byed pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi nga rgyal gyi nyes pa yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩde dag gnas gsum po de dag nyid la yon tan dang skyon ma dpyad par gnas de dag la gcig tu mos par byed cing /
analyzed: gnas bzang po ma yin pa gsum gdags pa byas pa dang / tshig bzang po ma yin pa kun tu brjod pa las gzhan la brten te bdag che ba'am / mtshungs pa'am / chung bar rlom sems byed pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi nga rgyal gyi nyes pa yin par rig par bya'o // de dag gnas gsum po de dag nyid la yon tan dang skyon ma dpyad par gnas de dag la gcig tu mos par byed cing /
translated: It should be understood that the faults of lack of conviction are the lack of conviction in the three matters, the lack of conviction in the three jewels, and the lack of conviction in the three times.üîΩIt should be understood that the faults of lack of application are the lack of application to the three trainings, the lack of application to the three doors of liberation, and the lack of application to the three causes of wisdom.üîΩIt should be understood that the faults of lack of skill in means are the lack of skill in means in regard to the three matters, the lack of skill in means in regard to the three realms, and the lack of skill in means in regard to the three doors of discrimination.üîΩIt should be understood that the faults of lack of purity are the lack of purity of the three matters, the lack of purity of the three knowledges, and the lack of purity of the three vehicles.

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis legs par gdams pa mdzad cing legs par rjes su bstan pa mdzad kyang gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la legs par mi gnas pa dang / yongs su brtags pa la legs par mi gnas pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis legs par gdams pa mdzad cing legs par rjes su bstan pa mdzad kyang gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la legs par mi gnas pa dang / yongs su brtags pa la legs par mi gnas pa dang /
translated: It should be understood that the faults of lack of conviction are the lack of conviction in the three matters, the lack of conviction in the three jewels, and the lack of conviction in the three times.üîΩIt should be understood that the faults of lack of application are the lack of application to the three trainings, the lack of application to the three doors of liberation, and the lack of application to the three causes of wisdom.üîΩIt should be understood that the faults of lack of skill in means are the lack of skill in means in regard to the three matters, the lack of skill in means in regard to the three realms, and the lack of skill in means in regard to the three doors of discrimination.üîΩIt should be understood that the faults of lack of purity are the lack of purity of the three matters, the lack of purity of the three knowledges, and the lack of purity of the three vehicles.

original: lam la legs par mi gnas pa dang / shis pa brjod pa la legs par mi gnas pa de ni de dag gi mos pa'i nyes pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lam la legs par mi gnas pa dang / shis pa brjod pa la legs par mi gnas pa de ni de dag gi mos pa'i nyes pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The fault of their interest should be understood as their lack of skill in the path and their lack of skill in the auspicious rites.

original: nyes pa gsum po de dag kyang lta ba ngan pa'i nyes pas kun nas bslang ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes pa gsum po de dag kyang lta ba ngan pa'i nyes pas kun nas bslang ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These three faults should be understood as motivated by the fault of bad views.

original: de ltar na rigs bram ze rnams ni gnas gsum po de dag la nyes pa gsum po de dag dang ldan pas na don dam par bram ze ma @72a * //üîΩyin pa'i grangs su 'gro ba yin /
analyzed: de ltar na rigs bram ze rnams ni gnas gsum po de dag la nyes pa gsum po de dag dang ldan pas na don dam par bram ze ma @72a * // yin pa'i grangs su 'gro ba yin /
translated: Thus, because of these three faults in regard to these three topics, the brahmin caste does not really exist.

original: rigs bram ze ma yin yang gang dag gnas gsum po 'di dag bden pa dang / yang dag pa las 'dogs par byed na /
analyzed: rigs bram ze ma yin yang gang dag gnas gsum po 'di dag bden pa dang / yang dag pa las 'dogs par byed na /
translated: But those who, although not of the brahmin caste, are attached to these three topics as true and real,

original: de dag ni gnas gsum po de dag la nyes pa gsum gyis sems skyon chags pa med pas de dag ni rigs bram ze ma yin yang don dam par bram ze zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: de dag ni gnas gsum po de dag la nyes pa gsum gyis sems skyon chags pa med pas de dag ni rigs bram ze ma yin yang don dam par bram ze zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
translated: because of their lack of mental fault in regard to these three topics, they are counted as true brahmins, even though they are not of the brahmin caste.

original: gnas gsum po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas gsum po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three topics?

original: sems can thams cad gsad par bya ba ma yin no zhes gnas dang po 'di smra na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gsad par bya ba ma yin no zhes gnas dang po 'di smra na /
translated: ‚ÄúAll sentient beings should not be killed.‚Äù

original: bden pa nyid smra ba yin gyi brdzun pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bden pa nyid smra ba yin gyi brdzun pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If they speak this way, they are speaking the truth, not lies.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi gnas dang po 'di la ngag gi nyes pas skyon chags pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi gnas dang po 'di la ngag gi nyes pas skyon chags pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not at fault in this first respect because of a defect in speech.

original: de dag gnas de dang bden pa smra ba des gzhan la brten nas bdag nyid che ba'am /
analyzed: de dag gnas de dang bden pa smra ba des gzhan la brten nas bdag nyid che ba'am /
translated: Because of that truth and because of that speech, they do not think of themselves as superior,

original: mtshungs pa'am / chung ba rlom sems mi byed pas de'i phyir de dag gnas de la nga rgyal gyi nyes pas yang dag par skyon chags pa med pa'i yid dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'am / chung ba rlom sems mi byed pas de'i phyir de dag gnas de la nga rgyal gyi nyes pas yang dag par skyon chags pa med pa'i yid dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: equal, or inferior to others. Therefore, they are not at fault in this respect because of a defect in pride.üîΩBecause of that object that is investigated in terms of good qualities and faults, they see that wholesome actions increase. Therefore, they are not at fault in this respect because of a defect in action.

original: de dag gnas de la yon tan dang skyon rnam par dpyad pas dmigs pa des dge ba'i chos rnams mngon par 'phel ba yang dag par rjes su mthong bas kha na ma tho ba med pa'i lus dang sems kyis phan 'dogs pa tshe 'di la bde bar gnas
analyzed: de dag gnas de la yon tan dang skyon rnam par dpyad pas dmigs pa des dge ba'i chos rnams mngon par 'phel ba yang dag par rjes su mthong bas kha na ma tho ba med pa'i lus dang sems kyis phan 'dogs pa tshe 'di la bde bar gnas
translated: They are happy in this life because they help others with a wholesome body and mind.

original: pas / sems can thams cad la byams pa'i rang bzhin gyis nyin mtshan du rjes su slob cing lan mang du gnas so //
analyzed: pas / sems can thams cad la byams pa'i rang bzhin gyis nyin mtshan du rjes su slob cing lan mang du gnas so //
translated: Thus, he is constantly and always engaged in the practice of loving kindness toward all sentient beings.

original: gnas de la gzhan dag gis dad pas mi 'gro zhing bdag rang gis bden pa de legs par mngon par rtogs pas de dag ni bden zhing mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnas de la gzhan dag gis dad pas mi 'gro zhing bdag rang gis bden pa de legs par mngon par rtogs pas de dag ni bden zhing mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: He does not go to others for faith in this matter, but he himself has realized the truth of this matter. Therefore, he is said to have a mind that is not defiled by the fault of adherence to opinion.

original: de'i phyir mos pa'i nyes pas skyon chags pa med pa'i sems dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mos pa'i nyes pas skyon chags pa med pa'i sems dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, he is said to have a mind that is not defiled by the fault of adherence to opinion.

original: de bzhin du 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni gnas gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni gnas gnyis pa ste /
translated: Similarly, ‚Äúall formations are impermanent‚Äù is the second station.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni gnas gsum pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni gnas gsum pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAll dharmas are without self‚Äù is the third station.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The rest is to be understood as before.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
translated: But there is this difference.

original: bden pa gnyis pa la ni 'du byed thams cad las 'byung ba dang 'jig par rjes su lta bas nyin mtshan du rjes su slob cing lan mang du gnas so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis pa la ni 'du byed thams cad las 'byung ba dang 'jig par rjes su lta bas nyin mtshan du rjes su slob cing lan mang du gnas so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the second truth, one should say that they follow day and night and dwell on it many times, by following the arising and passing away of all formations.

original: bden pa gsum pa la ni chos thams @72b cad la bdag gir 'dzin pa med pa'i tshul gyis nyin mtshan du rjes su slob cing lan mang du gnas so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa gsum pa la ni chos thams @72b cad la bdag gir 'dzin pa med pa'i tshul gyis nyin mtshan du rjes su slob cing lan mang du gnas so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the third truth, one should say that they follow day and night and dwell on it many times, by the method of not grasping any phenomena as one‚Äôs own.

original: gnas gsum po de dag la nyes pa gsum po de dag gis yang dag par skyon chags pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa de dag ni rigs bram ze ma yin yang don dam par bram ze zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas gsum po de dag la nyes pa gsum po de dag gis yang dag par skyon chags pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa de dag ni rigs bram ze ma yin yang don dam par bram ze zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Those who have minds that are not truly defiled by those three faults in those three abodes are counted as ultimate brahmins, even though they are not of the brahmin caste.

original: bram zer byed pa'i gnas gsum po bden pa las nyes pa gsum dang bral ba de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa kho nas mngon par rdzogs par thugs su chud de //
analyzed: bram zer byed pa'i gnas gsum po bden pa las nyes pa gsum dang bral ba de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa kho nas mngon par rdzogs par thugs su chud de //
translated: The TathƒÅgata alone has fully understood those three faults in the three abodes of brahmins, which are based on the truths.

original: de dag ni mdo las sems can thams cad bsad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba dang / 'byung ba'i chos can gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni 'gog pa'i chos can yin no zhes bya ba dang / bdag kyang med la bdag gi yang med de /
analyzed: de dag ni mdo las sems can thams cad bsad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba dang / 'byung ba'i chos can gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni 'gog pa'i chos can yin no zhes bya ba dang / bdag kyang med la bdag gi yang med de /
translated: ‚Äúthere is no life-force and no person,‚Äù

original: bdag gi ni ci yang med gang yang med gang na yang med do //
analyzed: bdag gi ni ci yang med gang yang med gang na yang med do //
translated: ‚Äúthere is no self and no mine,‚Äù ‚Äúthere is nothing that is mine, there is no one whose it is, there is no one who has it,‚Äù

original: bdag kyang ci yang med gang yang med gang na yang med do zhes ji skad gsungs pa'i don rgya cher bshad pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag kyang ci yang med gang yang med gang na yang med do zhes ji skad gsungs pa'i don rgya cher bshad pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: ‚Äúthere is no self, there is nothing that is mine,‚Äù should be understood as explained extensively in the sutra.

original: phung po rnams kyi gnas skabs du yod ce na /
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi gnas skabs du yod ce na /
translated: How many states of the aggregates are there?

original: smras pa / mang ste sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa / mang ste sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Many, but they are not associated with the mind.

original: 'thob pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa rgyas par sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //üîΩ'thob pa gnas skabs gang la gdags /
analyzed: 'thob pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa rgyas par sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o // 'thob pa gnas skabs gang la gdags /
translated: They should be understood in detail as previously explained, such as obtainment, the meditative attainment of nonperception and so on.üîΩIn what state is obtainment projected?

original: 'thob pa la rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: 'thob pa la rnam pa du yod ce na /
translated: How many types of obtainment are there?

original: smras pa / rgyu'i dbang kun tu 'byung ba'i gnas skabs la'o //
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu'i dbang kun tu 'byung ba'i gnas skabs la'o //
translated: He says: In the state of the origination of the power of the cause.

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sa bon dang ldan pa dang / dbang dang ldan pa dang / kun tu spyod pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang ldan pa dang / dbang dang ldan pa dang / kun tu spyod pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Possessing seeds, possessing power, and possessing practice.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa gnas skabs gang la gdags /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa gnas skabs gang la gdags /
translated: In what state are the meditative attainment of non-perception, the meditative attainment of cessation, and the state of non-perception posited?

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa la rnam pa du yod ce na /üîΩsmas pa / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral la /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa la rnam pa du yod ce na / smas pa / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral la /
translated: How many types are there of the meditative attainment of non-perception, the meditative attainment of cessation, and the state of non-perception?

original: gong ma'i ma yin pa'i 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas ming 'gog pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
analyzed: gong ma'i ma yin pa'i 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas ming 'gog pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
translated: He says: The meditative attainment of non-perception is in the state of the cessation of name-and-form due to the mental attention preceded by the discernment of the elements that is free from attachment to the desire realmüîΩbut not to the higher realms.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, it is of three types:

original: ngo bo nyid las @73a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las @73a * //
translated: By nature,

original: ni dge ba yin no //
analyzed: ni dge ba yin no //
translated: it is virtuous.

original: gang zag las ni so so'i skye bo'i rgyud du gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zag las ni so so'i skye bo'i rgyud du gtogs pa yin no //
translated: The person is one who belongs to the class of ordinary beings.

original: skye ba las ni dang po 'dir bskyed cing de'i 'og tu gzugs kyi khams su bsam gtan bzhi pa la 'bras bu las so sor myong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba las ni dang po 'dir bskyed cing de'i 'og tu gzugs kyi khams su bsam gtan bzhi pa la 'bras bu las so sor myong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: As for the mode of birth, it is first generated here in the desire realm and then its result is experienced in the form realm, in the fourth absorption.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas ming 'gog pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas ming 'gog pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation is a state of the mere cessation of mind and mental factors, preceded by the perception of a state of peace, and is free from attachment to the sphere of nothingness.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is of three types:

original: ngo bo nyid las ni dge ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las ni dge ba nyid yin no //
translated: by nature, it is virtuous;

original: gang zag las ni 'phags pa'i rgyud du gtogs te /
analyzed: gang zag las ni 'phags pa'i rgyud du gtogs te /
translated: by person, it belongs to the class of ƒÅryas;

original: slob pa'i rgyud dam mi slob pa'i rgyud du gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: slob pa'i rgyud dam mi slob pa'i rgyud du gtogs pa yin no //
translated: it belongs to the class of learners or the class of nonlearners.

original: skye ba las ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par ma bzhag na ni dang por 'dir skyed cing /
analyzed: skye ba las ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par ma bzhag na ni dang por 'dir skyed cing /
translated: As for the mode of birth, if the foundation consciousness is not posited, it is first generated here in the desire realm,

original: de'i 'og tu gzugs kyi khams su mngon du byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gzugs kyi khams su mngon du byed do //
translated: and then it is actualized in the form realm.

original: mngon du byed pa de ni gzugs kyi lus la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon du byed pa de ni gzugs kyi lus la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the manifestation of the latter is dependent on the material body.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par gzhag na ni mngon du byed pa thams cad du 'gro ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par gzhag na ni mngon du byed pa thams cad du 'gro ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: But when the store-consciousness is posited, the manifestation is all-pervading.

original: 'du shes med pa pa ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'i ming 'gog pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'i ming 'gog pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
translated: The state of non-perception is the state of cessation for those who have been born among the gods who are devoid of perception.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: This is threefold:

original: ngo bo nyid las ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: In terms of its intrinsic nature, it is unobscured and indeterminate.

original: gang zag las ni so so'i skye bo kho na der skye'o //
analyzed: gang zag las ni so so'i skye bo kho na der skye'o //
translated: In terms of the person, only ordinary beings are born there,

original: 'phags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: not noble ones.

original: skye ba las ni de ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sgrub par byed pa'i sems pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin te ;
analyzed: skye ba las ni de ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sgrub par byed pa'i sems pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin te ;
translated: In terms of its origination, it is the ripened result of the volition that accomplishes the attainment of the state of non-perception.

original: 'du shes skyes nas sems can de dag de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes skyes nas sems can de dag de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When the perception of those sentient beings who are born there arises, they die and pass away from that state.

original: srog gi dbang po gnas skabs gang la gdags /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po gnas skabs gang la gdags /
translated: In what state is the faculty of life force designated?

original: de rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: de rnam pa du yod ce na /
translated: How many kinds are there?

original: smras pa / las kyis 'phangs pa'i rnam par smin pa gnas pa'i dus nges pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
analyzed: smras pa / las kyis 'phangs pa'i rnam par smin pa gnas pa'i dus nges pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
translated: It is said: In the state where the duration of the ripening of karma projected is definite.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: And that is of three kinds:

original: nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa dang / lo dang bskal pa'i grangs rnam par gzhag pa las so //
analyzed: nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa dang / lo dang bskal pa'i grangs rnam par gzhag pa las so //
translated: definite, indefinite, and in terms of the arrangement of the number of years and eons, desired and undesired.

original: ris mthun pa gnas skabs gang la gdags /
analyzed: ris mthun pa gnas skabs gang la gdags /
translated: In what state is the similarity of type designated?

original: de rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: de rnam pa du yod ce na /
translated: How many kinds are there?

original: smras pa / sems can 'dra ba'i gnas skabs la'o //
analyzed: smras pa / sems can 'dra ba'i gnas skabs la'o //
translated: It is said: In the state of similarity of sentient beings.

original: rnam pa @73b gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa @73b gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds:

original: skye ba rigs mthun pa dang / rang bzhin rigs mthun pa dang / bzo dang las kyi gnas kyis 'tsho ba'i rigs mthun pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba rigs mthun pa dang / rang bzhin rigs mthun pa dang / bzo dang las kyi gnas kyis 'tsho ba'i rigs mthun pa'o //
translated: similarity of type in birth, similarity of type in nature, and similarity of type in livelihood through crafts and activities.

analyzed: skye ba gnas skabs gang la gdags /

original: rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa du yod ce na /

analyzed: smras pa / da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs la'o //

analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste skad cig gi skye ba dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skye ba dang / gnas skabs kyi skye ba'o //

analyzed: rga ba gnas skabs gang la gdags /

analyzed: rnam pa du yod ce na /

analyzed: smras pa / snga phyi'i gnas skabs la'o //

original: gnas pa gnas skabs gang la gdags /
analyzed: gnas pa gnas skabs gang la gdags /

original: rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa du yod ce na /

original: rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: skad cig gnas pa dang / rgyun gnas pa dang / lugs gnas pa'o //

analyzed: rnam pa du yod ce na /

analyzed: smras pa / skyes nas zhig pa'i gnas skabs la'o //

analyzed: 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang / bral ba'i mi rtag pa nyid do //

original: rnam pa du yod ce na /

original: rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: nye bar 'dogs pa dang / yang dag pa'i dngos po dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa'o //

analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid gnas skabs gang la gdags /

original: rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa du yod ce na /

analyzed: smras pa / 'jig rten las 'das pa 'phags pa'i chos ma bskyed pa'i gnas skabs la'o //

analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types:

analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: those that occur in the desire realm, those that occur in the form realm, and those that occur in the formless realm.

analyzed: 'jug pa gnas skabs gang la gdags /

original: rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa du yod ce na /
translated: How many types are there?

analyzed: smras pa / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun gyi gnas skabs la'o /

original: rnam pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa ni gsum ste /

analyzed: @74a * // skad cig gcig nas gcig tu 'jug pa dang / skye ba gcig nas gcig tu 'jug pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba gcig nas gcig tu 'jug pa'o //

analyzed: so sor nges pa gnas skabs gang la gdags rnam pa du yod ce na /

original: rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: mtshan nyid so sor nges pa dang / rgyu so sor nges pa dang / 'bras bu so sor nges pa'o //

original: rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa du yod ce na /

analyzed: smras pa / rgyu dang 'bras bu mthun pa'i gnas skabs la'o //

translated: ‚ÄúIn what situation is speed applied?

original: rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa du yod ce na /
translated: How many kinds are there?‚Äù

analyzed: smras pa / myur du 'jug pa'i gnas skabs la'o //

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: 'du byed kyi mgyogs pa dang / skyes bu'i byed pa'i mgyogs pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi mgyogs pa'o //

original: rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa du yod ce na /

analyzed: smras pa / 'du byed re re nas 'jug pa'i gnas skabs la'o //

analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: skad cig 'jug pa'i go rims dang / lus 'jug pa'i go rims dang / bya ba bsgrub pa 'jug pa'i go rims so //

original: dus gnas skabs gang la gdags /
analyzed: dus gnas skabs gang la gdags /
translated: ‚ÄúIn what situation is time applied?

original: rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa du yod ce na /
translated: How many kinds are there?‚Äù

analyzed: smras pa / 'du byed kyi rgyun rgyun mi 'chad pa'i gnas skabs la'o //

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'o //

original: rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa du yod ce na /

analyzed: smras pa / gzugs yongs su gzung ba'i gnas skabs la'o //
translated: He said: ‚ÄúThe term ‚Äòobject‚Äô is used in the context of apprehending form.

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types:

analyzed: 'og gi yul dang / steng gi yul dang / thad ka'i yul lo //
translated: objects below, above, and to the side.

original: grangs gnas skabs gang la gdags /

original: rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa du yod ce na /

analyzed: smras pa / chos yongs su gzhal ba yang dag par mtshon pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
translated: He said: ‚ÄúThe term ‚Äònumber‚Äô is used in the context of discerning phenomena and accurately demonstrating them.

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types:

analyzed: gcig gi grangs dang / gnyis kyi grangs dang / mang po'i grangs so //
translated: the number one, the number two, and the number many.

original: tshogs pa gnas skabs gang la gdags /

analyzed: rnam pa du @74b yod ce na /
translated: And how many types of collections are there?‚Äù

analyzed: smras pa / bya ba'i yan lag ma tshang pa med pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
translated: He said: ‚ÄúThe term ‚Äòcollection‚Äô is used in the context of the complete set of factors for action.

original: rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: 'dus pa'i tshogs pa dang / don gcig gi tshogs pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshogs pa'o //

original: ma tshogs pa gnas skabs gang la gdags /
analyzed: ma tshogs pa gnas skabs gang la gdags /

original: rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa du yod ce na /

analyzed: smras pa / ma tshogs pa'i gnas skabs dang / rab tu dbye ba ni tshogs pa las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: It is said: The state of no assembly and the classification should be understood as the opposite of assembly.

original: de la phung po rnams la gzugs can gyi mtshan nyid ni gang /
analyzed: de la phung po rnams la gzugs can gyi mtshan nyid ni gang /
translated: Among the aggregates, what is the characteristic of form?

original: phung po rnams las du zhig ni gzugs can yin zhe na /
analyzed: phung po rnams las du zhig ni gzugs can yin zhe na /

analyzed: de nyid kyis de bshad par byas nas gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyi don gyi phung po gzugs can ni gcig go //
translated: He explains that very thing: ‚ÄúThe aggregate that is the intrinsic nature of form is one.‚Äù

original: bstan pa du yod pa rnams don gang gis yin /
analyzed: bstan pa du yod pa rnams don gang gis yin /
translated: By what meaning are the teachings that exist taught?

original: du yod ce na /
analyzed: du yod ce na /
translated: How many are there?

original: smras pa / bstan du yod pa'i mig gi spyod yul du don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / bstan du yod pa'i mig gi spyod yul du don gyis so //
translated: It is said: The teachings that exist are by the meaning of the object of the eye that is visible.

original: gcig gi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: gcig gi phyogs gcig go //
translated: One part of one.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams don gang gis yin du yod ce na ;
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams don gang gis yin du yod ce na ;
translated: By what meaning are those that are impeded taught? How many are there?

original: smras pa / thogs pa dang bcas pa ni phan tshun reg cing yul gnon pa'i don dang / rags pa'i don gyis de rags pa'i don ni cha phra ba rnam pa gsum ma gtogs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / thogs pa dang bcas pa ni phan tshun reg cing yul gnon pa'i don dang / rags pa'i don gyis de rags pa'i don ni cha phra ba rnam pa gsum ma gtogs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: He says: The meaning of ‚Äúwith obstruction‚Äù is mutual contact and the meaning of ‚Äúgross‚Äù is the object of obstruction. The meaning of ‚Äúgross‚Äù should be understood as being the exception to the three subtle aspects.

original: cha phra ba rnam pa gsum ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: cha phra ba rnam pa gsum ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The three subtle aspects should be understood as before.

original: gcig gi phyogs gcig go ;
analyzed: gcig gi phyogs gcig go ;
translated: One part of one.

original: / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams don gang gis yin /
analyzed: / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams don gang gis yin /
translated: By what meaning are those with outflows?

original: du yod ce na /
analyzed: du yod ce na /
translated: How many are with outflows?

original: smras pa / gnas ngan len dang rjes su 'brel pa'i don dang / de'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pas skyed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / gnas ngan len dang rjes su 'brel pa'i don dang / de'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pas skyed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: He says: By the meaning of being related to the negative tendencies and by the meaning of being generated by the afflictions that are not their antidotes.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: One part of all.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i don gzhan yang gang la nyon mongs pas nyes pa rnam pa bzhi skyed par nus pa de ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i don gzhan yang gang la nyon mongs pas nyes pa rnam pa bzhi skyed par nus pa de ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Another meaning of ‚Äúwith outflows‚Äù is that which is able to generate the four faults of the afflictions is with outflows.

original: nyes pa rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four faults?

original: smras pa / rab tu ma zhi ba'i nyes pa dang / nang dang phyi rol 'gyur ba'i nyes pa dang / nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong ba'i nyes pa dang / rgyu yongs su 'dzin pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / rab tu ma zhi ba'i nyes pa dang / nang dang phyi rol 'gyur ba'i nyes pa dang / nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong ba'i nyes pa dang / rgyu yongs su 'dzin pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: He said: The fault of not being calm, the fault of the change of inner and outer, the fault of the origination of bad conduct, and the fault of the grasping of a cause.

original: de la dang po ni kun nas dkris pa kun tu spyod pa las gyur pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni kun nas dkris pa kun tu spyod pa las gyur pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The first should be seen as arising from the practice of the entanglements.

original: gnyis pa ni nyon mongs pa'i gzhi las nyon mongs pa rjes su spyod pa las gyur pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nyon mongs pa'i gzhi las nyon mongs pa rjes su spyod pa las gyur pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The second should be seen as arising from the practice of the afflictions that arise from the basis of the afflictions.

original: gsum pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las gyur pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las gyur pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The third should be seen as arising from the cause of the afflictions.

original: @75a * // bzhi pa ni yang srid pa 'phen pa las gyur pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: @75a * // bzhi pa ni yang srid pa 'phen pa las gyur pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The fourth should be seen as arising from the projection of rebirth.

original: 'dus byas rnams don gang gis yin /
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams don gang gis yin /
translated: By what meaning are conditioned things?

original: du yod ce na /
analyzed: du yod ce na /
translated: How many are conditioned?

original: smras pa / rgyu las byung ba 'byung ba'i skal ba can gyi don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu las byung ba 'byung ba'i skal ba can gyi don gyis so //
translated: He said: By the meaning of arising from a cause, and by the meaning of having the nature of arising.

original: 'dus byas thams cad do //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad do //
translated: All conditioned things.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa rnams don gang gis yin /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa rnams don gang gis yin /
translated: What is the meaning of those that are associated with afflictions?

original: du yod ce na /
analyzed: du yod ce na /
translated: How many are associated with afflictions?

original: smras pa / gnod pa mang pos dbang bsgyur ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / gnod pa mang pos dbang bsgyur ba'i don gyis so //
translated: It is said: They are so called because they are dominated by many kinds of harm.

analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o // zang zing dang bcas pa rnams don gang gis yin /
translated: They are one part of all.

original: du yod ce na /
analyzed: du yod ce na /
translated: What is the meaning of those that are associated with material things?üîΩHow many are associated with material things?

original: smras pa / sred pa dang / lta ba mang pos dbang bsgyur ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / sred pa dang / lta ba mang pos dbang bsgyur ba'i don gyis so //
translated: It is said: They are so called because they are dominated by many kinds of craving and views.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
translated: They are one part of all.

original: zhen pa la brten pa rnams don gang gis yin /üîΩdu yod ce na /
analyzed: zhen pa la brten pa rnams don gang gis yin / du yod ce na /
translated: What is the meaning of those that are based on attachment?üîΩHow many are based on attachment?

original: smras pa / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags mang pos dbang bsgyur ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags mang pos dbang bsgyur ba'i don gyis so //
translated: It is said: They are so called because they are dominated by many kinds of attachment to desire.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //üîΩ'jig rten pa rnams don gang gis yin /

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
translated: They are only one part of all.üîΩWhat is the meaning of near?

original: thag nye ba rnams don gang gis yin /üîΩdu yod ce na /
analyzed: thag nye ba rnams don gang gis yin / du yod ce na /
translated: How many are near?

analyzed: smras pa / thag ring ba las bzlog pa'i don gyis so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThey are near by the opposite meaning of distant.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //üîΩ'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams don gang gis yin /
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o // 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams don gang gis yin /
translated: They are only one part of all.üîΩWhat is the meaning of possessing desire?

original: du yod ce na /üîΩsmras pa / 'dir skyes pa gnyen po ma thob pa'am /
analyzed: du yod ce na / smras pa / 'dir skyes pa gnyen po ma thob pa'am /
translated: How many possess desire?

original: thob pa las langs pa dus gsum du kun tu spyod pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: thob pa las langs pa dus gsum du kun tu spyod pa'i don gyis so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThose born here who have not obtained the antidote or have risen from obtaining it, and those who are engaged in the three times.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
translated: They are only one part of all.üîΩWhat is the meaning of possessing form?

original: gzugs dang ldan pa rnams don gang gis yin /üîΩdu yod ce na /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa rnams don gang gis yin / du yod ce na /
translated: How many possess form?

original: smras pa / gzugs na spyod pa'i gnyen po thob pa snyoms par zhugs pa dang / skyes pa gong ma'i gnyen po ma thob pa'am /
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs na spyod pa'i gnyen po thob pa snyoms par zhugs pa dang / skyes pa gong ma'i gnyen po ma thob pa'am /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThose who have obtained the antidote of the desire realm and entered meditative attainment, and those who have not obtained the antidote of the higher realms or have risen from obtaining it.

original: thob pa de las langs pa dus gsum du kun tu spyod pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: thob pa de las langs pa dus gsum du kun tu spyod pa'i don gyis so //
translated: The meaning of the term is that of being engaged in the three times with regard to the attainment of that state.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
translated: It is a part of all.üîΩWhat is the meaning of the term formless?

original: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa rnams don gang gis yin /üîΩdu yod ce na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa rnams don gang gis yin / du yod ce na /
translated: How many are formless?

original: smras pa / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i gnyen po thob pa de la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / skyes ba gong ma'i gnyen po ma thob pa'am /
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i gnyen po thob pa de la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / skyes ba gong ma'i gnyen po ma thob pa'am /
translated: It is said: The formless is that which is attained as the counteragent to the form realm, and that in which one is absorbed and born, and which is not subsumed by the attainment of the counteragent to the higher realms,

original: thob pa de las langs pa dus gsum du kun tu spyod pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: thob pa de las langs pa dus gsum du kun tu spyod pa'i don gyis so //
translated: or by the meaning of being engaged in the three times with regard to the attainment of that state.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
translated: It is a part of all.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams ni shin tu sbyangs pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / de'i 'khor dang de'i 'bras bu'i chos kyis ma bsdus pa'i don gyis so //üîΩgzugs dang ldan pa rnams ni /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams ni shin tu sbyangs pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / de'i 'khor dang de'i 'bras bu'i chos kyis ma bsdus pa'i don gyis so // gzugs dang ldan pa rnams ni /
translated: Another explanation is that those who possess the desire realm are not subsumed by the concentration that is accompanied by pliancy, nor by the phenomena that are its retinue, nor by the phenomena that are the result of that.

original: gzugs dang 'brel pa'i nyon @76a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang 'brel pa'i nyon @76a * //
translated: Those who possess the form realm are not subsumed by the formless realm.üîΩThe formless realm is that which is subsumed by the formless realm.

original: mongs pa dang / de las bzlog pas bsdus pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: mongs pa dang / de las bzlog pas bsdus pa'i don gyis so //
translated: and the opposite of that.

original: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa rnams ni gzugs dang mi ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa des bsdus pa'i don gyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa rnams ni gzugs dang mi ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa des bsdus pa'i don gyis rig par bya'o //
translated: Those associated with the formless realm should be understood by the meaning of being included in the formless realm.

original: dge ba rnams don gang gis yin /
analyzed: dge ba rnams don gang gis yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the wholesome?

original: du yod ce na /
analyzed: du yod ce na /
translated: How many are wholesome?

original: smras pa / phyi ma la bde ba'i 'bras bu'i don dang nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal spong ba'i gnyen po'i don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / phyi ma la bde ba'i 'bras bu'i don dang nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal spong ba'i gnyen po'i don gyis so //
translated: It is said: They are wholesome by the meaning of the result of pleasure in the future and by the meaning of the antidote that abandons affliction and suffering.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
translated: They are all only one part.

original: mi dge ba rnams don gang gis yin /üîΩdu yod ce na /
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams don gang gis yin / du yod ce na /
translated: What is the meaning of the unwholesome?üîΩHow many are unwholesome?

original: smras pa / phyi ma la sdug bsngal ba'i 'bras bu'i don dang nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / phyi ma la sdug bsngal ba'i 'bras bu'i don dang nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong ba'i don gyis so //
translated: It is said: They are unwholesome by the meaning of the result of suffering in the future and by the meaning of motivating evil conduct.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
translated: They are all only one part.

original: lung du ma bstan pa rnams don gang gis yin /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa rnams don gang gis yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the neutral?

original: du yod ce na /
analyzed: du yod ce na /
translated: How many are neutral?

original: smras pa / de gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / de gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i don gyis so //
translated: It is said: They are neutral by the meaning of the opposite of both of those.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: They are all one part of all.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang dge ba rnams ni skyon med pa'i don dang / skyon dang yon tan gyi gnyen po dang / rjes su mthun pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang dge ba rnams ni skyon med pa'i don dang / skyon dang yon tan gyi gnyen po dang / rjes su mthun pa'i don gyis so //
translated: There is another explanation: the wholesome is so called because it is the antidote to the faults and the cause of the virtues.

original: mi dge ba rnams ni de las bzlog pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams ni de las bzlog pa'i don gyis so //
translated: The unwholesome is so called because it is the opposite of that.

original: lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni de gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni de gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i don gyis so //
translated: The undefined is so called because it is the opposite of both.

original: slob pa rnams don gang gis yin /üîΩdu yod ce na /
analyzed: slob pa rnams don gang gis yin / du yod ce na /
translated: What is the meaning of the learner?üîΩHow many are learners?

original: smras pa / slob pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / slob pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i don gyis so //
translated: It is said: The wholesome that arises from the practice of the learner is the meaning of the learner.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
translated: They are all one part of all.

original: mi slob pa rnams don gang gis yin /üîΩdu yod ce na /
analyzed: mi slob pa rnams don gang gis yin / du yod ce na /
translated: What is the meaning of the non-learner?üîΩHow many are non-learners?

original: smras pa / bslab pa yongs su rdzogs pa la mkhas pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / bslab pa yongs su rdzogs pa la mkhas pa'i don gyis so //
translated: It is said: The expertise in the completion of training is the meaning of the non-learner.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //üîΩslob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa rnams don gang gis yin /
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o // slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa rnams don gang gis yin /
translated: They are all one part of all.üîΩWhat is the meaning of neither learner nor non-learner?

original: du yod ce na /
analyzed: du yod ce na /
translated: How many are neither learner nor non-learner?

original: smras pa / de las gzhan pa dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos kyi don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / de las gzhan pa dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos kyi don gyis so //
translated: He says: By the meaning of the other wholesome, afflicted, and neutral phenomena.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
translated: They are all one part.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams don gang gis yin /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams don gang gis yin /
translated: What is the meaning of those that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing?

original: du yod ce na /
analyzed: du yod ce na /
translated: How many are they?

original: smras pa / mngon par rtog pa'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pas spang bar bya ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / mngon par rtog pa'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pas spang bar bya ba'i don gyis so //
translated: He says: By the meaning of those that are to be abandoned by the realization of the knowledge of realization of the truths.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
translated: They are all one part.

original: bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba rnams don gang gis yin /
analyzed: bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba rnams don gang gis yin /
translated: What is the meaning of those that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation?

original: du yod ce na /
analyzed: du yod ce na /
translated: How many are they?

original: smras pa / mngon par rtogs @76b pa de'i gong ma bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / mngon par rtogs @76b pa de'i gong ma bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i don gyis so //
translated: He says: By the meaning of those that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation that is higher than that realization.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
translated: They are all one part.

original: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa rnams don gang gis yin /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa rnams don gang gis yin /
translated: What is the meaning of those that are not to be abandoned?

original: du yod ce na /
analyzed: du yod ce na /
translated: How many are they?

original: smras pa / nyon mongs pa can thams cad gtan spangs pa dang / gnyen po'i don dang / spangs zin pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / nyon mongs pa can thams cad gtan spangs pa dang / gnyen po'i don dang / spangs zin pa'i don gyis so //
translated: He says: By completely abandoning all that is afflicted, by the meaning of antidote, and by the meaning of what has already been abandoned.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig kho na'o //
translated: It is only one part of all.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams don gang gis yin /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams don gang gis yin /
translated: By what meaning are the formless ones?

original: du yod ce na /
analyzed: du yod ce na /
translated: How many are there?

original: smras pa / gzugs can ma yin pa la sogs pa'i don ni gzugs can la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa rnams las bzlog pa'i don gyis blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs can ma yin pa la sogs pa'i don ni gzugs can la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa rnams las bzlog pa'i don gyis blta bar bya ste /
translated: He says: The meaning of formless, etc., should be seen by the meaning of the opposite of the meaning of form, etc., as it has been taught.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa dag gi phung po rnams kyi rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba gang dag yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa dag gi phung po rnams kyi rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba gang dag yin no //
translated: Thus, such as these are the divisions of the aspects of the aggregates.

original: phung po'i don ni spungs pa'i don to zhes gang gsungs pa de la spungs pa'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: phung po'i don ni spungs pa'i don to zhes gang gsungs pa de la spungs pa'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: As for what was said, ‚ÄúThe meaning of the aggregates is the meaning of a heap,‚Äù what is the meaning of a heap?

original: smras pa / spungs pa'i don ni bdag nyid sna tshogs mang po'i don dang / de bzhin du phan tshun 'dres pa'i dngos pos 'jug pa'i don dang / de bzhin du gcig tu mngon par bsdus pa'i don dang / 'phel ba dang 'bri pa'i don to //
analyzed: smras pa / spungs pa'i don ni bdag nyid sna tshogs mang po'i don dang / de bzhin du phan tshun 'dres pa'i dngos pos 'jug pa'i don dang / de bzhin du gcig tu mngon par bsdus pa'i don dang / 'phel ba dang 'bri pa'i don to //
translated: He replied: The meaning of ‚Äúheap‚Äù is the meaning of a multitude of various natures, and likewise the meaning of engagement by means of mutually mixed things, and likewise the meaning of being collected into one, and the meaning of increase and decrease.

original: ci'i phyir gzugs la gzugs zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzugs la gzugs zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is form called form?

original: smras pa / yul de dang der skye ba'i don dang / gzugs su rung ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / yul de dang der skye ba'i don dang / gzugs su rung ba'i don gyis so //
translated: He replied: Because of the meaning of being born in that and that place, and because of the meaning of being suitable as form.

original: gzugs su rung ba'i don kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzugs su rung ba'i don kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The meaning of being suitable as form is twofold:

original: lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pas gnod pa byar rung ba'i don dang yul sna tshogs su byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pas gnod pa byar rung ba'i don dang yul sna tshogs su byed pa'i don to //
translated: the meaning of being suitable to be harmed by contact with hands and so on, and the meaning of being made into various objects.

original: ci'i phyir phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po dag la ming 'di zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po dag la ming 'di zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are the four non-physical aggregates called name?

original: smras pa / dmigs pa sna tshogs la sems nye bar gzhol ba'i don dang / tha snyad las byung ba'i ming la brten te dmigs pa la rnam par rtog pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / dmigs pa sna tshogs la sems nye bar gzhol ba'i don dang / tha snyad las byung ba'i ming la brten te dmigs pa la rnam par rtog pa'i don gyis so //
translated: He replied: It means the mind is directed toward various objects, and it means that the mind is directed toward conceptualizing objects based on names that arise from conventions.

original: phung po rnams gang gis bsdus /
analyzed: phung po rnams gang gis bsdus /
translated: By what are the aggregates included?

original: ci'i phyir bsdus pa rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsdus pa rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: For what purpose are they established as included?

original: smras pa / ngo bo nyid kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: smras pa / ngo bo nyid kyis bsdus so //
translated: He replied: They are included by their own nature.

original: rang gi rigs sna tshogs yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir de rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rang gi rigs sna tshogs yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir de rnam par gzhag go //
translated: They are established in order to understand the various kinds of their own families.

original: chos rnams gang dang mtshungs par ldan /
analyzed: chos rnams gang dang mtshungs par ldan /
translated: With what are phenomena associated?

original: ci'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: For what purpose are they established as associated?

original: smras pa / gzhan gyi dngos po dang mtshungs par ldan no //üîΩsems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba la nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i chos @77a * //
analyzed: smras pa / gzhan gyi dngos po dang mtshungs par ldan no // sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba la nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i chos @77a * //
translated: He replied: They are associated with other things.

original: rnams 'phel ba dang 'bri ba yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir de yang rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rnams 'phel ba dang 'bri ba yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir de yang rnam par gzhag go //
translated: In order to understand the increase and decrease of afflicted and unafflicted phenomena in the naturally luminous mind, they are established.

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze la ming la sems tsam zhig rdzas su 'dod la sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni mi 'dod pa gang dag yod pa de dag kyang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze la ming la sems tsam zhig rdzas su 'dod la sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni mi 'dod pa gang dag yod pa de dag kyang mi 'thad do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe spiritual practitioners and brahmans who assert that only mind is substantially real and do not assert that mental factors are substantially real are also incorrect.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dang po kho nar phung po rnams lnga kho nar bstan pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po kho nar phung po rnams lnga kho nar bstan pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it is incorrect to teach that there are only five aggregates in the first place.

original: gal te gnas skabs kyi bye brag la sa lnga kho nar yongs su rtog na ni de'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag tu rtog pa yang skyon chags pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs kyi bye brag la sa lnga kho nar yongs su rtog na ni de'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag tu rtog pa yang skyon chags pa yin no //
translated: If you imagine that there are only five aggregates because of the differences in the states of the aggregates, then that imagination of the differences in the states of the aggregates is also flawed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnas skabs de dag gi phan tshun bya ba byed nus pa'i bye brag yod pa'am med pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas skabs de dag gi phan tshun bya ba byed nus pa'i bye brag yod pa'am med pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the error of asserting that the states are either different or not different from each other would ensue.

original: yod na ni mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir rdzas gzhan nyid du yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod na ni mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir rdzas gzhan nyid du yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are different, then because they would have different characteristics, it would follow that they would exist as different substances.

original: de med na ni gnas skabs gzhan yod par rtog pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na ni gnas skabs gzhan yod par rtog pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are not different, then it would be pointless to imagine that there are different states.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi gnas skabs tha dad pa lta bur yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi gnas skabs tha dad pa lta bur yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is also not tenable that the six collections of consciousness are different states.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag ni gnas dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag ni gnas dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the six collections of consciousness have different bases and objects.

original: gnas skabs de dag gi ni gcig la dmigs pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gnas skabs de dag gi ni gcig la dmigs pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that they are different states because they have the same object.

original: yongs su shes par gyur pa las kyang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yongs su shes par gyur pa las kyang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is also not tenable that they are different states because they are completely known.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs can la ni yongs su 'gyur ba dang ldan pas gnas skabs tha dad pa dag rung gi gzugs can ma yin pa la ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs can la ni yongs su 'gyur ba dang ldan pas gnas skabs tha dad pa dag rung gi gzugs can ma yin pa la ni mi rung ste /
translated: Because it is tenable that different states of form are completely known because they possess transformation, but it is not tenable that non-form is completely known.

original: 'o ma dang zho dang mar sar la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o ma dang zho dang mar sar la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are similar to milk, curd, butter, and so on.

original: byed rgyu khyad par med pa'i phyir sems kyi gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ba ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: byed rgyu khyad par med pa'i phyir sems kyi gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ba ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that the state of mind changes because there is no difference in its causal capacity.

original: skad cig gcig la gang gis gnas skabs gzhan la ston par 'gyur ba'i byed rgyu khyad par can gzhan ni mi dmigs te /
analyzed: skad cig gcig la gang gis gnas skabs gzhan la ston par 'gyur ba'i byed rgyu khyad par can gzhan ni mi dmigs te /
translated: But no other special cause of change is observed in a moment.

original: de lta bas na gnas skabs kyi bye brag kyang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnas skabs kyi bye brag kyang mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the difference of states is not tenable.

original: sems tsam zhig rdzas su yod pa ni lung dang 'gal bas kyang mi rung ste /
analyzed: sems tsam zhig rdzas su yod pa ni lung dang 'gal bas kyang mi rung ste /
translated: The existence of mind-only as a substance is not tenable because it contradicts scripture.

original: lung dang 'gal ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: lung dang 'gal ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the contradiction with scripture?

original: 'dod chags kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems ni rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur ro zhes ji skad gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems ni rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur ro zhes ji skad gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúThe mind that is defiled by attachment, hatred, and delusion does not become liberated.‚Äù

original: de la 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de la 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the contradiction here?

original: smras pa / sems tsam ste @77b gnyis cig car du 'byung ba med pa yin na 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par rig pa la mi brten par thal bar 'gyur bas mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa / sems tsam ste @77b gnyis cig car du 'byung ba med pa yin na 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par rig pa la mi brten par thal bar 'gyur bas mi rung ba'o //
translated: It is said: If mind-only exists, and two things do not occur simultaneously, then it is not tenable that attachment, etc., do not depend on representations.

original: rnam par rig pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid du rtog na'ang de lta na nyes pa khyad par med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid du rtog na'ang de lta na nyes pa khyad par med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you imagine that consciousness precedes them, then the error is the same.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa zhes gang gsungs pa dang / chos 'di dag ni 'dres pa ste ma 'dres pa ma yin pas chos 'di dag so sor phye zhing so sor phye na bye brag gam bsam pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa zhes gang gsungs pa dang / chos 'di dag ni 'dres pa ste ma 'dres pa ma yin pas chos 'di dag so sor phye zhing so sor phye na bye brag gam bsam pa'am /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also said, ‚ÄúThere are feelings, discriminations, and intentions that are co-arisen,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThese phenomena are mixed, not unmixed. If you distinguish these phenomena, you will not observe a difference, a distinction, or a separate thing.‚Äù

original: tha dad du bya ba brjod pa mi dmigs so zhes gang gsungs pa dang / 'dres pa'i don de nyid rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir mar me'i 'od kyi dpe mdzad pas na /
analyzed: tha dad du bya ba brjod pa mi dmigs so zhes gang gsungs pa dang / 'dres pa'i don de nyid rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir mar me'i 'od kyi dpe mdzad pas na /
translated: In order to establish the meaning of ‚Äúmixed,‚Äù he gave the example of the light of a lamp.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa med na 'dres pa'i sgra yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa med na 'dres pa'i sgra yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, if co-arisen does not exist, the term ‚Äúmixed‚Äù is also not tenable.

original: skyes bu 'di ni khams drug dang ldan pa'o zhes gzungs pa'i lung gang yin pa de yang dgongs te gsungs pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: skyes bu 'di ni khams drug dang ldan pa'o zhes gzungs pa'i lung gang yin pa de yang dgongs te gsungs pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: The scriptural passage that states, ‚ÄúThis person possesses six elements,‚Äù is also stated with a specific intention and is not erroneous.

original: de la dgongs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dgongs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the intention here?
