original: smras pa / dgongs pa ni gzugs dang yongs su g-yo ba dang / sems las byung ba rnams kyi gnas gtso cher bstan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / dgongs pa ni gzugs dang yongs su g-yo ba dang / sems las byung ba rnams kyi gnas gtso cher bstan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is said: The intention is to be seen as the teaching of the principal basis of form, movement, and mental factors.

original: de dang 'gal bas gnyen po'i lung yang dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dang 'gal bas gnyen po'i lung yang dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: And because the scriptures that are the antidote to that are also seen to contradict it.

original: de la gnyen po'i lung gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gnyen po'i lung gang zhe na /
translated: What are the scriptures that are the antidote?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'o ma dang zho dang ; mar sar gyi dpes kha cig du ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi las byung ba'i bdag rags pa dang kha cig tu ni gzugs can yid las byung ba dang kha cig tu gzugs can ma yin pa 'du shes kyi rang bzhin yin pa ji skad gsungs pa lta
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'o ma dang zho dang ; mar sar gyi dpes kha cig du ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi las byung ba'i bdag rags pa dang kha cig tu ni gzugs can yid las byung ba dang kha cig tu gzugs can ma yin pa 'du shes kyi rang bzhin yin pa ji skad gsungs pa lta
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, with the examples of milk, curd, and butter, in some places taught that the self is derived from the four great elements, in some places that it is a mental factor with form, and in some places that it is a formless nature of perception.

original: bu'o // de lta na ci 'byung ba chen po tsam zhig tu 'gyur ram 'on te sems tsam mam 'on te 'du shes tsam du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bu'o // de lta na ci 'byung ba chen po tsam zhig tu 'gyur ram 'on te sems tsam mam 'on te 'du shes tsam du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In that case, would it be just the great elements, or just mind, or just perception?

original: de'i phyir de dag dang de lta bu'i rnam pa dag bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag dang de lta bu'i rnam pa dag bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of such aspects should be regarded as interpretable in meaning.

original: de lta bas na phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po ming gis bsdus pa sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba de dag ni phan tshun mtshungs par ldan par rab tu grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po ming gis bsdus pa sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba de dag ni phan tshun mtshungs par ldan par rab tu grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the four non-material aggregates, which are included in name, i.e., mind and mental concomitants, are well established as being mutually concomitant.

original: bar sdom ni /
analyzed: bar sdom ni /
translated: The summary:

original: lnga nyid 'thad pa med phyir dang // de yi gnas skabs skyon phyir dang // byed rgyu bye brag med phyir dang // lung dang 'gal bar 'gyur phyir ro //üîΩphung po'i dngos po la mkhas pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: lnga nyid 'thad pa med phyir dang // de yi gnas skabs skyon phyir dang // byed rgyu bye brag med phyir dang // lung dang 'gal bar 'gyur phyir ro // phung po'i dngos po la mkhas pa rdzogs so /
translated: Because the five are not tenable, because of the fault in their state, because of the non-distinction of the active cause, and because of the contradiction with the scriptures.

original: // / bam po dgu pa /
analyzed: // / bam po dgu pa /
translated: The expertise in the entities of the aggregates is completed.

original: mig gi @78a * //
analyzed: mig gi @78a * //
translated: The eye element.

original: khams gang zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / mig lnga spangs pa'am /
analyzed: khams gang zhe na / smras pa / mig lnga spangs pa'am /
translated: What is the eye element?

original: spangs pa srog gi dbang pos yongs su zin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: spangs pa srog gi dbang pos yongs su zin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the five eyes, or that which is conjoined with the vitality faculty, having abandoned the five eyes.

original: mig gi khams ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: mig gi khams ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as with the eye element,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig gi bar du yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig gi bar du yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies up to the element of mental consciousness and the part of the element of mental objects which is not common to all.

original: gzugs kyi khams gang zhe na /üîΩdbang po'i dbang gis byung ba'i gzugs gang yin pa de la de'i dbang gis gzugs kyi khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams gang zhe na / dbang po'i dbang gis byung ba'i gzugs gang yin pa de la de'i dbang gis gzugs kyi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: What is the element of visible form?üîΩIt is visible form derived from the fundamental material elements and susceptible of offering resistance.

original: gzugs kyi khams ji lta ba bzhin du reg bya'i khams kyi bar du yang de bzhin no //üîΩbco brgyad po de dag las du ni rdzas su yod pa yin ;
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ji lta ba bzhin du reg bya'i khams kyi bar du yang de bzhin no // bco brgyad po de dag las du ni rdzas su yod pa yin ;
translated: The same applies up to the element of the tangible.

original: du ni btags pa'i yod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni btags pa'i yod pa yin zhe na /
translated: Among these eighteen elements, how many are substantial entities and how many are nominal entities?

original: smras pa / rdzas su yod pa ni bcu bdun nam bcu gnyis te /üîΩkun rdzob rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gyis drug gcig tu byas nas sam /
analyzed: smras pa / rdzas su yod pa ni bcu bdun nam bcu gnyis te / kun rdzob rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gyis drug gcig tu byas nas sam /
translated: Seventeen elements are substantial entities.

original: gcig drug tu byas nas so //üîΩmig gang yin pa mig gi khams kyang de yin la /
analyzed: gcig drug tu byas nas so // mig gang yin pa mig gi khams kyang de yin la /
translated: Twelve, six or one are substantial entities according to the method of the relative.üîΩThe element of the eye is a substantial entity.üîΩIs the element of the eye also the eye?

original: mig gi khams gang yin pa mig kyang de yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi khams gang yin pa mig kyang de yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is the eye also the element of the eye?

original: smras pa / mu bzhi yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / mu bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four alternatives.

original: mig yin la mig gi khams ma yin pa ni dgra bcom pa tha ma'i mig gang yin pa ste mu dang po'o //
analyzed: mig yin la mig gi khams ma yin pa ni dgra bcom pa tha ma'i mig gang yin pa ste mu dang po'o //
translated: The first possibility is the eye that is an eye but not the eye element, which is the eye of the final arhat.

original: mig gi khams yin la mig ma yin pa'i gzugs can gyi khams su skyes pa'i mig ma skyes pa dang / mig rab tu nyams pa dang / mig ma thob pa dang / mig 'gags ma thag pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo ste mu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi khams yin la mig ma yin pa'i gzugs can gyi khams su skyes pa'i mig ma skyes pa dang / mig rab tu nyams pa dang / mig ma thob pa dang / mig 'gags ma thag pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo ste mu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second possibility is the eye element that is not the eye, which is the eye that has not arisen, the eye that has degenerated, the eye that has not been obtained, the eye that has just ceased, and the ordinary beings who have been born in the formless realm.

original: mig kyang yin la mig gi khams kyang yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ste mu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: mig kyang yin la mig gi khams kyang yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ste mu gsum pa'o //
translated: The third possibility is the eye that is both the eye and the eye element, which is the eye that is not included in the previous two.

original: mig kyang ma yin la mig gi khams kyang ma yin pa ni dgra bcom pa mig rab tu nyams pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa mig ma bskyed pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i ste mu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: mig kyang ma yin la mig gi khams kyang ma yin pa ni dgra bcom pa mig rab tu nyams pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa mig ma bskyed pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i ste mu bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth possibility is that which is neither the eye nor the eye element, which is the arhat who has degenerated from the eye, the nonarising of the eye that has not been obtained, the eye that has just ceased, and the arhat who has attained nirvana without remainder.

original: mig ji lta ba bzhin du nang gi khams thams cad kyang de bzhin du ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mig ji lta ba bzhin du nang gi khams thams cad kyang de bzhin du ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The same is true for all the internal elements, as is appropriate.

original: lus kyi khams la ni rnam par brtags dgos te /
analyzed: lus kyi khams la ni rnam par brtags dgos te /
translated: The body element should be examined.

original: dang po nas lus ma skyes pa zhes ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dang po nas lus ma skyes pa zhes ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that the body is not born from the beginning, as is appropriate.

original: de bzhin du phyi rol gyi khams bzhi la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi rol gyi khams bzhi la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same is true for the four external elements, as is appropriate.

original: sgra'i khams ni gang gi tshe sgra phyung ba de'i @78b tshe ni gnyi ga yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sgra'i khams ni gang gi tshe sgra phyung ba de'i @78b tshe ni gnyi ga yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The sound element is said to be both when sound is produced.

original: gang gi tshe sgra ma phyung ba de'i tshe ni de las gzhan pa'i khams kyi tshogs bzhin du khams 'ba' zhig yod kyi sgra ni med par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgra ma phyung ba de'i tshe ni de las gzhan pa'i khams kyi tshogs bzhin du khams 'ba' zhig yod kyi sgra ni med par brjod par bya'o //
translated: When sound is not produced, it should be said that only the element exists, as is the case with the collection of other elements, but sound does not exist.

original: bco brgyad po de dag las du ni mtshungs pa yin /
analyzed: bco brgyad po de dag las du ni mtshungs pa yin /
translated: How many of these eighteen are similar?

original: du ni de dag dang mtshungs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni de dag dang mtshungs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How many are similar to them?

original: smras pa / mig gi khams rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa ni mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / mig gi khams rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa ni mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said: The eye element together with consciousness is similar.

original: de las gzhan pa ni de dag dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni de dag dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: The other elements are similar to these, as appropriate.

original: mig gi khams la ji lta ba bzhin du lus kyi khams kyi bar du yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gi khams la ji lta ba bzhin du lus kyi khams kyi bar du yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies for the element of the body, as for the element of the eye.

original: mtshungs pa de dag dang mtshungs pa ni dbang pos zin pa'i nang gi khams rnams la bsams pa yin gyi gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi dag la ni med do //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de dag dang mtshungs pa ni dbang pos zin pa'i nang gi khams rnams la bsams pa yin gyi gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi dag la ni med do //
translated: The similar and the similar-similar are considered to be the internal elements that are appropriated by the faculties. They do not exist externally, in form, etc.

original: chos kyi khams ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi khams dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi khams ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi khams dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The element of mental objects that is with cognitive object should be understood as being like the element of thought.

original: dmigs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra'o //üîΩkhams rnams las du ni phrad nas 'dzin pa dag yin /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra'o // khams rnams las du ni phrad nas 'dzin pa dag yin /
translated: That which is without cognitive object is like form, etc.üîΩAmong the elements, how many grasp their object after coming into contact with it?

original: du ni ma phrad par 'dzin pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni ma phrad par 'dzin pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many grasp their object without coming into contact with it?

original: smras pa / drug ni phrad nas 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / drug ni phrad nas 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Six grasp their object after coming into contact with it.

original: bzhi ni ma phrad par 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi ni ma phrad par 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Four grasp their object without coming into contact with it.

original: lnga ni 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lnga ni 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Five do not grasp.

original: gcig gi phyogs gcig dang khams gcig ni phrad pa dang / ma phrad par 'dzin pa yin no ;üîΩ/ du ni gzung ba kho na yin la 'dzin pa ma yin /
analyzed: gcig gi phyogs gcig dang khams gcig ni phrad pa dang / ma phrad par 'dzin pa yin no ; / du ni gzung ba kho na yin la 'dzin pa ma yin /
translated: The one part of the first and one part of the last are grasped as both in contact and not in contact.üîΩHow many are only apprehended, not apprehenders?

original: du ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
translated: How many are both apprehended and apprehenders?

original: smras pa / gzung ba ni thams cad do //
analyzed: smras pa / gzung ba ni thams cad do //
translated: It is said: All are apprehended.

original: lnga dang / gcig gi phyogs ni gzung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: lnga dang / gcig gi phyogs ni gzung ba kho na'o //
translated: Five and one part of the last are only apprehended.

original: bcu gnyis dang gcig gi phyogs ni 'dzin pa'ang yin no //üîΩdu ni grogs po dang bcas pas 'dzin pa yin /
analyzed: bcu gnyis dang gcig gi phyogs ni 'dzin pa'ang yin no // du ni grogs po dang bcas pas 'dzin pa yin /
translated: Twelve and one part of the last are also apprehenders.üîΩHow many apprehend with companions?

original: du ni grogs po med par 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni grogs po med par 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
translated: How many apprehend without companions?

original: smras pa / bcu dang gcig gi phyogs ni grogs dang bcas pas 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / bcu dang gcig gi phyogs ni grogs dang bcas pas 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: It is said: Ten and one part apprehend with companions.

original: gcig dang gcig gi phyogs ni grogs med par 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig dang gcig gi phyogs ni grogs med par 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: One and one part apprehend without companions.

original: du zhig 'dod pa dang ldan pa kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig 'dod pa dang ldan pa kho na yin zhe na /
translated: How many possess desire?

original: smras pa / bzhi'o //
analyzed: smras pa / bzhi'o //
translated: It is said: Four.

original: du zhig gzugs dang ldan pa kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig gzugs dang ldan pa kho na yin zhe na /
translated: How many possess form?

original: smras pa / 'ga' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / 'ga' yang ma yin no //
translated: It is said: None.

original: du zhig gzugs med pa dang ldan pa kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig gzugs med pa dang ldan pa kho na yin zhe na /
translated: How many are only associated with the formless realm?

original: smras pa / 'ga' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / 'ga' yang ma yin no //
translated: None.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa las du zhig gzugs dang ldan pa kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa las du zhig gzugs dang ldan pa kho na yin zhe na /
translated: How many are only associated with the form realm?

original: smras pa / bcu gcig go//
analyzed: smras pa / bcu gcig go//
translated: Eleven.

original: @79a * // gzugs dang ldan pa las du zhig gzugs med pa dang ldan pa kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: @79a * // gzugs dang ldan pa las du zhig gzugs med pa dang ldan pa kho na yin zhe na /
translated: How many are only associated with the formless realm?

original: smras pa / 'ga' yang ma yin no //üîΩdu zhig khams gsum dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / 'ga' yang ma yin no // du zhig khams gsum dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: None.üîΩHow many are associated with the three realms?

original: smras pa / gsum mo //
analyzed: smras pa / gsum mo //
translated: Three.

original: du zhig zin pa yin /
analyzed: du zhig zin pa yin /
translated: How many are appropriated?

original: du zhig zin pa dang ma zin pa yin /
analyzed: du zhig zin pa dang ma zin pa yin /
translated: How many are both appropriated and not appropriated?

original: du zhig ma zin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig ma zin pa yin zhe na /
translated: How many are not appropriated?

original: smras pa / lnga ni zin pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / lnga ni zin pa yin no //
translated: Five are appropriated.

original: lnga ni zin pa dang ma zin pa yin no //
analyzed: lnga ni zin pa dang ma zin pa yin no //
translated: Five are both appropriated and not appropriated.

original: lhag ma rnams ni ma zin pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni ma zin pa yin no //
translated: The rest are not appropriated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de las gzhan pa gang de dag 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i 'dzin par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa gang de dag 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i 'dzin par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not observed that anything other than those is appropriated.

original: khams sna tshogs pa nyid gang zhe na ;
analyzed: khams sna tshogs pa nyid gang zhe na ;
translated: What is the variety of the elements?

original: khams bco brgyad po dag phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po dag phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the fact that the characteristics of the eighteen elements are distinct from one another.

original: khams du ma pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: khams du ma pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the multiplicity of the elements?

original: de dag nyid sems can sna tshogs dpag tu med pa'i rab tu dbye bas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid sems can sna tshogs dpag tu med pa'i rab tu dbye bas gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the fact that the eighteen elements are the basis for the classification of the variety of beings as immeasurable.

original: khams tshad med pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: khams tshad med pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the immensity of the elements?

original: de gnyi ga gcig tu bsdus pa la khams tshad med pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga gcig tu bsdus pa la khams tshad med pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: It is the fact that the eighteen elements are immeasurable.

original: dbang po'i tshogs kyi dpes nga ni khams rnams kyi khams kyi dpe mtha' yod par mi smra'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i tshogs kyi dpes nga ni khams rnams kyi khams kyi dpe mtha' yod par mi smra'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, in the ParamarthagƒÅthƒÅs, it is said: ‚ÄúI do not say that there is an end to the similes of the elements. I compare the elements to the multitude of the sense-faculties. ‚Äù

original: bar sdom ni /
analyzed: bar sdom ni /
translated: The summary:

original: rdzas su yod pa gang yin dang // mu bzhi dang ni mtshungs pa dang // 'dzin dang khams dang zin pa dang // sna tshogs pa dang du ma nyid //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa gang yin dang // mu bzhi dang ni mtshungs pa dang // 'dzin dang khams dang zin pa dang // sna tshogs pa dang du ma nyid //
translated: The fourfold method of the elements, the method of the four alternatives, the method of grasping, the method of the elements, the method of the possession of the elements, the method of the variety of the elements, the method of the multiplicity of the elements, the method of the immensity of the elements.

original: khams kyi don gang zhe na /
analyzed: khams kyi don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of element?

original: smras pa / khams kyi don ni rgyu'i don dang sa bon gyi don dang rang bzhin gyi don dang rigs kyi don dang cha phra ba'i don dang gzhi'i don to //
analyzed: smras pa / khams kyi don ni rgyu'i don dang sa bon gyi don dang rang bzhin gyi don dang rigs kyi don dang cha phra ba'i don dang gzhi'i don to //
translated: Answer: The meaning of element is the meaning of cause, the meaning of seed, the meaning of nature, the meaning of type, the meaning of subtle aspect, and the meaning of basis.

original: ci'i phyir na mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings dang nam mkha'i khams la khams zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings dang nam mkha'i khams la khams zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the element of the realm of totality and the element of the realm of space called an element?

original: smras pa / sdug bsngal mi skye ba'i gzhi'i don dang lus dang mig la sogs pa yongs su g-yo ba'i gzhi'i don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / sdug bsngal mi skye ba'i gzhi'i don dang lus dang mig la sogs pa yongs su g-yo ba'i gzhi'i don gyis so //
translated: Answer: Because of the meaning of basis of the non-arising of suffering, and the meaning of basis of the movement of body, eye, etc.

original: ci zhig yongs su bstan par bya ba'i phyir khams rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig yongs su bstan par bya ba'i phyir khams rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: For the sake of teaching what is the establishment of the elements?

original: smras pa / rgyu'i rkyen yongs su bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / dbang po dang yul dang nye bar spyod pa yongs su bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu'i rkyen yongs su bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / dbang po dang yul dang nye bar spyod pa yongs su bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Answer: For the sake of teaching the causal condition and for the sake of teaching the sense faculties, objects, and enjoyments.

original: khams bco brgyad po 'di dag gi rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po 'di dag gi rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of these eighteen elements?

original: smras pa / re zhig mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / re zhig mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: Answer: First, in brief, it should be seen as sixfold.

original: chos kyi khams ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos kyi khams ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The element of the Dharma is as follows:

original: mig la sogs pa dag gi mig la sogs pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag gi mig la sogs pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The dharmas of the eye, etc.

original: dag pa'i khams ni 'di @79b lta ste /
analyzed: dag pa'i khams ni 'di @79b lta ste /
translated: The pure element is as follows:

original: gang zag rigs la gnas pa rnams kyi khams gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag rigs la gnas pa rnams kyi khams gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: It is the element of those who are abiding in the lineage.

original: rang bzhin gyi khams ni 'di lta ste /üîΩkhams bco brgyad po ji skad bstan pa de dag nyid thog ma med pa'i dus nas skye ba phyi ma phyi ma dag tu rab tu grub pa gang yin pa dang / gang zag rigs la gnas pa dang / rigs la gnas pa ma yin pa rnams kyi thog ma med pa'i dus nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi khams ni 'di lta ste / khams bco brgyad po ji skad bstan pa de dag nyid thog ma med pa'i dus nas skye ba phyi ma phyi ma dag tu rab tu grub pa gang yin pa dang / gang zag rigs la gnas pa dang / rigs la gnas pa ma yin pa rnams kyi thog ma med pa'i dus nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /
translated: The natural element is as follows:

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin pa'i chos nyid du rab tu grub pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin pa'i chos nyid du rab tu grub pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the eighteen elements as they have been taught, which are well established in the future births of those who have no beginning, and it is the nature of the dharmas of those who are abiding in the lineage and those who are not abiding in the lineage, which is well established as being beyond sorrow and not beyond sorrow from beginningless time.

original: yongs su bsgoms pa'i khams ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su bsgoms pa'i khams ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The element of cultivation is as follows:

original: sngon dge ba dang mi dge ba yongs su bsgoms pa de dag nyid 'khor bar skye ba dang / 'bri ba dang / bye brag dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon dge ba dang mi dge ba yongs su bsgoms pa de dag nyid 'khor bar skye ba dang / 'bri ba dang / bye brag dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: These very wholesome and unwholesome elements are the cause of birth in cyclic existence, of decrease, of distinction, and of the attainment of nirvana.

original: 'bras bu bskyed pa'i khams ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu bskyed pa'i khams ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The element that produces results is as follows:

original: de dag nyid 'bras bu bskyed nas 'gags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid 'bras bu bskyed nas 'gags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: These very elements, having produced results, cease.

original: 'bras bu ma bskyed pa'i khams ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma bskyed pa'i khams ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The element that does not produce results is as follows:

original: de dag nyid 'bras bu ma bskyed pa 'gags pa'am ma 'gags pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid 'bras bu ma bskyed pa 'gags pa'am ma 'gags pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: These very elements, having not produced results, either cease or do not cease.

original: de ltar na de ni mdor bstan pa las khams drug yin gyi rgyas par bstan pa ni tshad med do //üîΩkhams bco brgyad po de dag las du ni gzugs can dag yin du ni gzugs can ma yin pa dag yin pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar na de ni mdor bstan pa las khams drug yin gyi rgyas par bstan pa ni tshad med do // khams bco brgyad po de dag las du ni gzugs can dag yin du ni gzugs can ma yin pa dag yin pa nas /
translated: Thus, in brief, there are six elements. But if they are explained in detail, they are immeasurable.

original: du ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dag gi bar du yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dag gi bar du yin zhe na /
translated: Among these eighteen elements, how many have form, how many are formless, and so on, up to how many are not to be abandoned?

original: rgya cher ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su zhugs la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su zhugs la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply the characteristics as they are extensively taught.

original: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ba nas yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du ji skad gsung pa de la /
analyzed: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ba nas yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du ji skad gsung pa de la /
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThe eye sees forms, up to the mind cognizes dharmas.‚Äù

original: ci mig la sogs pas mthong ba nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du yin nam /
analyzed: ci mig la sogs pas mthong ba nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du yin nam /
translated: Is it that the eye, etc. see up to cognize,

original: 'on te de dag gi rnam par shes pa dag gis mthong pa nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de dag gi rnam par shes pa dag gis mthong pa nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du yin zhe na /
translated: or is it that the consciousnesses of those see up to cognize?

original: smras pa / don dam par ni mig la sogs pas kyang ma yin la de dag gi rnam par shes pa dag gis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / don dam par ni mig la sogs pas kyang ma yin la de dag gi rnam par shes pa dag gis kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is said: Ultimately, it is not by the eye, etc. nor by their consciousnesses.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po rnams ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir dang / skad cig pa'i phyir dang / g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir dang / skad cig pa'i phyir dang / g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things are dependently arisen, because they are momentary, and because they are without movement.

original: brda'i tshul du ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa la mthong ba po la sogs pa nye bar gdags pas ches rigs so //
analyzed: brda'i tshul du ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa la mthong ba po la sogs pa nye bar gdags pas ches rigs so //
translated: But it is more reasonable to apply the designations ‚Äúperceiver‚Äù and so on to the eye and so on, because they are the principal factors in the conventional sense.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩmig la sogs pa dbang po rnams @80a * //üîΩyod na ni rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ma tshang ba med par nges kyi /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / mig la sogs pa dbang po rnams @80a * // yod na ni rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ma tshang ba med par nges kyi /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause when the eye and so on are present, the arising of the corresponding consciousness is certain.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rgyun ni yod du zin kyang mig la sogs pa dbang po rnams tshang ba'am ma tshang bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rgyun ni yod du zin kyang mig la sogs pa dbang po rnams tshang ba'am ma tshang bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But even when the stream of consciousness is present, the eye and so on are not necessarily present.

original: lta ba la sogs pa tsam la mthong ba la sogs pa nye bar gdags pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yin no //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa tsam la mthong ba la sogs pa nye bar gdags pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yin no //
translated: The application of the designations ‚Äúseeing‚Äù and so on to mere seeing and so on is the ultimate sense.

original: khams bco brgyad po de dag gi go rims bstan pa'i rgyu dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po de dag gi go rims bstan pa'i rgyu dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the reasons for the order of the eighteen elements?

original: smras pa / de dag ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa / de dag ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: It is said: They should be seen as two-fold in brief:

original: gsum gyi go rims kyi rgyu dang / drug gi go rims kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: gsum gyi go rims kyi rgyu dang / drug gi go rims kyi rgyu'o //
translated: as the reason for the order of the three and the reason for the order of the six.

original: de la gsum gyi go rims kyi rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gsum gyi go rims kyi rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the reason for the order of the first three?

original: smras pa / gnas dang yul dang de gnyi ga la brten pa'i bye brag las te /
analyzed: smras pa / gnas dang yul dang de gnyi ga la brten pa'i bye brag las te /
translated: It is said: because of the difference in the basis, the object, and both.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa ni dbang po la phyogs gcig gi don gyis brten pa dang / yul la ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa ni dbang po la phyogs gcig gi don gyis brten pa dang / yul la ni /
translated: Thus, consciousness is based on the sense faculty in the sense of being its object-field.

original: dmigs pa'i don gyis brten to //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i don gyis brten to //
translated: It is based on the object in the sense of being its domain.

original: drug gi go rims kyi rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gi go rims kyi rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the reason for the order of the first six?

original: smras pa / mig la sogs pa ni spyod yul ches phal che ba dang sna tshogs pa dang yang dang yang 'byung ba'i phyir dang por bstan te de ni rgyu dang po yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / mig la sogs pa ni spyod yul ches phal che ba dang sna tshogs pa dang yang dang yang 'byung ba'i phyir dang por bstan te de ni rgyu dang po yin no //
translated: It is said: because of the predominance of the object-field, the variety of the object-field, and the frequent occurrence of the object-field.

original: yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rjes su 'jug pa las te /
analyzed: yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rjes su 'jug pa las te /
translated: Moreover, it is because of the conformity with worldly convention.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa rnams ni dang por gcig la gcig lta bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa rnams ni dang por gcig la gcig lta bar byed do //
translated: Thus, worldly people first look at each other.

original: de'i 'og tu kun tu smra bar byed do//
analyzed: de'i 'og tu kun tu smra bar byed do//
translated: After that, they speak to each other.

original: de'i 'og tu 'dus shing za ba dang lhag par za bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dus shing za ba dang lhag par za bar byed do //
translated: After that, they come together and eat and enjoy themselves.

original: de'i 'og tu nyi ma nub cing nam sros pa na mal shom zhing mal stan dang bcas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nyi ma nub cing nam sros pa na mal shom zhing mal stan dang bcas /
translated: Then, when the sun sets and night falls, they prepare their bed and sleep on a bed with a woman, using cotton and a pillow filled with kapok.

original: shing bal dang sngas nang tshangs can dang bud med kyi reg pa la rten par byed de de ni rgyu gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: shing bal dang sngas nang tshangs can dang bud med kyi reg pa la rten par byed de de ni rgyu gnyis pa yin no //
translated: This is the second cause.

original: yang dga' ba'i bye brag gi gnas las te de ni rgyu gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dga' ba'i bye brag gi gnas las te de ni rgyu gsum pa yin no //
translated: They also sleep in a place that is a source of pleasure, which is the third cause.

original: yang mdzes pa'i bye brag yongs su 'dzin pa las te 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi smen tshugs dang / mig sman la sogs pas mdzes par byas pas ni mig go //
analyzed: yang mdzes pa'i bye brag yongs su 'dzin pa las te 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi smen tshugs dang / mig sman la sogs pas mdzes par byas pas ni mig go //
translated: They also sleep in a place that is a source of beauty, for example, by applying collyrium to the eyes and wearing earrings and necklaces.

original: rna cha dang rna rgyan la sogs pas mdzes par byas pa ni rna ba yin gyi gzhan ni de lta ma yin te de ni rgyu bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: rna cha dang rna rgyan la sogs pas mdzes par byas pa ni rna ba yin gyi gzhan ni de lta ma yin te de ni rgyu bzhi pa yin no //
translated: The eyes and ears are beautiful when they are adorned in this way, but not the other sense faculties. This is the fourth cause.

original: yang bya ba dang zas dang 'khrig pa'i dbang las te /
analyzed: yang bya ba dang zas dang 'khrig pa'i dbang las te /
translated: They also sleep in a place that is a source of activity, food, and sex.

original: 'di ltar sems can rnams ni lus dang ngag gi las dge ba dang mi dge ba dag gis thams cad la rtsol ba byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can rnams ni lus dang ngag gi las dge ba dang mi dge ba dag gis thams cad la rtsol ba byed /
translated: Thus, sentient beings exert themselves in all activities of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma by body and speech.

original: yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: They seek out food.

original: de'i 'og tu kham gyi zas dag za bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu kham gyi zas dag za bar byed do //
translated: Then they eat the food.

original: tshim zhing @80b rgyags pa dag 'khrig pa sten par byed de de ni rgyu lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: tshim zhing @80b rgyags pa dag 'khrig pa sten par byed de de ni rgyu lnga pa yin no //
translated: They are satisfied and intoxicated, and they engage in sexual union. This is the fifth cause.

original: yang las dang bya ba'i bye brag yongs su 'dzin pa las te de ltar mig gis gzugs sna tshogs dag mthong nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: yang las dang bya ba'i bye brag yongs su 'dzin pa las te de ltar mig gis gzugs sna tshogs dag mthong nas 'gro'o //
translated: Moreover, they are attached to the variety of actions and activities. Thus, having seen various forms with their eyes, they go.

original: 'gro ba na 'khrul pa med pa dang spyod lam 'khrul pa dag 'phya bar byed do //
analyzed: 'gro ba na 'khrul pa med pa dang spyod lam 'khrul pa dag 'phya bar byed do //
translated: When they go, they are not confused and they do not stumble.

original: dgra bo dang mdza' bshes dang tha mal pa sngon mthong ba dang ma mthong ba gzhan dag gis ngo shes par yang byed do //
analyzed: dgra bo dang mdza' bshes dang tha mal pa sngon mthong ba dang ma mthong ba gzhan dag gis ngo shes par yang byed do //
translated: They are recognized by others, enemies, friends, and strangers, those who have seen them before and those who have not.

original: yul gyi ngo shes par byed cing gzhan dag la ston par yang byed do //
analyzed: yul gyi ngo shes par byed cing gzhan dag la ston par yang byed do //
translated: They recognize the objects and show them to others.

original: ming dang tha snyad 'dogs par yang byed do //
analyzed: ming dang tha snyad 'dogs par yang byed do //
translated: They give them names and designations.

original: bro gar dang zlos gar dang bzhad gad la sogs pa sna tshogs mang po dag gis dga' ba so sor myong bar yang byed do //
analyzed: bro gar dang zlos gar dang bzhad gad la sogs pa sna tshogs mang po dag gis dga' ba so sor myong bar yang byed do //
translated: They experience various kinds of pleasure, such as dancing, singing, acting, and joking.

original: lus kyang brtas bar byed da /
analyzed: lus kyang brtas bar byed da /
translated: and it also nourishes the body.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa rnam pa du ma ni mig gi khams kyi las yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa rnam pa du ma ni mig gi khams kyi las yin no //
translated: These and other similar activities are the functions of the eye element.

original: rna ba ni sgra sna tshogs dag nyan par byed do //
analyzed: rna ba ni sgra sna tshogs dag nyan par byed do //
translated: The ear element hears various sounds.

original: legs par gsungs pa dang nyes par bshad pa'i don kyang shes par yang byed do //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa dang nyes par bshad pa'i don kyang shes par yang byed do //
translated: It also understands the meaning of what is well spoken and what is badly spoken.

original: mngon par brjod pas tha snyad 'dogs par yang byed do //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pas tha snyad 'dogs par yang byed do //
translated: It also makes conventional expressions through verbalization.

original: rol mo'i sgras dga' ba so sor myong bar yang byed do //
analyzed: rol mo'i sgras dga' ba so sor myong bar yang byed do //
translated: It also experiences the joy of music.

original: lus kyang brtas par byed de /
analyzed: lus kyang brtas par byed de /
translated: and it also nourishes the body.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa ni rna ba'i khams kyi las rab tu sla ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa ni rna ba'i khams kyi las rab tu sla ba yin no //
translated: These and other similar activities are the easy functions of the ear element.

original: snas ni dri sna tshogs dag snom par byed do ;
analyzed: snas ni dri sna tshogs dag snom par byed do ;
translated: The nose element smells various odors.

original: / dris bro bar yang byed do //
analyzed: / dris bro bar yang byed do //
translated: It also makes odors fragrant.

original: dga' ba so sor myong bar yang byed do //
analyzed: dga' ba so sor myong bar yang byed do //
translated: It also experiences joy.

original: lus brtas par yang byed do //
analyzed: lus brtas par yang byed do //
translated: and it also nourishes the body.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa ni sna'i khams kyi las rab tu sla ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa ni sna'i khams kyi las rab tu sla ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These and other similar activities should be understood as the easy functions of the nose element.

original: lce'i khams kyis ni ro sna tshogs dag myong bar byed do //
analyzed: lce'i khams kyis ni ro sna tshogs dag myong bar byed do //
translated: The tongue element experiences various tastes.

original: dga' ba so sor myong bar yang byed do //
analyzed: dga' ba so sor myong bar yang byed do //
translated: It also experiences the individual experience of pleasure.

original: lus kyang brtas par yang byed do //
analyzed: lus kyang brtas par yang byed do //
translated: It also causes the body to grow.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa ni lce'i khams kyi las rab tu sla ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa ni lce'i khams kyi las rab tu sla ba yin no //
translated: Such is the easy practice of the tongue element.

original: lus kyi khams kyis ni reg bya sna tshogs dag reg par byed do //
analyzed: lus kyi khams kyis ni reg bya sna tshogs dag reg par byed do //
translated: The body element touches various tangibles.

original: dga' ba so sor myong bar yang byed do //
analyzed: dga' ba so sor myong bar yang byed do //
translated: It also experiences the individual experience of pleasure.

original: de dang des lus brtas par yang byed la lan 'ga' ni dga' ba'i dngos po de dag nyid nyams par yang byed do //
analyzed: de dang des lus brtas par yang byed la lan 'ga' ni dga' ba'i dngos po de dag nyid nyams par yang byed do //
translated: It also causes the body to grow through that and through this. Sometimes it also causes the loss of those very things that are the basis of pleasure.

original: de ltar de lta bu mthun pa ni lus kyi khams kyi las rab tu sla ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu mthun pa ni lus kyi khams kyi las rab tu sla ba yin te /
translated: Such is the easy practice of the body element.

original: de ni go rims bstan pa'i rgyu drug pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni go rims bstan pa'i rgyu drug pa yin no //
translated: This is the sixth reason for teaching the order.

original: yid ni mig la sogs pa drug po de dag gi rnam grangs thams cad dang thams cad du @81a * //
analyzed: yid ni mig la sogs pa drug po de dag gi rnam grangs thams cad dang thams cad du @81a * //
translated: The mind is the enumeration of all of those six, beginning with the eye, in all respects.

original: 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tha mar bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tha mar bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: They are taught in this order because they are the most gross, etc.

original: go rims kyi rgyu de dag gi bar sdom ni /
analyzed: go rims kyi rgyu de dag gi bar sdom ni /
translated: The order of the elements is explained by the following verse:

original: phal che ba dang tha snyad dang // dga' dang mdzes dang bya ba gnyis //
analyzed: phal che ba dang tha snyad dang // dga' dang mdzes dang bya ba gnyis //
translated: The order is explained by the predominance of the majority, by convention, by what is pleasing, by what is beautiful, and by the two actions.

original: khams bco brgyad po de dag gis /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po de dag gis /
translated: The eighteen elements are taught in this order because they are the most gross, etc.

original: de las gzhan pa mdo sde las gsungs pa thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa mdo sde las gsungs pa thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The order of the elements should be understood in accordance with the order of the sense bases.

original: ci'i phyir gzugs na spyod pa yul gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la sna'i khams dang lce'i khams 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzugs na spyod pa yul gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la sna'i khams dang lce'i khams 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why are the nose and tongue elements found in the realm of form, since those beings are free from attachment to the objects of those two?

original: smras pa / lus mdzes par bya ba'i phyir dang de gnyis kyi 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / lus mdzes par bya ba'i phyir dang de gnyis kyi 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are found there in order to make the body beautiful, since those beings are not free from attachment to those two.

original: gzugs kyi khams su bsam gtan gnyis pa dang de'i gong mar skyes pa /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su bsam gtan gnyis pa dang de'i gong mar skyes pa /
translated: Those born in the second absorption and above in the realm of form

original: gal te mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa mngon du byed na ni ji ltar na sa de rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa mngon du byed na ni ji ltar na sa de rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med par 'gyur /
translated: If the eye consciousness and so on are manifest with investigation and analysis, how could that level be without investigation and without analysis?

original: gal te mngon du mi byed na ni ji ltar na dbang po gzugs can des de'i sa pa'i yul nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mngon du mi byed na ni ji ltar na dbang po gzugs can des de'i sa pa'i yul nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If they are not manifest, how could the physical sense faculty experience objects of that level?

original: smras pa / rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa yin pas /
analyzed: smras pa / rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa yin pas /
translated: We respond: The concentration of noninvestigation and nonanalysis possesses the seeds of consciousness that is with investigation and analysis.

original: de'i phyir de las langs pa la de kun tu 'byung bar rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las langs pa la de kun tu 'byung bar rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is suitable that it arises from that concentration.

original: langs pa'i rnam par shes pa de la dpyod pa de yang rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sa bon dang ldan pa yin pas de'i phyir sa bon de ni rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa nyid ma yin no
analyzed: langs pa'i rnam par shes pa de la dpyod pa de yang rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sa bon dang ldan pa yin pas de'i phyir sa bon de ni rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa nyid ma yin no
translated: The consciousness that arises in that way is also the seed of the concentration that is without applied thought and sustained thought. Therefore, that seed is not without applied thought and sustained thought.

original: // rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems can de dag ni 'dod chags dang bral bas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir rtog pa de dag la rtog pa med kyang sa de la kun du spyod pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: // rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems can de dag ni 'dod chags dang bral bas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir rtog pa de dag la rtog pa med kyang sa de la kun du spyod pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: Those sentient beings who are naturally free from passion are free from passion because of being free from passion. Although they do not have applied thought in regard to those thoughts, there is no fault in their conduct on that stage.

original: ci'i phyir mig gi khams cha gnyis su mngon par grub cing rna ba'i khams dang sna'i khams kyang de bzhin las gzhan ni de lta bu ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mig gi khams cha gnyis su mngon par grub cing rna ba'i khams dang sna'i khams kyang de bzhin las gzhan ni de lta bu ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that the eye element is established as two parts, and the ear element and the nose element are also like that, but the others are not like that?

original: smras pa / lus la mdzes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / lus la mdzes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: In order to beautify the body.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i bar du gnyis la brten te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i bar du gnyis la brten te /
translated: The eye consciousness, up to the nose consciousness, are based on two.

original: skye ba gang yin pa de dag ci gcig tu brjod par bya'am /
analyzed: skye ba gang yin pa de dag ci gcig tu brjod par bya'am /
translated: Are those who are born described as one?

original: 'on te gnyis su brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gnyis su brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Should they be described as one or two?

original: smras pa / gcig tu brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig tu brjod par bya'o //
translated: They should be described as one.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gcig ma bsgribs shing rab tu @81b ma nyams na rnam par shes pa gsal bar skye ba'i phyir dang / bsgribs shing rab tu nyams na rnam par shes pa gsal bar mi skye ba'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa de ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs bzhin du yul las gnyis su dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig ma bsgribs shing rab tu @81b ma nyams na rnam par shes pa gsal bar skye ba'i phyir dang / bsgribs shing rab tu nyams na rnam par shes pa gsal bar mi skye ba'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa de ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs bzhin du yul las gnyis su dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one is not obscured and not impaired, consciousness arises clearly, and when it is obscured and impaired, consciousness does not arise clearly. And because that consciousness is not material, it cannot be divided into two, as form is, on the basis of location.

original: mig dang mig gi rnam par shes pa gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin na de lta na ci ltar de gnyis lhan cig gi dngos por 'gyur /
analyzed: mig dang mig gi rnam par shes pa gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin na de lta na ci ltar de gnyis lhan cig gi dngos por 'gyur /
translated: If the eye and eye consciousness are the entities of cause and effect, how could they be simultaneous?

original: gal te lhan cig gi dngos po yin na ni de ltar na ji ltar de gnyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rung zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig gi dngos po yin na ni de ltar na ji ltar de gnyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rung zhe na /
translated: If they are simultaneous, how could they be the entities of cause and effect?

original: smras pa / sa bon dang myu gu bzhin du mig la brten te rnam par shes pa skye ba ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: smras pa / sa bon dang myu gu bzhin du mig la brten te rnam par shes pa skye ba ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Objection: It is not tenable that consciousness arises in dependence on the eye, as in the case of a seed and a sprout.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the eye is not the cause that generates visual consciousness.

original: 'on kyang gnas kyi rgyu yin pas de'i phyir de gnyis ni mar me dang 'od bzhin du lhan cig gi dngos po dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos rung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnas kyi rgyu yin pas de'i phyir de gnyis ni mar me dang 'od bzhin du lhan cig gi dngos po dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos rung ngo //
translated: However, it is the cause of its duration, and therefore it is tenable that those two are simultaneous, like a lamp and its light, and they are the cause and result of each other.

original: mig dang mig gi rnam par shes pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: mig dang mig gi rnam par shes pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is with the eye and visual consciousness,

original: rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang de dag gi rnam par shes pa rnams kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang de dag gi rnam par shes pa rnams kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: so it is with the ear, nose, tongue, body, and their consciousnesses.

original: gzhan du na rang gi sa bon las skye bar gyur na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas med pa las 'byung bar 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du na rang gi sa bon las skye bar gyur na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas med pa las 'byung bar 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
translated: Otherwise, if they were generated from their own seeds, the consciousnesses of the eye and so on would arise without a basis. That is not tenable.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes shing byung ba'i mig gi khams nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'am zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes shing byung ba'i mig gi khams nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'am zhe na /
translated: Should it be said that the eye element of one born and existing in the desire realm will definitely emerge?

original: smras pa / der ni gcig tu ma nges so //
analyzed: smras pa / der ni gcig tu ma nges so //
translated: It is not definite in that realm.

original: mig gi khams ji lta ba bzhin du rna ba dang sna dang lce'i khams rnams dang / de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi khams ji lta ba bzhin du rna ba dang sna dang lce'i khams rnams dang / de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as with the eye element, the ear element, nose element, and tongue element, and their consciousness elements, should be understood in the same way.

original: lus kyi khams ni nges par 'byung ste lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams dang yid kyi khams dang chos kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khams rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lus kyi khams ni nges par 'byung ste lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams dang yid kyi khams dang chos kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khams rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The body element definitely emerges, as well as the body-consciousness element, the mind element, the entity element, the mind-consciousness element, and the form, sound, smell, taste, and tangible-object elements.

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes shing 'byung ba'i mig gi khams nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'am zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes shing 'byung ba'i mig gi khams nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'am zhe na /
translated: Should it be said that the eye element of one born and existing in the form realm will definitely emerge?

original: smras pa / nges pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / nges pa yin no //
translated: It is definite.

original: mig gi khams ji lta ba bzhin du rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi khams rnams dang mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gi khams ji lta ba bzhin du rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi khams rnams dang mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The elements of the ear, nose, tongue, and body, and the elements of the consciousness of the ear, nose, tongue, and body are like the element of the eye.

original: @82a * // dri'i khams dang ro'i khams dang de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dag ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa thams cad ni nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @82a * // dri'i khams dang ro'i khams dang de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dag ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa thams cad ni nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Except for the element of smell, the element of taste, and the elements of the consciousness of smell and taste, all the other elements are definitely liberated.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes shing byung ba la ni khams gsum po yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams ma gtogs pa dang dbang sgyur bas thob pa'i gzugs ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa rnams ni nges par 'byung ba ma yin
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes shing byung ba la ni khams gsum po yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams ma gtogs pa dang dbang sgyur bas thob pa'i gzugs ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa rnams ni nges par 'byung ba ma yin
translated: Those that are born in the formless realm and have arisen there are not definitely liberated, except for the three elements of mind, mental objects, and mind consciousness, and except for the form that is obtained through mastery.

original: no // gsum po 'di dag ni der nges par 'byung bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: no // gsum po 'di dag ni der nges par 'byung bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: These three are seen as definitely liberated there.

original: 'di'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa ni phung po la mkhas pa dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa ni phung po la mkhas pa dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The summary verse should be understood as similar to the verse on skillfulness with regard to the aggregates.

original: kha zas kyi dngos po la mkhas pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: kha zas kyi dngos po la mkhas pa rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on skillfulness with regard to food is completed.

original: // / skye mched rnams kyi sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa yang khams rnams kyi ji lta ba de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: // / skye mched rnams kyi sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa yang khams rnams kyi ji lta ba de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The summary verse on the sense bases should be understood as it is for the elements.

original: mig gi skye mched gang zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched gang zhe na /
translated: What is the eye sense base?

original: mig thob cing ma spangs pa de ma thag tu lus las 'gog pa'i chos can ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mig thob cing ma spangs pa de ma thag tu lus las 'gog pa'i chos can ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the eye that has been obtained and not abandoned, and is not obstructed with regard to the object and the eye consciousness.

original: mig gi skye mched ji lta ba bzhin du skye mched lhag ma rnams kyang ngo bo nyid las de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi skye mched ji lta ba bzhin du skye mched lhag ma rnams kyang ngo bo nyid las de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining sense bases should be understood in the same way, according to their individual characteristics.

original: skye mched dang reg pa'i skye mched gnyis la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: skye mched dang reg pa'i skye mched gnyis la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the sense bases and the sense base of contact?

original: smras pa / skye mched ni ji skad bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / skye mched ni ji skad bstan pa yin no //
translated: The sense bases are as they have been explained.

original: reg pa'i skye mched ni skye mched gang reg pa dang / lhan cig pa de ma thag tu reg pa skye bar byed pa reg pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched ni skye mched gang reg pa dang / lhan cig pa de ma thag tu reg pa skye bar byed pa reg pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: The sense-sphere of contact is the sense-sphere that is in conjunction with contact, and that immediately precedes the arising of contact, and is favorable to contact.

original: mig gang yin pa skye mched kyang de yin la skye mched gang yin pa mig kyang de yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mig gang yin pa skye mched kyang de yin la skye mched gang yin pa mig kyang de yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it the case that whatever is the eye is also the sense-sphere?

original: smras pa / mig yin la skye mched ma yin pa'ang yod de mig thob cing ma spangs la de ma thag tu 'og tu 'gog pa'i chos can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / mig yin la skye mched ma yin pa'ang yod de mig thob cing ma spangs la de ma thag tu 'og tu 'gog pa'i chos can gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is said: There is the eye that is not the sense-sphere, namely, the eye that has been obtained and not abandoned, but is not present, and is not subject to cessation.

original: skye mched yin la mig ma yin pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: skye mched yin la mig ma yin pa'ang yod de /
translated: There is the sense-sphere that is not the eye,

original: skye mched lhag ma skye mched kyi mtshan nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: skye mched lhag ma skye mched kyi mtshan nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa rnams so //
translated: namely, the remaining sense-spheres that are present as the characteristics of the sense-spheres.

original: mig kyang yin la skye mched kyang yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: mig kyang yin la skye mched kyang yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is that which is the eye and also the sense-sphere,

original: mig thob cing ma spangs la de ma thag tu 'gog pa'i chos can yang ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mig thob cing ma spangs la de ma thag tu 'gog pa'i chos can yang ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: namely, the eye that has been obtained and not abandoned, but is not subject to cessation.

original: mig kyang ma yin la skye mched kyang ma yin pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: mig kyang ma yin la skye mched kyang ma yin pa'ang yod de /
translated: There is that which is neither the eye nor the sense-sphere,üîΩnamely,

original: mig ma thob pa'am spangs pa dang de las gzhan pa rna ba la sogs pa skye mched kyi mtshan nyid kyis nye bar mi gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mig ma thob pa'am spangs pa dang de las gzhan pa rna ba la sogs pa skye mched kyi mtshan nyid kyis nye bar mi gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the eye that has not yet arisen, or that has disappeared, or that is not present in the form of the sense-sphere.üîΩIs the sense-sphere that is a contact-sense-sphere?

original: skye mched gang yin pa reg pa'i skye mched @82b kyang de yin la reg pa'i skye mched gang yin pa skye mched kyang de yin nam zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / reg pa'i skye mched gang yin pa de ni re zhig skye mched kyang yin no //
analyzed: skye mched gang yin pa reg pa'i skye mched @82b kyang de yin la reg pa'i skye mched gang yin pa skye mched kyang de yin nam zhe na / smras pa / reg pa'i skye mched gang yin pa de ni re zhig skye mched kyang yin no //
translated: The sense-sphere that is a contact-sense-sphere is a sense-sphere.

original: skye mched yin la reg pa'i skye mched ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: skye mched yin la reg pa'i skye mched ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There are sense-spheres that are not contact-sense-spheres.

original: mig la sogs pa reg pa dang mi ldan pa dang / de ma thag tu reg pa skyed par mi byed pa dang 'gog pa'i chos can ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa reg pa dang mi ldan pa dang / de ma thag tu reg pa skyed par mi byed pa dang 'gog pa'i chos can ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The eye, etc. that are not associated with contact, that do not immediately produce contact, and that are not of the nature of cessation.

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes shing byung ba'i sna gang yin pa dang lce gang yin pa de ni dus rtag tu skye mched ma yin pa kho nar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes shing byung ba'i sna gang yin pa dang lce gang yin pa de ni dus rtag tu skye mched ma yin pa kho nar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The nose and tongue that have arisen in the form realm are never sense-spheres.

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'i dbang po gang dag yin pa de dag kyang dus rtag tu skye mched ma yin pa kho nar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'i dbang po gang dag yin pa de dag kyang dus rtag tu skye mched ma yin pa kho nar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The faculties of those gods who are born among the gods who are devoid of ideation are also never sense bases.

original: don gang gis na skye mched rnams zhes bya /
analyzed: don gang gis na skye mched rnams zhes bya /
translated: What is the meaning of sense bases?

original: ci zhig yongs su bstan pa'i phyir skye mched rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig yongs su bstan pa'i phyir skye mched rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: For the sake of teaching what are the sense bases established?

original: smras pa / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi skye ba'i sgo'i don dang / rkyen gyi don dang / thabs kyi don dang / tshogs pa'i dngos po'i don dang / rten gyi don dang / de dag snang ba'i gnas kyi don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi skye ba'i sgo'i don dang / rkyen gyi don dang / thabs kyi don dang / tshogs pa'i dngos po'i don dang / rten gyi don dang / de dag snang ba'i gnas kyi don gyis so //
translated: It is said: For the sake of the meaning of the door of arising of mind and mental factors, the meaning of condition, the meaning of means, the meaning of the collection of things, the meaning of support, and the meaning of the abode of their appearance.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen rnam pa gsum yongs su bstan par bya ba'i phyir skye mched rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen rnam pa gsum yongs su bstan par bya ba'i phyir skye mched rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The sense bases are established for the sake of teaching the three types of conditions: the equivalent immediately preceding condition, the objective condition, and the dominant condition.

original: skye mched rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba dang go rims ni khams bzhin du ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba dang go rims ni khams bzhin du ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The classification and order of the bases should be understood in the same way as the elements, as appropriate.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / de bzhin du rgyas par zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / de bzhin du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa'i skye mched bzhi dang / de bzhin du skye mched gnyis po 'du shes med pa'i skye mched dang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / de bzhin du rgyas par zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / de bzhin du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa'i skye mched bzhi dang / de bzhin du skye mched gnyis po 'du shes med pa'i skye mched dang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn declared in the s≈´tras that there are eight bases of subjugation, and similarly, in detail, ten bases of totality, and similarly, four bases such as the base of infinite space, and similarly, two bases such as the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment, and the base of cessation.

original: de dag la sogs pa skye mched kyi sgrar bstan pa'i chos gang dag gsungs pa de dag kyang skye mched bcu gnyis po dag gis mtshan nyid ji skad smos pas ci rigs par bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa skye mched kyi sgrar bstan pa'i chos gang dag gsungs pa de dag kyang skye mched bcu gnyis po dag gis mtshan nyid ji skad smos pas ci rigs par bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Those phenomena that are taught using the term base should be understood as included in the twelve bases, as appropriate, by the characteristics that have been explained.

original: skye mched rnams kyi rten kyang khams kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched rnams kyi rten kyang khams kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The support of the bases should be understood in the same way as the elements.

original: skye mched kyi dngos po la mkhas pa rdzogs so /üîΩ// / de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams zhes bya ba la gang dag bdag po med pa dang / byed pa po med pa dang / tshor ba po med pa dang / bdag nyid g-yo ba @83a * //üîΩmed pa dang / rang dbang med pa dang / rgyus bskyed pa dang / rkyen la rag las shing 'bral bar 'jug pa dang / ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i chos can dang / byung nas 'jig pa'i chos can dang / chos tsam zhag rab tu phye ba dang /
analyzed: skye mched kyi dngos po la mkhas pa rdzogs so / // / de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams zhes bya ba la gang dag bdag po med pa dang / byed pa po med pa dang / tshor ba po med pa dang / bdag nyid g-yo ba @83a * // med pa dang / rang dbang med pa dang / rgyus bskyed pa dang / rkyen la rag las shing 'bral bar 'jug pa dang / ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i chos can dang / byung nas 'jig pa'i chos can dang / chos tsam zhag rab tu phye ba dang /
translated: The explanation of the expertise in the sense bases is now complete.

original: chos rnams kho nas mngon par brlan pa dang / chos rnams kho na mngon par rlan par byed pa dang / rgyud du gtogs pa dang / de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de dag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kho nas mngon par brlan pa dang / chos rnams kho na mngon par rlan par byed pa dang / rgyud du gtogs pa dang / de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de dag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúdependently arisen phenomena‚Äù refers to those phenomena that are devoid of a self, devoid of an agent, devoid of a feeler, devoid of an inner being, devoid of independence, produced by causes, dependent on conditions, arising from a combination of causes and conditions, arising from a combination of causes and conditions, arising from a combination of causes and
