original: de la rgyu gang yin pa de la ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu gang yin pa de la ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is the cause is called dependent origination.

original: 'bras bu gang yin pa de la ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang yin pa de la ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: That which is the result should be seen as dependent origination.

original: de la ma rig pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa yod pas ma rig pa'i kun nas dkris pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa yod pas ma rig pa'i kun nas dkris pa 'byung ngo //
translated: There, the latent tendency of ignorance is not abandoned, and so the entanglement of ignorance arises.

original: ma rig pa'i kun nas dkris pa skyes pa'i phyir 'du byed rnams kyi 'jug pa skye'o ;
analyzed: ma rig pa'i kun nas dkris pa skyes pa'i phyir 'du byed rnams kyi 'jug pa skye'o ;
translated: Because the entanglement of ignorance arises, the engagement of formations arises.

original: / de bzhin du 'du byed kyi sa bon ma spangs pa yod pas 'du byed rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: / de bzhin du 'du byed kyi sa bon ma spangs pa yod pas 'du byed rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: Similarly, because the seed of formations is not abandoned, formations arise.

original: 'du byed rnams skyes pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'jug pa skye'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams skyes pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'jug pa skye'o //
translated: Because formations arise, the engagement of consciousness arises.

original: de bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag lhag ma rnams kyi 'jug pa'i tshul yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag lhag ma rnams kyi 'jug pa'i tshul yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the engagement of the remaining limbs of dependent origination should be understood in the appropriate manner.

original: de la srid pa dang skye ba dang rga shi ni btags pa'i chos yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la srid pa dang skye ba dang rga shi ni btags pa'i chos yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: There, existence, birth, and aging and death should be understood as imputed phenomena.

original: srid pa'i yan lag lhag ma rnams ni rdzas su yod pa'i chos yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag lhag ma rnams ni rdzas su yod pa'i chos yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The remaining members of dependent origination should be understood as real entities.

original: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The classification of dependent origination is presented in five ways.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: sdug bsngal 'phen pa'i rgyu'i gnas dang / sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu'i gnas dang / sdug bsngal 'phen pa'i rgyu dang / sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu dang / sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub pa nyid ni lnga'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phen pa'i rgyu'i gnas dang / sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu'i gnas dang / sdug bsngal 'phen pa'i rgyu dang / sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu dang / sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub pa nyid ni lnga'o //
translated: The basis of the cause that propels suffering, the basis of the cause that actualizes suffering, the cause that propels suffering, the cause that actualizes suffering, and the actualization of suffering.

original: de la tshe 'di la ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug mngon par 'grub pa ma spangs shing /
analyzed: de la tshe 'di la ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug mngon par 'grub pa ma spangs shing /
translated: In this life, the six sense bases are actualized on the basis of name-and-form as a condition, and that is not abandoned and not fully understood.

original: yongs su ma shes pa gang yin pa de la dmigs shing de la gnas nas /
analyzed: yongs su ma shes pa gang yin pa de la dmigs shing de la gnas nas /
translated: Focusing on that and taking that as a basis,

original: byis pa rnams kyi lus la kun tu rmongs pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyi lus la kun tu rmongs pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the ignorance that occurs in the childish as a complete delusion about the body is called ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis de'i 'og tu 'du byed rnams dang phyi ma la reg pa'i rkyen gyis @83b tshor ba'i bar du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis de'i 'og tu 'du byed rnams dang phyi ma la reg pa'i rkyen gyis @83b tshor ba'i bar du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Due to the condition of ignorance, the formations arise. Due to the condition of contact in the future, feeling arises.

original: skye mched drug po de dag ni ma rig pa la sogs pa 'phen pa'i rgyu de'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug po de dag ni ma rig pa la sogs pa 'phen pa'i rgyu de'i gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: These six sense spheres are called the ‚Äúabode‚Äù of the cause that propels ignorance and so on.

original: de ltar kun du rmongs pa'i reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshe 'de nyid la tshor ba 'byung ba gang yin pa de la gnas nas phyi rol gyi yul rnams la sred pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar kun du rmongs pa'i reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshe 'de nyid la tshor ba 'byung ba gang yin pa de la gnas nas phyi rol gyi yul rnams la sred pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, craving for external objects arises in this life due to the condition of contact, which is based on the feeling that arises due to the condition of contact, which is based on the delusion of ignorance.

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis de'i 'og tu len pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis de'i 'og tu len pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Due to the condition of craving, grasping arises.

original: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa 'byung ste /
translated: Due to the condition of grasping, becoming arises.

original: de ltar mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu de'i gnas ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba de yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu de'i gnas ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba de yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the ‚Äúabode‚Äù of the cause of actualization should be seen as the feeling that arises due to the condition of contact.

original: de la tshe 'di pa'i rnam par shes pa bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i las kyis yongs su bsgos pa la /
analyzed: de la tshe 'di pa'i rnam par shes pa bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i las kyis yongs su bsgos pa la /
translated: In this regard, the consciousness of this life is imbued with virtuous, nonvirtuous, and unmoving karma.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams dang reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i bar phyi ma phyi ma'i sa bon dang ldan pa gang dag yod pa de dag ni lus zhig nas /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams dang reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i bar phyi ma phyi ma'i sa bon dang ldan pa gang dag yod pa de dag ni lus zhig nas /
translated: The formations conditioned by ignorance and the feeling conditioned by contact that exist endowed with the seeds of the subsequent ones, when the body is destroyed,

original: phyi ma la rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye ba dang rga shi'i ming can gyi sdug bsngal gzhan 'phen par byed de /
analyzed: phyi ma la rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye ba dang rga shi'i ming can gyi sdug bsngal gzhan 'phen par byed de /
translated: project another suffering that is named consciousness, etc., up to old age and death.

original: de ni de'i 'phen pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de'i 'phen pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the projecting cause.

original: de la tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa dang sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa dang len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa gang yin pa de ni phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa dang sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa dang len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa gang yin pa de ni phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: In this regard, craving conditioned by feeling and grasping conditioned by craving and becoming conditioned by grasping are called the producing cause of future suffering.üîΩIt should be understood that becoming is the cause of the future suffering that is projected.

original: sngon byas pa'i las dang nyon mongs pas yongs su zin pa ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa de nyid la srid pa zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngon byas pa'i las dang nyon mongs pas yongs su zin pa ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa de nyid la srid pa zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The future birth that is appropriated by the karma and afflictions that were previously performed and that is directed toward the future is called becoming.

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba dang skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi gang yin pa de dag ni sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba dang skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi gang yin pa de dag ni sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising due to the condition of existence and the old age and death due to the condition of birth are called the establishment of suffering.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs la sogs pa tshor ba'i mthar thug pa de dag nyid sngon sa bon gyi dngos po dang ldan pa'i tshe na ni sdug bsngal 'phen pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs la sogs pa tshor ba'i mthar thug pa de dag nyid sngon sa bon gyi dngos po dang ldan pa'i tshe na ni sdug bsngal 'phen pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those very consciousnesses, name-and-form, etc., up to feeling, when possessing the state of a prior seed, obtain the name cause of projecting suffering.

original: de dag nyid da ltar 'bras bu bskyed zin pa ni skye ba dang rga shi'i ming can gyi sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob po //
analyzed: de dag nyid da ltar 'bras bu bskyed zin pa ni skye ba dang rga shi'i ming can gyi sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob po //
translated: Those very [factors] when the fruit has already been produced in the present obtain the name suffering, which is called birth and old age and death.

original: de la ma rig pa ni shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs sems las byung ba'i chos sgrib par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin par blta bar bya'i //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs sems las byung ba'i chos sgrib par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin par blta bar bya'i //
translated: Therein, ignorance should be seen as a mental factor that obscures the mind, having the nature of an obstruction to knowledge.

original: rig pa med pa tsam yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rig pa med pa tsam yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not merely the absence of knowledge,

original: log pa'i shes pa tsam yang ma yin no //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa tsam yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it merely a wrong knowledge.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: re zhig gal te ma rig pa rig pa med pa tsam yin par gyur na ni /üîΩde la chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid yod par @84a * //
analyzed: re zhig gal te ma rig pa rig pa med pa tsam yin par gyur na ni / de la chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid yod par @84a * //
translated: If ignorance were merely the absence of knowledge,

original: mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it would not exist as small, medium, and great.üîΩFor what is nonexistent has no small, medium, or greatüîΩand it would be impossible to posit the latent states and entanglements of ignorance.

original: med pa la ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid gang yang med pa dang / ma rig pa'i bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa rnam par gzhag par mi nus pa dang / med par ni dus thams cad du mtshan nyid 'dra ba yin pas /
analyzed: med pa la ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid gang yang med pa dang / ma rig pa'i bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa rnam par gzhag par mi nus pa dang / med par ni dus thams cad du mtshan nyid 'dra ba yin pas /
translated: And since what is nonexistent is always the same in terms of its characteristics,üîΩit would be impossible for it to exist as both a universal and a specific mental state.

original: kun du spyod pa dang rjes su 'brel ba gnyis yod par mi rung ba dang / so so'i skye bo'i sems nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa rig pa dang bral ba thams cad la yang rig pa med par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: kun du spyod pa dang rjes su 'brel ba gnyis yod par mi rung ba dang / so so'i skye bo'i sems nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa rig pa dang bral ba thams cad la yang rig pa med par 'gyur bas /
translated: And since all afflicted and virtuous minds of ordinary beings and all neutral minds devoid of knowledge would be devoid of knowledge,

original: des na sems de dag thams cad nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba dang / med pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos ni 'dus byas kyis bsdus par yang mi rung la 'dus ma byas kyis bsdus par yang mi rung ba dang / 'dus byas kyis kyang ma bsdus la 'dus ma byas kyis kyang ma bsdus pa gang yin pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: des na sems de dag thams cad nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba dang / med pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos ni 'dus byas kyis bsdus par yang mi rung la 'dus ma byas kyis bsdus par yang mi rung ba dang / 'dus byas kyis kyang ma bsdus la 'dus ma byas kyis kyang ma bsdus pa gang yin pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur la rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Therefore, all those minds would be afflicted, and a phenomenon that has the nature of nonexistence cannot be included in the conditioned nor can it be included in the unconditioned, and that which is not included in the conditioned nor in the unconditioned cannot be afflicted nor can it be purified.

original: ma rig pa dang ma bral ba'i sems kyi rgyud la ni dus rtag tu rig pa skye bar yang mi 'gyur ba dang / ma rig pa 'gags na rig pa skye zhes gang gsungs pa de yang med pa la ni 'gag pa ji ltar yang mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang ma bral ba'i sems kyi rgyud la ni dus rtag tu rig pa skye bar yang mi 'gyur ba dang / ma rig pa 'gags na rig pa skye zhes gang gsungs pa de yang med pa la ni 'gag pa ji ltar yang mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And in a mindstream that is not free from ignorance, knowledge would never arise, and that which is said, ‚ÄúWhen ignorance ceases, knowledge arises,‚Äù is also not tenable because cessation is not possible in the slightest in the nonexistent.

original: gal te ma rig pa log pa'i shes pa tsam zhig yin par gyur na yang de ltar na rig pas bsdus pa'i shes pa nyid ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i shes pa thams cad log pa'i shes pa yin par 'gyur ba'am /üîΩnyon mongs pa can gyi bdag nyid kyi shes pa gang yin pa de nyid log pa'i shes pa yin par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa log pa'i shes pa tsam zhig yin par gyur na yang de ltar na rig pas bsdus pa'i shes pa nyid ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i shes pa thams cad log pa'i shes pa yin par 'gyur ba'am / nyon mongs pa can gyi bdag nyid kyi shes pa gang yin pa de nyid log pa'i shes pa yin par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If ignorance were merely a wrong consciousness, then all consciousnesses other than consciousnesses included in the class of correct consciousnesses would be wrong consciousnesses.üîΩOr, any consciousness that has an afflicted nature would be a wrong consciousness.

original: nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de log pa'i shes pa yin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de log pa'i shes pa yin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Or, any consciousness that is concomitant with affliction would be a wrong consciousness.

original: gal te shes pa dang po log pa'i shes pa yin par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te shes pa dang po log pa'i shes pa yin par gyur na ni /
translated: If the first consciousness were a wrong consciousness,

original: de lta na so so'i skye bo'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i shes pa dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa thams cad kyang log pa'i shes pa yin par 'gyur bas de ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta na so so'i skye bo'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i shes pa dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa thams cad kyang log pa'i shes pa yin par 'gyur bas de ni mi rung ngo //
translated: then all virtuous and neutral consciousnesses included in the mindstreams of ordinary beings would be wrong consciousnesses, but that is unacceptable.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa can gyi bdag nyid kyi shes pa log pa'i shes pa yin par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa can gyi bdag nyid kyi shes pa log pa'i shes pa yin par gyur na ni /
translated: If consciousness that is afflicted in nature is mistaken consciousness,

original: de ltar na 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta ba lnga po dag kyang nyon mongs pa can gyi bdag nyid kyi shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta ba lnga po dag kyang nyon mongs pa can gyi bdag nyid kyi shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: then the five views such as the afflicted view of the self are also called consciousnesses that are afflicted in nature.

original: de la ma rig pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du @84b mi rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin la lta ba rnams ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma rtogs na log pa'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du @84b mi rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin la lta ba rnams ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma rtogs na log pa'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Ignorance is defined as the noncomprehension of things as they really are, and the views are defined as the noncomprehension of things as they really are, which is to say, the adherence to things that are unreal.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,üîΩthe afflicted view of the self causes one to adhere to the self and entities connected to the self through the power of ignorance. Similarly, the remaining views engage their objects through their respective modes of adherence.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni ma rig pa'i dbang gis bdag dang bdag gi zhes mngon par zhen par byed la de bzhin du lta ba lhag ma rnams kyang rang rang gi mngon par bzhin pa'i rnam pas 'jug par 'gyur ba de dag kyang gti mug med par
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni ma rig pa'i dbang gis bdag dang bdag gi zhes mngon par zhen par byed la de bzhin du lta ba lhag ma rnams kyang rang rang gi mngon par bzhin pa'i rnam pas 'jug par 'gyur ba de dag kyang gti mug med par
translated: Since they are not free from ignorance,

original: yang mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: yang mi 'gyur bas /
translated: they are not free from the adherence to things that are unreal.

original: de'i phyir gti mug gi rnam pa yang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gti mug gi rnam pa yang gzhan yin la /
translated: Therefore, the aspect of ignorance is one thing,

original: lta ba rnams kyi rnam pa yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lta ba rnams kyi rnam pa yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and the aspects of the views are another.

original: ma rig pa nyon mongs pa can gyi bdag nyid kyi shes pa yin par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ma rig pa nyon mongs pa can gyi bdag nyid kyi shes pa yin par mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that ignorance is a consciousness that is the nature of an afflicted view.

original: gal te ma rig pa dang lta ba rnams mtshan nyid 'dra ba yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa dang lta ba rnams mtshan nyid 'dra ba yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If ignorance and the views had the same characteristics,

original: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis bag la nyal bdun po dag tu lta ba'i bag la nyal rnam par gzhag pa mdzad par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis bag la nyal bdun po dag tu lta ba'i bag la nyal rnam par gzhag pa mdzad par mi 'gyur la /
translated: then the BhagavƒÅn would not have posited the latent afflictions as seven,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis lta ba rnams la ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i ming ni gang du'ang ma bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lta ba rnams la ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i ming ni gang du'ang ma bstan to //
translated: and the BhagavƒÅn would not have taught anywhere that the views are called ignorance.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i log pa'i shes pa ma rig pa yin par gyur na de ltar na 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta ba lnga po gang dag yin pa de dag kyang shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i log pa'i shes pa ma rig pa yin par gyur na de ltar na 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta ba lnga po gang dag yin pa de dag kyang shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: If ignorance were a wrong consciousness concomitant with the afflictions, then the five views such as the view of the transitory collection would also be by nature consciousnesses.

original: shes pa'i rdzas gnyis mtshungs par ldan pa ni med pas /
analyzed: shes pa'i rdzas gnyis mtshungs par ldan pa ni med pas /
translated: But there is no substance of consciousness that is concomitant with both.

original: de dag ni ma rig pa dang mi ldan pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni ma rig pa dang mi ldan pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they would not be associated with ignorance.

original: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis shes pa de gti mug nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis shes pa de gti mug nyid yin na ni /
translated: If that consciousness were delusion itself due to the power of afflictions such as attachment,

original: des na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbang gis gti mug tu 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbang gis gti mug tu 'gyur gyi /
translated: then it would be delusion due to the power of attachment and so on,

original: gti mug gi dbang dang gti mug sngon du 'gro ba las 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gti mug gi dbang dang gti mug sngon du 'gro ba las 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: but it would not be the case that afflictions such as attachment arise from the power of delusion and preceded by delusion.

original: ji ltar nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ni mtshungs par ldan pa las nyon mongs pa can yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ni mtshungs par ldan pa las nyon mongs pa can yin gyi /
translated: Just as the wisdom concomitant with afflictions is afflicted due to its concomitance,

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin pa bzhin du /
translated: but not due to its intrinsic nature,

original: gti mug gi bdag nyid ma yin pa de yang gti mug gi bdag nyid du drang par brjod mi nus te /
analyzed: gti mug gi bdag nyid ma yin pa de yang gti mug gi bdag nyid du drang par brjod mi nus te /
translated: so too that which is not the nature of delusion cannot be described as being the nature of delusion.

original: dper na de las gzhan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos /
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos /
translated: For example, other minds and mental factors

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa /
translated: It is not of a defiled nature,

original: nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag lta bu'o //üîΩde lta bas na ma rig pa ni sems las @85a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag lta bu'o // de lta bas na ma rig pa ni sems las @85a * //
translated: but is associated with defilements.

original: byung ba'i chos sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: byung ba'i chos sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, ignorance is a mental factor, a dharma associated with the mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis lus kyi 'du byed dang dag gi 'du byed dang yid kyi 'du byed dang 'du byed gsum gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lus kyi 'du byed dang dag gi 'du byed dang yid kyi 'du byed dang 'du byed gsum gsungs pa de la /
translated: The Blessed One has taught three kinds of formative forces: formative forces of body, speech, and mind.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba'i rlung dag kyang lus kyi 'du byed dag yin te /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba'i rlung dag kyang lus kyi 'du byed dag yin te /
translated: In this regard, the winds of inhalation and exhalation are formative forces of body,

original: rlung ni lus kyi las 'jug pa'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung ni lus kyi las 'jug pa'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the wind is the antecedent of bodily action.

original: lus kyi las gang yin pa de nyid lus kyi 'du byed yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi las gang yin pa de nyid lus kyi 'du byed yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand that whatever is bodily action is also a formative force of body.

original: de ltar rmongs pa la lus kyi las dang rjes su mthun pa'i rlung dag kyang 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar rmongs pa la lus kyi las dang rjes su mthun pa'i rlung dag kyang 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, in one who is confused, winds arise that are in conformity with bodily action.

original: de dag gis lus kyi las nyon mongs pa can 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: de dag gis lus kyi las nyon mongs pa can 'jug par byed do //
translated: They cause the performance of defiled bodily action.

original: ji ltar dbugs rdu ba pa dang dbugs 'byung ba dag gis lus kyi las 'jug par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar dbugs rdu ba pa dang dbugs 'byung ba dag gis lus kyi las 'jug par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as inhalation and exhalation cause the body to engage in action,

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag gis kyang ngag gi las 'jug par byed la /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag gis kyang ngag gi las 'jug par byed la /
translated: so too, investigation and analysis cause speech to engage in action.

original: 'du byed kyis kyang yid kyi las 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: 'du byed kyis kyang yid kyi las 'jug par byed de /
translated: And formation causes the mind to engage in action.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni lus kyi 'du byed dang / ngag gi 'du byed dang / yid kyi 'du byed ces bya ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni lus kyi 'du byed dang / ngag gi 'du byed dang / yid kyi 'du byed ces bya ste /
translated: All of these together are called bodily formation, verbal formation, and mental formation.

original: khams gang la gang yod pa'o //
analyzed: khams gang la gang yod pa'o //
translated: They exist in the realms as follows.

original: de la yan lag bcu gnyis po gang yin pa de dag las gnyis ni las kho nas bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: de la yan lag bcu gnyis po gang yin pa de dag las gnyis ni las kho nas bsdus pa yin te /
translated: Among the twelve members, two are subsumed only in action:

original: 'du byed dang srid pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed dang srid pa'o //
translated: formation and becoming.

original: gsum ni nyon mongs pas bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: gsum ni nyon mongs pas bsdus pa yin te /
translated: Three are subsumed in the afflictions:

original: ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang len pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang len pa'o //
translated: ignorance, craving, and grasping.

original: lhag ma rnams ni dngos pos bsdus pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni dngos pos bsdus pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining members should be seen as subsumed in actual entities.

original: de la yan lag gnyis po gang dag las kyis bsdus pa de dag las gcig ni 'phen pa'i las kyis bsdus pa'i las yin te /
analyzed: de la yan lag gnyis po gang dag las kyis bsdus pa de dag las gcig ni 'phen pa'i las kyis bsdus pa'i las yin te /
translated: Of those two members that are included in action, one is the action that is included in the projecting cause,

original: 'di lta ste 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'du byed rnams so //
translated: namely, the formative forces.üîΩThe other is the action that is included in the actualizing cause,

original: gnyis pa ni mngon par 'grub pa'i las kyis bsdus pa'i las yin te 'di lta ste srid pa'o //üîΩde la yan lag gsum po gang dag nyon mongs pas bsdus pa de dag las gcig ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mngon par 'grub pa'i las kyis bsdus pa'i las yin te 'di lta ste srid pa'o // de la yan lag gsum po gang dag nyon mongs pas bsdus pa de dag las gcig ni /
translated: namely, becoming.üîΩOf those three members that are included in the afflictions, one is the motivating force of the projecting cause,

original: 'phen pa'i las kun nas slong bar byed pa yin te 'di lta ste ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'phen pa'i las kun nas slong bar byed pa yin te 'di lta ste ma rig pa'o //
translated: namely, ignorance.

original: gnyis pa ni mngon par grub pa'i las kun nas slong bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mngon par grub pa'i las kun nas slong bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The other is the motivating force of the actualizing cause,

original: 'di lta ste srid pa dang len pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste srid pa dang len pa'o //
translated: namely, becoming and grasping.

original: yan lag lhag ma gang dag dngos pos bsdus pa de dag las yang lag gnyis ni ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma gang dag dngos pos bsdus pa de dag las yang lag gnyis ni ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa yin te /
translated: Of those remaining members that are included in the entities, two are included in future suffering,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: skye ba dang rga shi'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi'o //
translated: birth and old age and death.

original: yan lag lnga ni ma @85b 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyus bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: yan lag lnga ni ma @85b 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyus bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The five members are included in future suffering.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: tshe 'di la 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang rnam par shes pa la brten nas reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i bar dag go //
analyzed: tshe 'di la 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang rnam par shes pa la brten nas reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i bar dag go //
translated: The consciousness that is conditioned by formations in this life and the feeling that is conditioned by contact that is based on consciousness.

original: gang dag sngon gyi rgyus mngon par bsgrub ste da ltar dmigs pa rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bsdus pa'i yan lag lnga po de dag nyid ni da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa dag ste /
analyzed: gang dag sngon gyi rgyus mngon par bsgrub ste da ltar dmigs pa rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bsdus pa'i yan lag lnga po de dag nyid ni da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa dag ste /
translated: Those very five members that are included in the result of evolution that is perceived in the present because they are established by previous causes are included in present suffering.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba'o //
translated: consciousness, name and form, the six sense bases, contact and feeling.

original: de la yan lag lngas bsdus pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de dang yan lag gnyis kyis bsdus pa ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'bras bur bsdus pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la yan lag lngas bsdus pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de dang yan lag gnyis kyis bsdus pa ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'bras bur bsdus pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The effect included in five members and the effect in the future included in two members should be understood as the effect of dependent origination.

original: yan lag lhag ma rnams ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rgyur bsdus pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma rnams ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rgyur bsdus pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining members should be understood as the cause of dependent origination.

original: mi shes pa de yang mdor bsdu na gnas lnga bskyed pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa de yang mdor bsdu na gnas lnga bskyed pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: That ignorance should be understood as being produced by five things.

original: 'di lta ste som nyi skyed pa dang / sred pa skyed pa dang / gnas ma yin pa la dad pa skyed pa dang / lta ba skyed pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste som nyi skyed pa dang / sred pa skyed pa dang / gnas ma yin pa la dad pa skyed pa dang / lta ba skyed pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyed pa'o //
translated: Doubt, craving, faith in what is not right, view, and pride.

original: de la sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni som nyi skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni som nyi skyed pa yin no //
translated: Among them, ignorance about the prior limit produces doubt.

original: de la som nyi ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la som nyi ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the doubt:

original: ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na ma byung bar gyur tam snyam pa dus gsum dag la 'jug pa'i som nyi mdo las ji skad gsungs pa kho na bzhin no //
analyzed: ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na ma byung bar gyur tam snyam pa dus gsum dag la 'jug pa'i som nyi mdo las ji skad gsungs pa kho na bzhin no //
translated: The Sutra states: One wonders if I existed in the past or not, and so on, in regard to the three times.

original: de la 'das pa'i dus ni sngon gyi mtha' yin no //
analyzed: de la 'das pa'i dus ni sngon gyi mtha' yin no //
translated: The past time is the prior limit.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus ni phyi ma'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus ni phyi ma'i mtha' yin no //
translated: The future time is the later limit.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus ni sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus ni sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya ste /
translated: The present time is called the prior and later limits.

original: 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas ni phyi ma'i mtha' yin la ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ltos nas ni sngon gyi mtha' yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas ni phyi ma'i mtha' yin la ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ltos nas ni sngon gyi mtha' yin no //
translated: In relation to the past time, the future time is the later limit. In relation to the future time, the past time is the later limit.

original: de la gang gi tshe 'das pa'i dus la som nyi za ba'i som nyi de ni sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pas bskyed pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe 'das pa'i dus la som nyi za ba'i som nyi de ni sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pas bskyed pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: In this regard, one should understand that doubt in regard to the past time is generated by ignorance of the prior limit.

original: gang gi tshe ma 'ongs pa'i dus la som nyi za ba'i som nyi de ni phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pas bskyed pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma 'ongs pa'i dus la som nyi za ba'i som nyi de ni phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pas bskyed pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand that doubt in regard to the future time is generated by ignorance of the later limit.

original: nang la som nyi za ste ci zhig yod /üîΩcir 'gyur / sems can 'di ga las 'ongs /üîΩ'di nas shi 'phos nas gang du 'gro bar 'gyur snyam du som nyi za ba gang yin pa de ni sngon gyi @86a * //üîΩmtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pas bskyed pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nang la som nyi za ste ci zhig yod / cir 'gyur / sems can 'di ga las 'ongs / 'di nas shi 'phos nas gang du 'gro bar 'gyur snyam du som nyi za ba gang yin pa de ni sngon gyi @86a * // mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pas bskyed pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
