original: nang mi shes pa dang phyi rol mi shes pa dang nang dang phyi rol mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni /üîΩnang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnams la yang srid pa 'byung bar byed pa dang / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang de dang der mngon par dga' ba'i srid pa gang yin pa des bskyed do //
analyzed: nang mi shes pa dang phyi rol mi shes pa dang nang dang phyi rol mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni /üîΩnang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnams la yang srid pa 'byung bar byed pa dang / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang de dang der mngon par dga' ba'i srid pa gang yin pa des bskyed do //
translated: What is the inner and outer?üîΩWhat is the inner and outer?üîΩWhat is the inner

original: de la las dang rnam par smin pa dang las dang rnam par smin pa mi shes pas sems can rnams kyi las bdag gir bya ba nyid mi shes pa gang yin pa de la brten nas ni drag po dang khyab 'jug dang skye dgu'i bdag po la sogs
analyzed: de la las dang rnam par smin pa dang las dang rnam par smin pa mi shes pas sems can rnams kyi las bdag gir bya ba nyid mi shes pa gang yin pa de la brten nas ni drag po dang khyab 'jug dang skye dgu'i bdag po la sogs
translated: In this regard, since they do not understand karma and its ripening, sentient beings do not understand karma to be one's own.üîΩ

original: pa gnas ngan pa dag la gus pa dang dad pa dang mos pa skye'o //
analyzed: pa gnas ngan pa dag la gus pa dang dad pa dang mos pa skye'o //
translated: The non-understanding of the karma of sentient beings, of the maturation of karma, and of the karma and maturation of sentient beings, is the basis for the generation of respect, faith, and devotion toward inferior abodes, such as Shiva, Vishnu, Ishvara, etc.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dang lam gyi mthar thug pa'i bar dag mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni lta ba bskyed par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dang lam gyi mthar thug pa'i bar dag mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni lta ba bskyed par rig par bya ste /
translated: The non-understanding of the Buddha, etc., and the non-understanding of the culmination of the path should be understood as the generation of views.

original: 'di ltar dkon mchog rnams mi shes pa dang / bden pa rnams mi shes pas ni lta ba'i rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi bar dag skyed par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dkon mchog rnams mi shes pa dang / bden pa rnams mi shes pas ni lta ba'i rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi bar dag skyed par byed do //
translated: Thus, due to the non-understanding of the Jewels and the non-understanding of the Truths, up to the generation of the sixty-two views is explained.

original: sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no giving,

original: mchod sbyin med do zhes rgya cher de ltar lta zhing /
analyzed: mchod sbyin med do zhes rgya cher de ltar lta zhing /
translated: no sacrifice,

original: de skad smra ba'i bar gang yin pa de ni log par lta ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de skad smra ba'i bar gang yin pa de ni log par lta ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: up to this is the wrong view.

original: rgyu dang rgyu las byung ba'i chos rnams dang dge ba dang mi dge ba dag mi shes pa rgya cher mdo las ji skad gsungs pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni bde 'gror 'gro ba'i lam dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba'i thabs la mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyed par byed de /
analyzed: rgyu dang rgyu las byung ba'i chos rnams dang dge ba dang mi dge ba dag mi shes pa rgya cher mdo las ji skad gsungs pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni bde 'gror 'gro ba'i lam dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba'i thabs la mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyed par byed de /
translated: The ignorance of the causes and results of phenomena, of virtue and nonvirtue, as extensively taught in the sutras, is the conceit of the path to the higher realms and the means to the higher realms.

original: 'di ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa rnams ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa rnams ni /
translated: Thus, those who do not know correctly the phenomena of virtue and nonvirtue and so on and their desired and undesired results

original: zas mi za ba dang mer 'jug pa dang / g-yang sar mchong ba la sogs pa thabs ma yin pa dag gis thabs su 'du shes shing mtho ris yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: zas mi za ba dang mer 'jug pa dang / g-yang sar mchong ba la sogs pa thabs ma yin pa dag gis thabs su 'du shes shing mtho ris yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: perceive the means to the higher realms in such nonmeans as fasting, entering fire, jumping off a cliff, and so on.

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug po dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma rtogs pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni dge slong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'thob pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyed par byed de /
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug po dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma rtogs pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni dge slong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'thob pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyed par byed de /
translated: The ignorance that does not understand the six sense bases of contact as they are in reality generates the over-esteeming of that which is not the path in the attainment of the fruit of the religious wanderer.

original: 'di ltar reg pa'i skye mched drug rab tu rtogs pa'i shes pa med pa ni de la mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar reg pa'i skye mched drug rab tu rtogs pa'i shes pa med pa ni de la mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the absence of the knowledge that fully understands the six sense bases of contact generates the over-esteeming of that which is not the path.

original: de la mtho ris kyi thabs la mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa gang yin pa @86b dang dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu la mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa gang yin pa de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mtho ris kyi thabs la mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa gang yin pa @86b dang dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu la mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa gang yin pa de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: The over-esteeming of that which is not the path in the means to heaven and the over-esteeming of that which is not the path in the fruit of the religious wanderer are combined into one and called the over-esteeming of that which is not the path.

original: de ltar na ma rig pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa lnga po 'di dag skyed par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar na ma rig pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa lnga po 'di dag skyed par byed de /
translated: Thus, ignorance generates these five types of afflictions.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: som nyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang sred pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mos pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: som nyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang sred pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mos pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The defilement of doubt, the defilement of craving, the defilement of belief, the defilement of views, and the defilement of pride.

original: de la som nyi'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i byis pa ni som nyi thob pa dang the tshom thob pa dang / gzhan gyi dring la 'jog pa dang / gzhan gyis bkri ba yin pas tshe 'di la sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba la reg pa med par gnas so //
analyzed: de la som nyi'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i byis pa ni som nyi thob pa dang the tshom thob pa dang / gzhan gyi dring la 'jog pa dang / gzhan gyis bkri ba yin pas tshe 'di la sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba la reg pa med par gnas so //
translated: The child who is defiled by the defilement of doubt is defiled by the acquisition of doubt, by the acquisition of uncertainty, by being led by others, and by being carried away by others. Thus, in this life, he does not abide in the experience of happiness.

original: srid pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa ni yang 'byung bas skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: srid pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa ni yang 'byung bas skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed do //
translated: The one who is defiled by the defilement of craving brings about the manifestation of the suffering of birth, old age, disease, etc. by being reborn again and again.

original: mos pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa ni rgyu med pa'am mi mthun pa'i rgyu dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyu yin par rtogs shing skyes bu'i byed pa med pa kho nar gnas so //
analyzed: mos pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa ni rgyu med pa'am mi mthun pa'i rgyu dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyu yin par rtogs shing skyes bu'i byed pa med pa kho nar gnas so //
translated: The defilement of faithlessness is the cause of the defilement of the mind, because one imagines that there is no cause or that the cause is not in accordance with the effect, such as the Lord, etc. and one remains without any human effort.

original: lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa ni nyes pa spyod pa la ji 'dod dgur 'jug cing phyi ma la ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa ni nyes pa spyod pa la ji 'dod dgur 'jug cing phyi ma la ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed do //
translated: The defilement of view is the cause of the defilement of the mind, because one engages in evil conduct as one wishes and brings about the suffering of the miserable destinies in the future.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa ni skyes bu'i byed pa 'bras bu med pa dang 'bras bu dang bral bar byed do //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa ni skyes bu'i byed pa 'bras bu med pa dang 'bras bu dang bral bar byed do //
translated: The defilement of pride is the cause of the defilement of the mind, because one makes human effort fruitless and devoid of result.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa'i rab tu dbye ba rgyas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa'i rab tu dbye ba rgyas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The extensive classification of skill in dependent origination is as follows:

original: sa'i dngos gzhir bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i dngos gzhir bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as taught in the Abhidharma-mahavibhasa-sastra.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo //
translated: The remaining topics of the treatise on the expertise in dependent origination are not presented here.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po la mkhas pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po la mkhas pa rdzogs so /
translated: The expertise in the things of dependent origination is complete.

original: // / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa'i spyi sdom ni /
analyzed: // / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa'i spyi sdom ni /
translated: The general summary of the expertise in the possible and impossible is:üîΩThe body, the teaching, and the door

original: lus dang yongs su bstan pa dang // sgo dbye ba ni tha ma yin //
analyzed: lus dang yongs su bstan pa dang // sgo dbye ba ni tha ma yin //
translated: are the last.

original: gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the possible?

original: smras pa / gzhi de dang de la rigs pa dang mi 'gal ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gzhi de dang de la rigs pa dang mi 'gal ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which is not in contradiction with reason in any given case.

original: gnas ma yin pa gang zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / gzhi de dang de la rigs pa dang @87a * //
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa gang zhe na / smras pa / gzhi de dang de la rigs pa dang @87a * //
translated: What is the impossible?

original: 'gal ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is that which is in contradiction with reason in any given case.

original: de ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa gnyis kyi lus yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa gnyis kyi lus yin no //
translated: This is the body of the two, the possible and the impossible.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis don ci'i phyir gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa yongs su bstan ce na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis don ci'i phyir gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa yongs su bstan ce na /
translated: Why did the Bhagavat teach the expertise in the possible and the impossible?

original: smras pa / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba gnyis kyi yang dag pa'i thabs shes pas chud mi za ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba gnyis kyi yang dag pa'i thabs shes pas chud mi za ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He replied: ‚ÄúBecause it demonstrates the non-wastage of the correct means of purification and affliction.‚Äù

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa gnyis la sgo du yod par blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa gnyis la sgo du yod par blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: If one asks how many doors there are to the two, the possible and the impossible,

original: smras pa / bzhi ste /
analyzed: smras pa / bzhi ste /
translated: he replied: ‚ÄúFour.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas dang gnas ma yin pa nyid ni sgo bzhi kho nas bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas dang gnas ma yin pa nyid ni sgo bzhi kho nas bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the Blessed One taught the possible and the impossible through only four doors.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'grub pa'i sgo dang 'grogs pa'i sgo dang thob pa'i sgo dang kun du spyod pa'i sgos so //
analyzed: 'grub pa'i sgo dang 'grogs pa'i sgo dang thob pa'i sgo dang kun du spyod pa'i sgos so //
translated: the door of accomplishment, the door of association, the door of attainment, and the door of practice.

original: ci'i phyir gnas dang gnas ma yin pa nyid sgo bzhis bstan ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnas dang gnas ma yin pa nyid sgo bzhis bstan ce na /
translated: If one asks why the possible and the impossible are taught through four doors,

original: smras pa / rnam pa thams cad kyi rab tu dbye ba dag gi sgo kun tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam pa thams cad kyi rab tu dbye ba dag gi sgo kun tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: he replied: ‚ÄúIn order to demonstrate the doors of all the different aspects.

original: rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: If one asks what are those different aspects,

original: 'grub pa'i sgo las brtsams te /
analyzed: 'grub pa'i sgo las brtsams te /
translated: beginning with the door of accomplishment,

original: des ma bsdus pa'i rnam pa lhag ma rnams yongs su brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: des ma bsdus pa'i rnam pa lhag ma rnams yongs su brjod par bya ste /
translated: The remaining modes of activity that are not included in the above should be explained.

original: de'i rab tu dbye ba ni dbang po'i 'chol ba dang / 'byung ba chen po'i 'chol ba dang / yo byang 'byung ba'i 'chol ba las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rab tu dbye ba ni dbang po'i 'chol ba dang / 'byung ba chen po'i 'chol ba dang / yo byang 'byung ba'i 'chol ba las blta bar bya'o //
translated: The classification of these should be understood from the Compendium of Bases, the Compendium of Elements, and the Compendium of Faculties.

original: de la dbang po'i 'chol ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la dbang po'i 'chol ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: The Compendium of Faculties states:

original: mig gi dbang pos sgra dag nyan pa dang / dri dag snom pa dang / ro dag myang ba dang / reg bya dag reg par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin /üîΩskabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: mig gi dbang pos sgra dag nyan pa dang / dri dag snom pa dang / ro dag myang ba dang / reg bya dag reg par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin / skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible, it is not possible, that the eye faculty would hear sounds, smell scents, taste flavors, or feel touchables.

original: gzugs rnams la lta bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: gzugs rnams la lta bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
translated: It is impossible, it is not possible, that the eye faculty would see visible forms.

original: mig gi dbang po ji lta ba bzhin du dbang po gzugs can lhag ma rnams kyis re re nas phan tshun 'chol ba'i rab tu dbye ba yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po ji lta ba bzhin du dbang po gzugs can lhag ma rnams kyis re re nas phan tshun 'chol ba'i rab tu dbye ba yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The classification of the remaining material faculties should be understood in the same way, each one in relation to the others.

original: de la 'byung ba chen po'i 'chol ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la 'byung ba chen po'i 'chol ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: The Compendium of Elements states:

original: sas chu'i bya ba byed par 'gyur ba dang / me'i bya ba dang / rlung gi bya ba byed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: sas chu'i bya ba byed par 'gyur ba dang / me'i bya ba dang / rlung gi bya ba byed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible and incorrect for earth to perform the function of water, or for earth to perform the function of fire or wind.

original: sas sa'i bya ba byed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: sas sa'i bya ba byed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni gnas yod do //
translated: It is possible for earth to perform the function of earth.

original: 'byung ba chen po lhag ma rnams kyi phan tshun 'chol ba'i rab tu dbye ba yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po lhag ma rnams kyi phan tshun 'chol ba'i rab tu dbye ba yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining great elements should be understood in the same way, in terms of their mutual permutations.

original: de la yo byad 'byung ba'i 'chol ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la yo byad 'byung ba'i 'chol ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the permutation of the arising of requisites:

original: sa @87b bon gyi rigs gzhan las myu gu'i rigs gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: sa @87b bon gyi rigs gzhan las myu gu'i rigs gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible and incorrect for a sprout to arise from a seed of a different type.

original: de dang rigs mthun pa las gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: de dang rigs mthun pa las gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
translated: It is possible for a sprout to arise from a seed of the same type.

original: bdag gis rva rnams bzhos pa las 'o ma 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: bdag gis rva rnams bzhos pa las 'o ma 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible and incorrect for milk to arise from the horns of an ox.

original: nu ma dag las gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: nu ma dag las gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
translated: The milk that comes from the udder is possible.

original: chu'i bum pa bsrubs pa las mar sar 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: chu'i bum pa bsrubs pa las mar sar 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: The butter that comes from churning water is impossible, not possible, not at all possible.

original: zho las gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: zho las gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
translated: The curd that comes from milk is possible.

original: bye ma dag btsir ba las til mar 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: bye ma dag btsir ba las til mar 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: The oil that comes from pressing sand is impossible, not possible, not at all possible.

original: til dag las gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: til dag las gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
translated: The oil that comes from sesame seeds is possible.

original: shing rlon pa gtsubs pa las me 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: shing rlon pa gtsubs pa las me 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te de ni gnas med do //
translated: The fire that comes from rubbing two wet pieces of wood together is impossible, not possible, not at all possible.

original: shing skam po dag las gang yin pa de ni gnas yod de /
analyzed: shing skam po dag las gang yin pa de ni gnas yod de /
translated: The fire that comes from rubbing two dry pieces of wood together is possible.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la /
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la /
translated: Such are the various kinds of possibilities and impossibilities.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang po'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang po'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The first alternative should be understood as the analysis of the modes of the first kind of conceptualization.

original: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas gang zhe na /
translated: In the second case, it is said:üîΩIt is impossible and does not occur that light and darkness

original: snang ba dang mun pa gnyis dus gcig nas 'grogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: snang ba dang mun pa gnyis dus gcig nas 'grogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: coexist in the same place and at the same time.

original: cig shos med par gcig pu 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: cig shos med par gcig pu 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
translated: It is possible that one occurs without the other.üîΩIt is impossible and does not occur that fire and water

original: me dang chu gnyis lhan cig 'grogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: me dang chu gnyis lhan cig 'grogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: coexist in the same place and at the same time.

original: gang yang rung ba gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
translated: It is possible that one occurs without the other.üîΩIt is impossible and does not occur that two collections of formüîΩcoexist in the same place and at the same time.

original: gzugs 'dus pa gnyis yul gcig tu yul mtshungs par gnas par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: gzugs 'dus pa gnyis yul gcig tu yul mtshungs par gnas par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is possible that one occurs without the other.üîΩIt is impossible and does not occur that two atoms

original: rdul phra rab gcig gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
translated: coexist in the same place and at the same time.üîΩIt is possible that one occurs without the other.

original: rigs mthun pa'i sems gnyis sam sems las byung ba gnyis lhan cig 'grogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i sems gnyis sam sems las byung ba gnyis lhan cig 'grogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible for two similar minds or mental factors to accompany each other.

original: re re nas gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //üîΩdge ba dang mi dge ba'am dge ba dang lung du ma bstan @88a * //
analyzed: re re nas gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do // dge ba dang mi dge ba'am dge ba dang lung du ma bstan @88a * //
translated: It is possible for each of them to accompany a dissimilar mind.

original: ba'am mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'am /
analyzed: ba'am mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'am /
translated: It is impossible for a wholesome and an unwholesome mind, or a wholesome and a neutral mind, or an unwholesome and a neutral mind,üîΩto accompany each other.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba'am rigs mi mthun pa gnyis dus gcig tu lhan cig tu 'grogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba'am rigs mi mthun pa gnyis dus gcig tu lhan cig tu 'grogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible for a pleasant and a painful feeling, or two dissimilar feelings, to accompany each other.

original: gang yang rung ba gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //üîΩ'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa gnyis lhan cig 'grogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do // 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa gnyis lhan cig 'grogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is possible for each of them to accompany a dissimilar feeling.üîΩIt is impossible for a desired and an undesired result to accompany each other.

original: gang yang rung ba de ni gnas yod de /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba de ni gnas yod de /
translated: It is possible for each of them to accompany a dissimilar result.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This is the classification of the modes of the second conception of the possible and the impossible.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la rnam par rtog pa gsum pa las brtsams nas rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la rnam par rtog pa gsum pa las brtsams nas rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of the modes of the third conception of the possible and the impossible?

original: smras pa / mo gsham las bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: smras pa / mo gsham las bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is said: It is impossible and never occurs that a barren woman gives birth.

original: mo gsham ma yin pa las gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: mo gsham ma yin pa las gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
translated: It is possible that a woman who is not barren gives birth.

original: skyes nas ma ning bu skyed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: skyes nas ma ning bu skyed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible and never occurs that a eunuch begets a child.

original: skyes ba gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: skyes ba gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
translated: It is possible that a man begets a child.

original: long bas mig gis gzugs rnams mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / 'on pas rna bas sgra rnams thos par 'gyur ba dang / sna rab tu nyams pas snas dri rnams tshor bar 'gyur ba dang / lce rab tu nyams pas lces ro rnams myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //üîΩrab tu ma nyams pas gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //üîΩtshogs ma bsags pas tshe 'di la slob pa dang mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba mngon du byed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: long bas mig gis gzugs rnams mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / 'on pas rna bas sgra rnams thos par 'gyur ba dang / sna rab tu nyams pas snas dri rnams tshor bar 'gyur ba dang / lce rab tu nyams pas lces ro rnams myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do // rab tu ma nyams pas gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do // tshogs ma bsags pas tshe 'di la slob pa dang mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba mngon du byed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is possible that one whose eyes, etc. are not defective should see visible forms, etc. with his eyes, etc.üîΩIt is impossible, it cannot be, that one who has not accumulated the equipment should realize the fruit of entering the stream, etc. in this very life.

original: tshogs bsags pas gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: tshogs bsags pas gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
translated: It is possible that one who has accumulated the equipment should realize the fruit of entering the stream, etc. in this very life.

original: 'phags pa'i lam ma thob pas mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam ma thob pas mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible, it cannot be, that one who has not attained the noble path will realize nirvana, or that one will realize individual enlightenment or supreme enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa'i lam thob pas gang yin pa @88b de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam thob pas gang yin pa @88b de ni gnas yod do //
translated: But it is possible that one who has attained the noble path will realize these.

original: mi dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba'i srog chags kyi kha zas rtsva la sogs pas dus ston byed par 'gyur ba dang / lha mi'i kham gyi zas dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems can kham gyi zas za bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: mi dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba'i srog chags kyi kha zas rtsva la sogs pas dus ston byed par 'gyur ba dang / lha mi'i kham gyi zas dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems can kham gyi zas za bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible, it cannot be, that a being born as an animal will celebrate a festival with grass and so on as food, or that a god or human will eat solid food, or that a being in the form or formless realms will eat solid food.

original: de las bzlog pas gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: de las bzlog pas gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
translated: But it is possible that one who is the opposite of these will do these things.

original: sems can dmyal ba pa'i lus ma spangs par mi'i lus 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du gang yang rung ba'i lus ma spangs par gang yang rung ba'i lus 'thob par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa'i lus ma spangs par mi'i lus 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du gang yang rung ba'i lus ma spangs par gang yang rung ba'i lus 'thob par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible, it cannot be, that a being in hell should obtain a human body without abandoning the body of a being in hell. And likewise, it is impossible that anyone should obtain any body whatsoever without abandoning any body whatsoever.

original: de las bzlog pa gang yin pa de ni gnas yod de /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa gang yin pa de ni gnas yod de /
translated: But it is possible that someone should obtain a human body after abandoning the body of a being in hell.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la rnam par rtog pa gsum pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la rnam par rtog pa gsum pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This is how the threefold discrimination of the possible and the impossible should be understood according to the third discrimination of the possible and the impossible.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the threefold discrimination of the possible and the impossible according to the fourth discrimination of the possible and the impossible?

original: smras pa / sas rang gi mtshan nyid spangs te khams gzhan gyi mtshan nyid la brten par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: smras pa / sas rang gi mtshan nyid spangs te khams gzhan gyi mtshan nyid la brten par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: He replied: ‚ÄúIt is impossible, it cannot happen that earth, having abandoned its own characteristics, would rely on the characteristics of another element.

original: de las bzlog pas gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do//
analyzed: de las bzlog pas gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do//
translated: It is possible, it can happen that earth, having abandoned its own characteristics, would rely on its own characteristics.

original: sa ji lta ba de bzhin du 'byung ba chen po gzhan dag kyang ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //üîΩ'dod pa'i khams su skyes shing byung ba lha'i mig ma thob pas lha'i gzugs dag mthong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: sa ji lta ba de bzhin du 'byung ba chen po gzhan dag kyang ci rigs par blta bar bya'o // 'dod pa'i khams su skyes shing byung ba lha'i mig ma thob pas lha'i gzugs dag mthong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: Just as with earth, so with the other great elements, as is appropriate in each case.üîΩIt is impossible, it cannot happen that one born and arisen in the desire realm, not having obtained the divine eye, would see divine forms.

original: mi'i gzugs dag mthong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: mi'i gzugs dag mthong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
translated: It is possible, it can happen that one born and arisen in the desire realm, not having obtained the divine eye, would see human forms.

original: de bzhin du dbang po lhag ma rnams kyis kyang ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po lhag ma rnams kyis kyang ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: So too, with the remaining faculties, as is appropriate in each case.‚Äù

original: brkam zhing chags pas zil gyis non pas chags pa de ma spangs par longs spyod rnams la 'dzin pa med pa'i sems su 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: brkam zhing chags pas zil gyis non pas chags pa de ma spangs par longs spyod rnams la 'dzin pa med pa'i sems su 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible and never occurs that one who is overcome by greed and attachment does not abandon that attachment and yet has a mind that is free from grasping with regard to enjoyments.

original: spangs pas gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: spangs pas gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
translated: It is possible that one who abandons that attachment has a mind that is free from grasping with regard to enjoyments.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang gti mug dag gis kyang ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //üîΩchags pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kun nas dkris pa las ma spangs par dran pa nye bar gzhag @89a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang gti mug dag gis kyang ci rigs par blta bar bya'o // chags pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kun nas dkris pa las ma spangs par dran pa nye bar gzhag @89a * //
translated: Similarly, one should understand anger and delusion in the appropriate manner.

original: pa bzhi sgom par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: pa bzhi sgom par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible and never occurs that one who has not abandoned the entanglements of the mental afflictions and the secondary mental afflictions such as greed and so on would develop the four close mindfulnesses.

original: spangs pas gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: spangs pas gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
translated: It is possible that one who has abandoned them would develop the four close mindfulnesses.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa gzhan dag kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa gzhan dag kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as with the four close mindfulnesses, the same should be understood for the other factors that contribute to enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang lhan cig rtsod par gyur pa rtsod par 'dod pa dang / 'gyod par 'dod pa'i sems ma spangs la /üîΩbzhed pa med par de bzhin gshegs pa mngon du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang lhan cig rtsod par gyur pa rtsod par 'dod pa dang / 'gyod par 'dod pa'i sems ma spangs la / bzhed pa med par de bzhin gshegs pa mngon du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible and there is no chance that one who has not abandoned the mind that wishes to dispute with the TathƒÅgata, who wishes to dispute and to regret, will come face to face with the TathƒÅgata without wishing to.

original: spangs pa'am bzhed pa gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do ;üîΩ/ thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs pas shes bya chung zad mi mkhyen par 'gyur ba'am bsnyel ngas pas thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i spyod pa mdzad par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: spangs pa'am bzhed pa gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do ; / thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs pas shes bya chung zad mi mkhyen par 'gyur ba'am bsnyel ngas pas thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i spyod pa mdzad par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible and there is no chance that one who has abandoned or wishes to abandon the mind that wishes to dispute with the TathƒÅgata, who wishes to dispute and to regret, will come face to face with the TathƒÅgata without wishing to.üîΩIt is impossible and there is no chance that the Omniscient One, the All-Seeing One, would not know a small object of knowledge, or that he would act in a way that is not omniscient due to forgetting.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin zhing thams cad gzigs pa ma yin pas gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin zhing thams cad gzigs pa ma yin pas gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
translated: It is possible that one who is not omniscient, who is not all-seeing, would not know a small object of knowledge, or that he would act in a way that is not omniscient due to forgetting.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sar chud par sems can rnams la bsam pas kun nas mnar sems kyi sems bskyed par 'gyur ba'am byang chub las phyir ldog par 'gyur ba gang yin pad  ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sar chud par sems can rnams la bsam pas kun nas mnar sems kyi sems bskyed par 'gyur ba'am byang chub las phyir ldog par 'gyur ba gang yin pad  ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible, it cannot be, that a bodhisattva who has entered the stages would arouse a thought of malice toward sentient beings or turn away from enlightenment.

original: sar chud pa ma yin pas gang yin pa de ni gnas yod de /üîΩde ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa las rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa las brtsams nas rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sar chud pa ma yin pas gang yin pa de ni gnas yod de / de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa las rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa las brtsams nas rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: But it is possible for one who has not entered the stages.üîΩThis is the classification of the four alternatives of the possible and the impossible in terms of the fourth alternative.

original: gzhan yang mdor bsdu na gnas bzhi dang gnas ma yin pa bzhi yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdor bsdu na gnas bzhi dang gnas ma yin pa bzhi yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, in brief, the possible and the impossible should be seen in terms of four possibilities and four impossibilities.

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang 'thad pas bsgrub pa'i rigs pa dang chos nyid kyi rigs pa sngar bstan pa'i rigs pa de dag dang mi 'gal bar ston pa gang yin pa de ni gnas yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang 'thad pas bsgrub pa'i rigs pa dang chos nyid kyi rigs pa sngar bstan pa'i rigs pa de dag dang mi 'gal bar ston pa gang yin pa de ni gnas yin no //
translated: That which is taught without contradicting those reasonings taught above‚Äîthe reasoning of dependence, the reasoning of efficacy, the reasoning of logical possibility, and the reasoning of nature‚Äîis tenable.

original: 'gal bar ston pa gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal bar ston pa gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin te /
translated: That which is taught in contradiction to those is not tenable.

original: gnas bzhi po de dag dang gnas ma yin pa bzhi po de dag bsdus na gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas bzhi po de dag dang gnas ma yin pa bzhi po de dag bsdus na gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: When those four tenable and those four untenable are combined, they become the eight skills of the tenable and the untenable.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between skill in dependent origination and skill in the tenable and the untenable?

original: @89b smras pa /
analyzed: @89b smras pa /
translated: It was said:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam du 'jug pa shes pas rab tu phye ba yin la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam du 'jug pa shes pas rab tu phye ba yin la /
translated: Skill in dependent origination is distinguished by the knowledge that engages merely cause and effect.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa ni de'i phyin ci ma log pa yin par shes pas rab tu phye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa ni de'i phyin ci ma log pa yin par shes pas rab tu phye ba ma yin no //
translated: The expertise in the possible and the impossible is not distinguished as the non-erroneous understanding of that.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i dngos po la mkhas pa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i dngos po la mkhas pa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo //
translated: The remaining topics of the treatise on expertise in the possible and the impossible do not appear here.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i dngos po la mkhas pa rdzogs so /üîΩ// / bam po bcu pa /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i dngos po la mkhas pa rdzogs so / // / bam po bcu pa /
translated: The expertise in the possible and the impossible is complete.

original: dbang po rnams kyi spyi sdom ni //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi spyi sdom ni //
translated: The general summary of the faculties is:

original: don dang rnam par gzhag pa dang // rab tu dbye ba tha ma yin //
analyzed: don dang rnam par gzhag pa dang // rab tu dbye ba tha ma yin //
translated: Meaning, presentation, and final classification.

original: dbang po'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the faculties?

original: smras pa / dbang po'i don ni dbang byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: smras pa / dbang po'i don ni dbang byed pa'i don to //
translated: It is said: The meaning of the faculties is the meaning of dominance.

original: ci zhig yongs su bstan par bya ba'i don du zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig yongs su bstan par bya ba'i don du zhe na /
translated: For the sake of teaching what?

original: smras pa / gzhi de dang de la chos de dang de dag gtso bor yongs su bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gzhi de dang de la chos de dang de dag gtso bor yongs su bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: It is said: For the sake of teaching that those phenomena are primary in that and that basis.

original: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis po de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis po de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of those twenty-two faculties?

original: smras pa / drug ni yul 'dzin pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / drug ni yul 'dzin pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: He replied: The six are established because they control the perception of objects.

original: gnyis ni rigs rgyud rnam par gzhag pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: gnyis ni rigs rgyud rnam par gzhag pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: The two are established because they control the classification of families.

original: gcig ni 'tsho ba'i don du las kyi mtha'i sbyor ba la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: gcig ni 'tsho ba'i don du las kyi mtha'i sbyor ba la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: The one is established because it controls the application of work for the sake of livelihood.

original: lnga ni las kyi 'bras bu la yongs su longs spyod pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: lnga ni las kyi 'bras bu la yongs su longs spyod pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: The five are established because they control the enjoyment of the results of action.

original: gzhan lnga ni 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: gzhan lnga ni 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: The other five are established because they control mundane purity.

original: gsum ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsum ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The three are established because they control supramundane purity.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang drug ni yul gsal ba la yongs su longs spyod pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang drug ni yul gsal ba la yongs su longs spyod pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Another enumeration: The six are established because they control the enjoyment of clear objects.

original: gnyis ni yul bsgribs pa la yongs su longs spyod pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: gnyis ni yul bsgribs pa la yongs su longs spyod pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: The two are established because they control the enjoyment of obscured objects.

original: gcig ni yul la yongs su longs spyod pa la mthar thug pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: gcig ni yul la yongs su longs spyod pa la mthar thug pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: One is the faculty of perfect knowledge, which is the faculty of mastery in the final stage of the enjoyment of objects.

original: lnga ni yul la longs spyod pa las byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: lnga ni yul la longs spyod pa las byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Five are the faculties of the enjoyment of objects, which are the faculties of mastery in the enjoyment of objects.

original: brgyad ni rnam par byad ba la dbang byed pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: brgyad ni rnam par byad ba la dbang byed pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Eight are the faculties of purification, which are the faculties of mastery in the purification of objects.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang drug ni yul la nang du lta bar yongs su longs spyod pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang drug ni yul la nang du lta bar yongs su longs spyod pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Another enumeration: Six are the faculties of the enjoyment of internal objects.

original: gnyis ni yul phyir bltas par yongs su longs spyod pa la @90a * //üîΩdbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: gnyis ni yul phyir bltas par yongs su longs spyod pa la @90a * // dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Two are the faculties of the enjoyment of external objects.

original: gcig ni lus la yongs su longs spyod pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: gcig ni lus la yongs su longs spyod pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: One is the faculty of the enjoyment of the body.

original: lnga ni yul dang lus la yongs su longs spyod pa las byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: lnga ni yul dang lus la yongs su longs spyod pa las byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Five are the faculties of the enjoyment of objects and the body, which are the faculties of mastery in the enjoyment of objects and the body.

original: brgyad ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po rnam par byang ba la dbang byed pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: brgyad ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po rnam par byang ba la dbang byed pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The other eight are established as the controlling faculties of purification, in the sense that they control the counteractives to the defilements.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang lnga ni lus mdzes pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //üîΩgcig ni lus la dbang bsgyur ba la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang lnga ni lus mdzes pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so // gcig ni lus la dbang bsgyur ba la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Again, there are five controlling faculties in the sense that they control the beauty of the body.üîΩOne controls the mastery of the body.

original: gcig ni lus gnas pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: gcig ni lus gnas pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: One controls the stability of the body.

original: gnyis ni lus skye ba la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: gnyis ni lus skye ba la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Two control the birth of the body.

original: lnga ni lus la phan pa dang gnod pa byed pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: lnga ni lus la phan pa dang gnod pa byed pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Five control the benefit and harm of the body.

original: brgyad ni lus rnam par grol bar byed pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: brgyad ni lus rnam par grol bar byed pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Eight are established as controlling faculties in the sense that they control the liberation of the body.

original: gzhan yang rnam grangs su drug ni sems can gyi dngos po yongs su bstan pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam grangs su drug ni sems can gyi dngos po yongs su bstan pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Again, there are six in the sense that they control the teaching of the entity of sentient beings.

original: gnyis ni sems can gyi dngos po skye ba la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: gnyis ni sems can gyi dngos po skye ba la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Two are the bases of power over the birth of sentient beings.

original: gcig ni sems can gyi dngos po gnas pa dang 'chi 'pho ba la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //üîΩlnga ni sems can gyi yul la yongs su longs spyod pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: gcig ni sems can gyi dngos po gnas pa dang 'chi 'pho ba la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so // lnga ni sems can gyi yul la yongs su longs spyod pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: One is the base of power over the duration and death of sentient beings.üîΩFive are the bases of power over the enjoyment of sentient beings.

original: gzhan lnga ni sems can gyi mngon par mtho ba'i thabs la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: gzhan lnga ni sems can gyi mngon par mtho ba'i thabs la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Five are the bases of power over the means of the higher realms of sentient beings.

original: gsum ni sems can gyi nges par legs pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsum ni sems can gyi nges par legs pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Three are the bases of power over the definite goodness of sentient beings.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang drug ni sems can gyi dngos po yongs su bstan pa la dbang byed pa'i don kho nas so //üîΩgnyis ni sems can 'phel ba la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang drug ni sems can gyi dngos po yongs su bstan pa la dbang byed pa'i don kho nas so // gnyis ni sems can 'phel ba la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Another enumeration: six are the bases of power over the manifestation of sentient beings.üîΩTwo are the bases of power over the increase of sentient beings.

original: gcig ni sems can 'grib pa la dbang byed pa'i yongs su bstan pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: gcig ni sems can 'grib pa la dbang byed pa'i yongs su bstan pa'i don gyis so //
translated: One is the base of power over the decrease of sentient beings.

original: lnga ni sems can gyi 'byor pa dang rgud pa yongs su bstan pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: lnga ni sems can gyi 'byor pa dang rgud pa yongs su bstan pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: The five are established as the bases of the power of knowledge of sentient beings‚Äô spiritual faculties, because they are the bases of the knowledge of sentient beings‚Äô spiritual faculties.

original: brgyad ni sems can gyi yon tan dang skyon yongs su bstan pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: brgyad ni sems can gyi yon tan dang skyon yongs su bstan pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The eight are established as the bases of the power of knowledge of the absorptions, liberations, and so on, because they are the bases of the knowledge of the absorptions, liberations, and so on.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang drug ni ming ni 'di zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas so //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang drug ni ming ni 'di zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas so //
translated: Another enumeration: The six are established as the bases of the power of knowledge of previous lives, because they are the bases of the knowledge of previous lives.

original: gnyis ni rigs @90b ni 'di zhes bya rus ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas so //
analyzed: gnyis ni rigs @90b ni 'di zhes bya rus ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas so //
translated: The two are established as the bases of the power of knowledge of death and rebirth, because they are the bases of the knowledge of death and rebirth.

original: lnga ni zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /üîΩbde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas so //
analyzed: lnga ni zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za / bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas so //
translated: The five are established as the bases of the power of knowledge of various dhƒÅtus, because they are the bases of the knowledge of various dhƒÅtus.

original: gcig ni che ring khyad ni 'di tsam zhig / yun ni 'di srid gcig gnas gnas /
analyzed: gcig ni che ring khyad ni 'di tsam zhig / yun ni 'di srid gcig gnas gnas /
translated: The one is established as the base of the power of knowledge of the supreme and the nonsupreme, because it is the base of the knowledge of the supreme and the nonsupreme.

original: tshe ni 'di tsam zhig thub ces bya ba'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: tshe ni 'di tsam zhig thub ces bya ba'i dbang du byas te /
translated: The one is established as the base of the power of knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants, because it is the base of the knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants.

original: dbang po de dag ni khyim pa'i phyogs la spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po de dag ni khyim pa'i phyogs la spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: These faculties should be regarded as being established in terms of the practice of the householder.üîΩThe eight faculties beginning with faith are established in terms of the practice of the renunciate.üîΩThe eight faculties beginning with faith are established in terms of the practice of the renunciate.üîΩThe eight faculties beginning with faith are established in terms of the practice of the renunciate.üîΩThe eight faculties beginning with faith are established in terms of the practice of the renunciate.

original: brgyad ni dad pa ni 'di lta bu zhig dang ldan pa brtson 'grus ni 'di lta bu zhig dang ldan zhes bya ba nas shes rab ni 'di lta bu dang ldan zhes bya ba'i bar dang 'di ltar ni zhugs pa yin no //üîΩ'di ltar ni 'bras bu la gnas pa yin zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas te dbang po de dag ni rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: brgyad ni dad pa ni 'di lta bu zhig dang ldan pa brtson 'grus ni 'di lta bu zhig dang ldan zhes bya ba nas shes rab ni 'di lta bu dang ldan zhes bya ba'i bar dang 'di ltar ni zhugs pa yin no // 'di ltar ni 'bras bu la gnas pa yin zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas te dbang po de dag ni rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The eight faculties beginning with faith are established in terms of the practice of the renunciate.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang drug ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang drug ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa la dbang byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: The eight faculties beginning with faith are established in terms of the practice of the renunciate.üîΩThe eight faculties beginning with faith are established in terms of the practice of
